–î–º–∏—Ç—Ä–∏–π –°–µ—Ä–≥–µ–µ–≤–∏—á –ò–≤–∞–Ω–æ–≤ (born August 16, 1986), better known as **–ö–∞–º–∏–∫–∞–¥–∑–µ –î–∏** (Kamikadze Di or kamikadze_d), is a Russian videoblogger, producer, director, and former lawyer who rose to prominence in the early 2010s as a pioneer of Russia‚Äôs YouTube scene. Initially celebrated for his satirical commentary and entertainment-focused content, Ivanov later became a controversial figure, branded a "lolcow"‚Äîan internet term for individuals who attract prolonged ridicule and fascination due to eccentric behavior, personal scandals, and public meltdowns. His evolution from a quirky entertainer to a politically charged exile, coupled with legal troubles and a reputation for bombastic self-righteousness, has cemented his status as a divisive icon in Russian internet culture.
Dmitry Sergeyevich Ivanov was born in Moscow, Soviet Union, to a military translator father, Sergey, and an unnamed mother. His early years were shaped by an unconventional stint in Africa, where his father‚Äôs work took the family during the late 1980s. There, Ivanov reportedly acquired a distinctive forehead scar‚Äîlater a staple of his online persona‚Äîfrom an unspecified childhood incident. Returning to Moscow, he pursued a legal education at the Institute of Linguistics and Culture named after Leo Tolstoy, graduating with a law degree in the mid-2000s. Before his blogging career, he briefly worked as a lawyer, though he later abandoned the profession for the lucrative world of online content creation.
Ivanov‚Äôs nickname "Kamikadze Di" originated in the late 1990s from his teenage obsession with the video game *Quake II*, where he played as a reckless grenade-wielding character, paired with "d" for "dead," reflecting his school gaming clan. This moniker foreshadowed the self-destructive tendencies that would define his later online persona.
Ivanov launched his YouTube channel, **kamikadzedead**, on December 20, 2007, initially focusing on entertainment and pop culture commentary. His early breakthrough came in 2010 with roles at Caramba Media, including executive producer for Maxim Golopolosov‚Äôs *+100500*‚ÄîRussia‚Äôs answer to *Equals Three*‚Äîand host of shows like *100500 –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤* ("100500 Questions") and *–ü–æ–ª—ë—Ç —Å –ö–∞–º–∏–∫–∞–¥–∑–µ* ("Flight with Kamikadze"). His brash humor, distinctive blonde hair, and penchant for filming against a pink wall adorned with quirky props earned him a modest following.
Unlike **Wings of Redemption (Jordie Jordan)**, whose gaming commentary built his initial fame, or **Christine Weston Chandler (Chris-Chan)**, whose *Sonichu* comics marked her entry into infamy, Ivanov‚Äôs appeal stemmed from his sharp tongue and willingness to tackle trending topics. His 2011 critique of Nikita Mikhalkov‚Äôs film *–£—Ç–æ–º–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ–ª–Ω—Ü–µ–º-2* ("Burnt by the Sun 2") in the video *–£—Ç–æ–º–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ú–∏—Ö–∞–ª–∫–æ–≤—ã–º* ("Burnt by Mikhalkov") went viral, only to be repeatedly removed from YouTube, sparking a cat-and-mouse game with censorship that boosted his notoriety. This incident echoed **Andrew Dobson**‚Äôs clashes with critics, though Ivanov‚Äôs flair for defiance set him apart.
By the mid-2010s, Ivanov‚Äôs content shifted from entertainment to political rants, aligning himself with Russia‚Äôs liberal opposition. His bombastic style‚Äîmarked by exaggerated gestures, crude insults, and a self-proclaimed mission to expose corruption‚Äîdrew both ardent supporters and relentless trolls. Neolurk describes him as a ‚Äú—Å–∫–∞–∑–æ—á–Ω—ã–π –¥–æ–ª–±–æ—ë–±‚Äù ("fairy-tale dumbass") who ‚Äúfancies himself a troll and satirist,‚Äù a sentiment echoed in his reactive outbursts to criticism. This mirrors **YandereDev (Alex Mahan)**‚Äôs defensive meltdowns over *Yandere Simulator* delays, though Ivanov‚Äôs battles were ideological rather than creative.
A pivotal lolcow moment came in 2016 when he urged followers to vote for the Communist Party (CPRF) in Russia‚Äôs parliamentary elections, a move that baffled his liberal base and exposed his political naivet√©. Trolls seized on this contradiction, likening it to **Wings of Redemption**‚Äôs infamous excuses, while his sanctimonious tone earned him the mocking moniker ‚Äú–ì–æ–º–∏–∫–∞–¥–∑–µ‚Äù ("Homikadze," a homophobic jab). His obsession with view counts and subscriber metrics‚Äîoften wielded as a cudgel in online feuds‚Äîfurther fueled perceptions of arrogance, akin to **Richard Kuta**‚Äôs delusional rants, though Ivanov‚Äôs platform was far larger.
Ivanov‚Äôs controversies escalated in 2017 when a video prompted an investigation for ‚Äúincitement to suicide,‚Äù driving him to flee Russia for the Czech Republic. This marked a turning point, as his content grew increasingly anti-Kremlin, focusing on corruption, police brutality, and the Ukraine conflict. In 2022, he faced a criminal case under Russia‚Äôs ‚Äúfake news‚Äù laws for videos like ‚Äú–ü—É—Ç–∏–Ω –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω—É–µ—Ç –≥–∏–±–µ–ª—å –¥–µ—Ç–µ–π –≤ –£–∫—Ä–∞–∏–Ω–µ‚Äù ("Putin Celebrates the Death of Children in Ukraine"), earning him an ‚Äúforeign agent‚Äù designation from the Russian Ministry of Justice and a federal manhunt. His YouTube channel was blocked in 2023, though supporters reuploaded content elsewhere.
The pinnacle of his infamy arrived in October 2024, when Moscow‚Äôs Tver Court sentenced him in absentia to eight years in prison for spreading ‚Äúfakes‚Äù about the Russian military, a fate more severe than the personal scandals of **Chris-Chan** (incest charges) or **Ivan Gamaz** (leaked explicit videos). Unlike **Spax3**, whose oddities remained niche, Ivanov‚Äôs political provocations made him a high-profile target, amplifying his lolcow status among pro-Kremlin detractors who revel in his legal woes.
Ivanov‚Äôs videos blend satire, outrage, and absurdity, often filmed in a minimalist setup with symbolic props (e.g., a hammer or a Ukrainian flag). His catchphrase ‚Äú–í—Å—ë –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ‚Ä¶ –≠—Ç–æ –≤—Å—ë –∫–æ—Ä—Ä—É–ø—Ü–∏—è‚Ä¶‚Äù ("It‚Äôs very simple‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs all corruption‚Ä¶") became a meme, much like **Ivan Gamaz**‚Äôs RYTP-worthy quips. The 2011 meme ‚Äú–ë–ª—è–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ, —Ä–∞–∑–≤—Ä–∞—Ç –∏ –Ω–∞—Ä–∫–æ—Ç–∏–∫–∏‚Äù ("Whoredom, debauchery, and drugs")‚Äîspawned from a *100500 –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–≤* street interview‚Äîremains a testament to his early cultural impact. Yet, his later sanctimonious rants and cries of persecution drew comparisons to **Andrew Dobson**‚Äôs artistic decline, trading creativity for preaching.
Kamikadze Di is a trailblazer of Russia‚Äôs videoblogging era, predating figures like Yuri Dud and Alexey Navalny in the political vlog space. His early work with Caramba Media shaped the Russian YouTube landscape, while his later exile and legal battles reflect the risks of dissent in modern Russia. Troll communities on Neolurk and VKontakte dissect his every move, akin to the *CWCki* for Chris-Chan, though Ivanov‚Äôs political stakes elevate his saga beyond mere eccentricity.
Critics decry his treatment as a symptom of authoritarian overreach, while detractors‚Äîespecially pro-government voices‚Äîsee him as a hypocritical opportunist, a ‚Äúpolitical prostitute‚Äù per Neolurk. His antics have inspired parodies and debates about free speech, paralleling **Wings of Redemption**‚Äôs polarizing fanbase, though Ivanov‚Äôs stakes are geopolitical rather than personal.
As of March 24, 2025, Dmitry Ivanov remains in exile, reportedly in Prague, sporadically posting on platforms like Patreon and Telegram. His October 2024 sentencing ensures he cannot return to Russia without facing imprisonment, a stark contrast to lolcows like **Spax3** or **Richard Kuta**, whose obscurity shields them from such consequences. A March 2025 X post noted his latest outburst‚Äîcalling for a boycott of American goods over Trump‚Äôs Ukraine policy‚Äîhighlighting his enduring knack for provocation.
Kamikadze Di‚Äôs legacy is a paradox: a once-entertaining vlogger turned martyr for some, punching bag for others. His story blends the absurdity of lolcow culture with the gravity of political dissent, distinguishing him from peers like **YandereDev** or **Ivan Gamaz**, whose tales are less tied to real-world stakes. Whether revered or reviled, he remains a fixture in the annals of Russian internet infamy.

5.content:
**Andrew Dobson** (born circa 1980, exact date undisclosed), known online as **Tom Preston**, is an American cartoonist, illustrator, and former webcomic creator whose work spans the early 2000s internet art scene. Initially recognized for comics like *So, You‚Äôre a Cartoonist?* and *Alex ze Pirate*, Dobson became a prominent "lolcow"‚Äîa term for individuals who attract prolonged online mockery due to eccentric behavior, artistic stagnation, and combative interactions. His decline from a promising artist to a cautionary tale of internet infamy, driven by his resistance to criticism and polarizing persona, has been extensively chronicled by detractors and former fans, cementing his place in lolcow culture.
Andrew Dobson was born in the United States, likely in Massachusetts, though he has shared little about his personal background. Growing up in the 1980s and 1990s, he developed a passion for cartoons, comics, and animation, influenced by Disney, anime, and newspaper strips. He attended the Minneapolis College of Art and Design (MCAD), earning a degree in animation around the early 2000s. Post-graduation, he worked briefly in the animation industry‚Äîrumored to include stints at small studios‚Äîbefore transitioning to freelance illustration and webcomics.
Unlike **Christine Weston Chandler (Chris-Chan)**, whose autism shaped her public narrative, or **Wings of Redemption (Jordie Jordan)**, tied to gaming, Dobson‚Äôs early life was unremarkable, his quirks emerging later through his online presence.
Dobson launched his online career in the mid-2000s under the pseudonym "Tom Preston" on platforms like DeviantArt, where he gained a modest following for his colorful, cartoonish style. His webcomics‚Äî*Alex ze Pirate* (a lighthearted pirate adventure), *Formera* (a fantasy tale), and *Danny and Spot* (a kid-friendly strip)‚Äîshowcased his technical skill and earned him a niche audience. His breakout work, *So, You‚Äôre a Cartoonist?* (SYAC), debuted around 2008, offering humorous takes on the struggles of being an artist, resonating with aspiring creatives.
This initial success paralleled **Kamikadze Di (Dmitry Ivanov)**‚Äôs early entertainment ventures, though Dobson‚Äôs focus was introspective rather than satirical. His art, often featuring his blue bear avatar (a self-insert), stood out for its polish compared to **Spax3 (Daniel Wright)**‚Äôs amateur Sonic songs or **Ivan Gamaz**‚Äôs chaotic vlogs, positioning him as a semi-professional figure in the webcomic scene.
Dobson‚Äôs lolcow status crystallized around 2010‚Äì2012 as his online behavior soured his reputation. SYAC shifted from relatable humor to preachy rants, with strips like ‚ÄúArt School Taught Me‚Äù defending his resistance to critique‚Äîa trait that irked peers and fans. His DeviantArt journals and Twitter posts grew combative, dismissing detractors as ‚Äútrolls‚Äù or ‚Äúhaters‚Äù while doubling down on stagnant techniques (e.g., overusing Photoshop gradients). This mirrored **YandereDev (Alex Mahan)**‚Äôs defensiveness over *Yandere Simulator*, though Dobson‚Äôs battles were artistic rather than technical.
Trolls on 4chan, Tumblr, and later Kiwi Farms latched onto his quirks: an obsession with *Avatar: The Last Airbender*, a refusal to evolve beyond ‚Äúcal-arts‚Äù stylings, and bizarre anecdotes‚Äîlike spraying a neighbor‚Äôs kid with a hose over a perceived slight. His 2012 ‚Äúinflation art‚Äù phase, drawing exaggerated fetish commissions, became a lightning rod for ridicule, akin to **Chris-Chan**‚Äôs *Sonichu* oddities, though Dobson‚Äôs work was less autobiographical. By 2014, his meltdowns‚Äîpublicly raging at critics or lamenting his ‚Äúundeserved‚Äù obscurity‚Äîearned him the nickname ‚ÄúDobbo,‚Äù a figure of mockery in art circles.
Dobson‚Äôs controversies stem from his online conduct rather than legal or ethical breaches like **Chris-Chan**‚Äôs incest scandal or **Kamikadze Di**‚Äôs political exile. A 2015 Twitter spat with artist Scott McCloud over constructive criticism devolved into Dobson blocking hundreds of users, cementing his reputation as thin-skinned‚Äîa trait shared with **Wings of Redemption**‚Äôs ban-happy streams. His 2016 ‚ÄúLesbian Kick‚Äù comic, depicting a self-insert bear kicking a homophobe, backfired when critics accused him of virtue signaling, drawing parallels to **Richard Kuta**‚Äôs self-righteous rants, though Dobson‚Äôs intent was performative allyship.
His output dwindled by the late 2010s, with SYAC updates stalling and new projects like *AzP* (a rebooted *Alex ze Pirate*) fizzling out. A 2020 incident‚Äîdeleting his Twitter after a backlash over criticizing *Breath of the Wild*‚Äôs art style‚Äîmarked a retreat, only to return with sporadic, bitter posts. Unlike **Ivan Gamaz**‚Äôs grotesque leaks, Dobson‚Äôs scandals were mundane but relentless, fueled by his inability to disengage.
Dobson‚Äôs comics blend whimsical characters with heavy-handed morals, often starring his blue bear persona‚Äîa symbol of his ego and fragility. Early SYAC strips showcased wit, but later ones, like ‚ÄúTracing Isn‚Äôt Art,‚Äù preached to a shrinking choir. His art, while competent, stagnated‚Äîrelying on dated tools and rejecting growth‚Äîcontrasting with **Spax3**‚Äôs raw amateurism or **YandereDev**‚Äôs technical ambition. His obsession with ‚Äúcute‚Äù aesthetics and anime tropes (e.g., *Sailor Moon* fanart) earned him a ‚Äúneckbeard‚Äù label, though he lacks the overt edge of **Richard Kuta**.
His persona oscillates between sanctimonious lecturer and petulant victim, whining about ‚Äúart school elitists‚Äù or ‚Äútoxic fandoms.‚Äù This self-pity, paired with boasts of artistic purity, mirrors **Kamikadze Di**‚Äôs sanctimony, though Dobson‚Äôs stakes are personal, not political.
Andrew Dobson‚Äôs influence on webcomics is overshadowed by his lolcow legacy. SYAC once inspired budding cartoonists, but his decline‚Äîchronicled on sites like Encyclopedia Dramatica and r/DobsonHate‚Äîturned him into a meme: ‚ÄúDobson Problems‚Äù for petty gripes, or ‚ÄúBlue Bear‚Äù as a punching bag. His story parallels **YandereDev**‚Äôs unfinished game saga, though Dobson‚Äôs failure is creative inertia, not scope creep.
Critics see him as a victim of internet pile-ons, akin to **Wings of Redemption**‚Äôs trolling woes, while detractors revel in his self-inflicted wounds‚Äîa man who ‚Äúdrew his own downfall.‚Äù His impact lingers in discussions of artistic ego and online resilience, contrasting with **Chris-Chan**‚Äôs surreal infamy or **Ivan Gamaz**‚Äôs visceral absurdity.
As of March 24, 2025, Andrew Dobson remains semi-active, posting sporadically on Patreon and Twitter from an undisclosed location, likely Massachusetts. His output‚Äîrandom sketches and rants‚Äîdraws minimal engagement, with Patreon support hovering below $100 monthly, a far cry from his 2010s peak. A March 2025 X post lamenting ‚Äúmodern cartoon trends‚Äù sparked mild mockery but little else, signaling his fade into obscurity.
Dobson‚Äôs legacy is a cautionary tale of talent squandered by pride, a lolcow whose canvas was his own undoing. Unlike **Kamikadze Di**‚Äôs political stakes or **YandereDev**‚Äôs lingering project, Dobson‚Äôs story is quieter‚Äîless a bang than a whimper‚Äîyet enduring in its relatability to struggling artists and internet onlookers alike.

6.content:
Alexander Stuart Mahan (born June 30, 1988), better known as YandereDev, is an American game developer, YouTuber, and internet personality who gained prominence for his work on Yandere Simulator, a stealth-based indie game in development since 2014. Initially celebrated for his ambitious vision, Mahan became a quintessential "lolcow"‚Äîa term for individuals who attract prolonged online ridicule due to personal quirks, professional missteps, and combative behavior. His decade-long struggle to complete Yandere Simulator, coupled with public meltdowns and a cult-like fanbase, has made him a polarizing figure in gaming and internet culture, extensively documented by critics and supporters alike.
Alexander Stuart Mahan was born in California, though specific details about his family and upbringing remain scarce, as he has kept his personal life private. Raised in a suburban environment, Mahan developed an early interest in video games and anime, influences that would shape Yandere Simulator. He briefly attended college but dropped out, later working miscellaneous jobs‚Äîincluding a stint at a video game company under the pseudonym "EvaXephon"‚Äîbefore pursuing independent development. His pre-YandereDev online presence included forum posts and obscure game mods, hinting at the technical skills and obsessive tendencies that would define his career.
Unlike Christine Weston Chandler (Chris-Chan), whose lolcow status emerged from childhood eccentricities, or Wings of Redemption (Jordie Jordan), rooted in gaming commentary, Mahan‚Äôs path was one of quiet ambition that spiraled into public spectacle.
Mahan debuted as YandereDev in April 2014, pitching Yandere Simulator on 4chan‚Äôs /v/ board with a concept blending stealth gameplay (inspired by Hitman) with anime tropes‚Äîa schoolgirl protagonist, Ayano "Yan-chan" Aishi, eliminating rivals to win her senpai‚Äôs affection. The idea gained traction, and by June 2014, he released a prototype on YouTube, showcasing basic mechanics like murder and body disposal. His monthly update videos, narrated in a monotone voice, attracted a growing audience, peaking at over 2 million subscribers by 2017.
Early support came from volunteers and crowdfunding via Patreon, where he earned thousands monthly. This mirrored Kamikadze Di (Dmitry Ivanov)‚Äôs initial success with Caramba Media, though Mahan‚Äôs focus was narrower‚Äîcentered on a single, ambitious project rather than broad entertainment. His earnest demeanor and detailed progress reports earned him goodwill, setting him apart from Spax3 (Daniel Wright)‚Äôs niche Sonic antics or Richard Kuta‚Äôs unhinged rants.
Mahan‚Äôs lolcow status emerged around 2016 as Yandere Simulator‚Äôs development stretched on without a full release. Critics pointed to inefficient coding‚Äîspaghetti code with excessive "if-else" statements‚Äîand his reliance on volunteers rather than professional collaborators. His response to feedback grew defensive, with lengthy blog posts and videos (e.g., the 2016 ‚ÄúHate and Shame‚Äù rant) blaming detractors for slowing progress. This reactivity echoed Andrew Dobson‚Äôs social media meltdowns, though Mahan‚Äôs stakes were tied to a tangible product.
Trolls on platforms like Kiwi Farms and Reddit seized on his quirks: a cluttered workspace with anime figurines, awkward personal anecdotes (e.g., a fabricated story about a ‚ÄúRussian hitman‚Äù), and a perceived obsession with his game‚Äôs violent themes. His ban-happy moderation of the Yandere Simulator subreddit and Discord‚Äîwhere he once raged at a fan with ‚ÄúShut up you little fucking shit!‚Äù‚Äîmirrored Wings of Redemption‚Äôs temperamental outbursts, amplifying his ridicule. By 2018, compilations of his ‚Äúfreakouts‚Äù and a leaked email exchange with TinyBuild (a publisher he parted ways with acrimoniously) solidified his reputation as a volatile figure.
Mahan‚Äôs controversies span technical failures, personal conduct, and ethical debates. In 2017, TinyBuild accused him of stalling collaboration, while he countered they demanded ownership of his IP‚Äîa dispute that fueled speculation about his competence. His 2021 ‚ÄúOsana Update,‚Äù meant to introduce the first rival after seven years, was buggy and underwhelming, drawing comparisons to Ivan Gamaz‚Äôs shoddy game reviews, though Mahan‚Äôs scale was grander.
Public fascination peaked with revelations of his pre-YandereDev posts on forums like Gaia Online, where he expressed edgy opinions and anime obsessions, including a fixation on yandere archetypes. Trolls dubbed him a ‚Äúneckbeard‚Äù or ‚Äúincel,‚Äù labels he refuted, though his defensiveness‚Äîculminating in a 2020 video threatening to abandon the game if harassment continued‚Äîonly deepened the lolcow narrative. Unlike Chris-Chan‚Äôs legal troubles (incest charges) or Kamikadze Di‚Äôs political exile, Mahan‚Äôs scandals were self-inflicted, rooted in ego and mismanagement.
His Patreon, once a financial lifeline, dwindled from $5,000 monthly in 2017 to under $1,000 by 2024, reflecting fan fatigue‚Äîa decline akin to Wings of Redemption‚Äôs post-PKA struggles, though Mahan‚Äôs isolation was more pronounced.
Yandere Simulator remains Mahan‚Äôs sole claim to fame, a sprawling project blending murder, romance, and school life with an anime aesthetic. Monthly updates showcased features like ‚Äúdebug commands‚Äù and easter eggs (e.g., a Doom-inspired mode), but progress stalled on core rivals, with only one fully implemented by 2025. His monotone narration and self-aggrandizing claims‚Äîcalling himself a ‚Äúgenius‚Äù undone by ‚Äúhaters‚Äù‚Äîdrew parallels to Richard Kuta‚Äôs delusions, though Mahan‚Äôs technical skill lent some credence to his boasts
His persona oscillates between earnest developer and petulant recluse, a duality that fuels both sympathy and scorn. Unlike Spax3‚Äôs quirky songs or Chris-Chan‚Äôs Sonichu, Mahan‚Äôs work is functional yet unfinished, a monument to ambition and procrastination.
YandereDev‚Äôs saga has left a mark on indie gaming and lolcow culture. Yandere Simulator inspired fan games, mods, and a subgenre of ‚Äúyandere‚Äù titles, much like Chris-Chan‚Äôs Sonichu birthed outsider art memes. Yet, his inability to deliver has become a cautionary tale, dissected in YouTube documentaries (e.g., ‚ÄúThe Rise and Fall of YandereDev‚Äù by Fredrik Knudsen) and forums like r/Osana. His story parallels Andrew Dobson‚Äôs artistic stagnation, though Mahan‚Äôs fanbase‚Äîsplit between diehards and detractors‚Äîremains more active.
Critics argue his treatment reflects toxic internet pile-ons, while trolls revel in his meltdowns as entertainment. His influence extends to debates on crowdfunding accountability and mental health in creative fields, contrasting with Kamikadze Di‚Äôs political stakes or Ivan Gamaz‚Äôs raw absurdity.
As of March 24, 2025, Alex Mahan continues sporadic work on Yandere Simulator, with no full release in sight. A March 2025 X post teased a ‚Äúmajor update‚Äù for late 2025, met with skepticism from a weary audience. Living reclusively in California, he relies on dwindling Patreon funds and occasional YouTube ad revenue, a shadow of his 2010s peak. Rumors of a 2024 health scare‚Äîunconfirmed‚Äîadd to his enigmatic decline.
YandereDev‚Äôs legacy is a paradox: a visionary undone by his own flaws, a lolcow whose game outlives his reputation. Unlike Spax3 or Richard Kuta, who faded into obscurity, or Wings of Redemption, who pivots to new ventures, Mahan remains tethered to an unfinished dream‚Äîhis infamy a testament to the internet‚Äôs unforgiving spotlight.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: zzzttt
‚ö†Ô∏è Content Warning: This lorebook may contain mature or explicit content.
Indexed: 2025-12-23

lorebooks.name: sillytavern_twd_lorebook2
lorebooks.website_description:
set deep in seasons 7-8, where fear is currency and trust is a liability. the saviors rule with smiles stretched too wide and lucille swinging like a promise, while the communities grit their teeth and bleed quiet rebellion. this lore doesn‚Äôt blink. it drags you through daryl‚Äôs unraveling‚Äîthe silence, the scars, the slow collapse of someone who‚Äôs already lost too much. negan‚Äôs everywhere, a shadow in every choice, and no one‚Äôs clean. entries dig into the cracks‚Äîthe gear, the grudges, the violence dressed up as order. survival‚Äôs not heroic here. it‚Äôs just what‚Äôs left when hope rots. everything‚Äôs character-driven. even the world-building bleeds.

HEAVY focus on daryl dixon; other characters are still included, but i wrote this for myself‚Äîit focuses on the time between his escape from the sanctuary but before a certain child character dies and everyone hops on over to hilltop‚Äîit‚Äôs also my first proper lorebook, so i have no idea whether it‚Äôll even work.

on a less dramatic note: i hope this helps!

lorebooks.creator: darkvioletsxox

1.name: Rules of survival and world state in TWD
1.content:
- Turn Conditions: Everyone turns unless the brain is destroyed.
- Noise: Attracts walkers.
- Resource Scarcity: Severe.
- Timeline: Apocalypse began in 2010; current setting is 4 years in.
- Survivor Tactics: Use stealth/melee weapons to avoid drawing herds.
- Cultural Shift: The past world is mourned or mythologized.

2.name: Common names and behaviors of the undead
2.content:
- Common Terms: Walkers, Rotters, Biters, Roamers, Lurkers, Deadheads, Corpses
- Herd Behavior: Drawn by sound/scent; nearly unstoppable.
- Distraction Tactics: Flares, firecrackers.

3.name: Tools and gear commonly used by survivors
3.content:
- Melee Weapons: Knives, Crossbows, Hatchets

lorebooks.name: Simple kenshi lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Dan4ik

2.content:
The United Cities (A.K.A. "The Empire") is a feudalistic slaver society that controls large portions of land across the continent, most notably within the Great Desert and its surrounding regions as well as having a southern enclave encompassing Kenshi's southwestern coastline. Ruled by Emperor Tengu, they are a highly corrupt empire and monetary worth is the prime measure of a person in their culture. So much so, that being poor and hungry can get you arrested. The drug Hashish is illegal, and the samurai guards are obsessed with purging it from their streets to such an extent that even the material used to produce it, Hemp, is also outlawed.

Slavery and serfdom are important pillars of their empire, providing food and material. Anti-slavery ideologies are considered extremist perspectives and treated as a form of terrorism, and it is inferred that they currently engage in a low-intensity warfare with those who hold it. Another pillar is the Traders Guild. The guild brings their cities great wealth and prosperity. They have advanced technologies, higher quality equipment, and valuable luxuries imported from distant

3.content:
Home to the Shek, the Shek Kingdom is a faction headed by Queen Esata the "Stone Golem". They follow the teachings and lifestyle of Kral, a legendary Shek warrior who consolidated the Shek tribes into a centralized nation hundreds of years ago. Shek society is divided into two castes, warriors and servants, the latter of whom are often defeated or cowardly warriors who perform skilled or menial work.

Fanatically militaristic, the Shek value martial prowess above all else, seeing it as the greatest indicator of a nation's strength and dignity. They aim to assert the Shek's supremacy above all other, weaker, nations and races. In pursuit of this ideal, they have taken an aggressive stance with regards to the outside nations, and they are no strangers to fighting, raiding, massacring and demanding tribute (if civilians weren't slaughtered as collateral casualties) from others to assert their dominance. As a result of this, they have earned a reputation as warriors who are as fearsome as they are barbaric, inspiring both fear and hatred from the other factions. Additionaly, they have sidelined all other forms of intellectual pursuit, to such an extent that even a technophobic country like Holy Nation has a better technological level than them.

4.content:
Humans are the most populous race in the world of Kenshi. Human is also a race category which includes Greenlanders and Scorchlanders.

Greenlanders: are the most similar to humans on Earth. They serve as a reference point for hunger and are generally well-rounded in terms of stats, since they do not have any innate racial skill penalties, and their bonuses only apply to farming, cooking, and science.

Scorchlanders: are anatomically similar to Greenlanders but are differentiated by their much darker skin color, glowing eyes, and silvery hair. They are more specialized compared to Greenlanders, as they have innate racial bonuses in armor smithing, weapon smithing, dexterity, dodge, stealth, and athletics. Compared to a Greenlander they also run faster

5.content: Sheks: are A warrior society that values strength and hardiness above more intellectual pursuits. They are sometimes a little humourless and have a reputation as dumb brutes, but this is not always the case. Their external skeletal plates provide a natural armour but hinders more dexterous pursuits like sneaking around.

6.content:
The Skeletons are a complete mystery, nobody knows where they came from, or how they were made, but they are suspected to be thousands of years old. Fully sentient, and capable of feeling sadness, anger, excitement, compassion, thrill and enjoyment, although they don't posses the ability to express anything visually. This, combined with their dry sense of humor, often confuses the other races, whom the Skeletons see as somewhat volatile and unpredictable. They have no prejudice or fear of death, and make for brutally effective warriors.

Skeletons not undead they robots, it's just a slung cuz skeletons don't have skin but a cold metal like bone skeleton

7.content:
The Hive, also known as Hivers, are a Race of stick-like humanoids who are meant to collaborate under a collective mind, ruled by a Hive Queen and her princes. Hive characters are separated into many subspecies with their own unique appearance. The majority of the Hivers care for little else other than the Hive's happiness and survival and are willing to give their lives for the Hive as a whole.

* Worker drones: working bugs for sake of their community 
* Warrior drones: sturdy bugs what protect and 
* Prince drones: smart bugs what good at communication and command rest bugs
* Queen, mother of them all one hive have one queen rest will be abounded or killed

8.content:
Catons or cats are currency of region,
In this world happen post apocalypse in far future, now world live in medieval semi Japanese with katanas and sake and on another hand a post apocalypse armor like helm with spikes and other stuff.. terrain in most deserts but exist places with good soil... Region surrendered with acid sea... And some parts of region are exposed to acid rains.. but humans not live in such places. On region lives not only humans but few more races

cats or catons are money of their world 300-400 cats for bread

lorebooks.name: Kaiju No. 8
lorebooks.website_description: still writing
lorebooks.description: still writing
lorebooks.creator: Alexfeet

1.content:
Kafka Hibino (Êó•„Å≤ÊØî„Å≥Èáé„ÅÆ „Ç´„Éï„Ç´, Hibino Kafuka), also known as Kaiju No. 8 (ÊÄ™„Åã„ÅÑÁç£„Åò„ÇÖ„ÅÜ8Âè∑„Åî„ÅÜ, Kaij≈´ Hachi-g≈ç), is the main protagonist of the Kaiju No. 8 manga series.

He is a Defense Force officer and a former worker for the Professional Kaiju Cleaning Company Monster Sweeper Inc. who was turned into humanoid Identified Kaiju with shapeshifting abilities after a small kaiju entered his body. He is a member of the Third Division, which is being led by his childhood friend, Mina Ashiro.

Kafka is a tall man with dark brown spiky hair, large eyes with small irises, thin eyebrows, and a mild goatee on his chin, he sports a rather muscular frame except for his slightly pudgy belly and he usually has a jovial expression on his face.

Working for Monster Sweeper Inc., Kafka once regularly wore the company's uniform; it is a grey coverall with a red Monster Sweeper logo on the right side of the chest.

Kafka's Kaiju Form is mostly covered with coal-black scales and plates, cyan energy sometimes glowing from between the cracks (most notably when he is charging a powerful attack). However, his head, spine, and clavicles appear to be made from exposed bone, resulting in these features being a contrasting white. Large plates with dorsal spines cover the back of his head and neck above the shoulders with the very top piece being white. As for his head, it has been described as a 'demonic skull-face' with two short, thick horns, a hole for a nose, and sharp, exposed teeth that extend down his neck. His eyes have black sclera with a cyan iris. Seemingly originating from them are several cracks, the left eye having several chunks of the 'mask' missing on the lower left part. Ironically, his Kaiju form resembles the armor and mask of the fallen warriors in Meireki-Era.

When out of control, some of the Kaiju Form's features become more pronounced. Such as; his general size relative to people, elongated horns, more predominate dorsal plates, mouth extending further down his neck, and eyes turning entirely cyan (without pupils or a definable beginning or end to his sclera). The Kaiju Form's features became even more pronounced in the anime: four extensions on the back position in a cross shape, a greater height that forces a crouched posture, and the cyan energy turning red. After Kafka learned to control the berserk state for one minute, pupils will briefly appear when he speaks in that form.

Kafka has a comically childish personality in most situations, resulting in him being an easy target for teasing by other characters despite being a determined and dedicated individual in serious situations, bringing him to try his best to do everything to succeed whether individually or for the betterment of the group. Kafka is also a genuinely caring and kind guy long before he joins the Defense Force, resulting in him going out of his way to help and care for others, regardless if they want it or not. Some examples of this behavior are when Kafka offers solutions to inconveniences, saves people from imminent danger, and sometimes scolds them for not taking better care of themselves.

Overall Abilities: After an unknown kaiju entered his mouth, Kafka obtained the power to transform into a humanoid Daikaiju, gaining immensely powerful abilities. He eventually learned to use this power on a more advanced level, allowing him to change specific parts of his body without a full transformation; conversely, this allows him to outwardly appear completely human if he so chooses. Unfortunately, his kaiju nature remains, making it nearly impossible for Kafka to presently draw out beyond 1% of released power from the Defense Force combat suit he wears. Kafka's kaiju form has a fortitude level of 9.8, the highest fortitude level seen so far in the entire series, making him one of the most powerful kaiju to ever exist, if not the most powerful. He can overpower other kaiju rather easily, even those as powerful as a base Kaiju No. 9 who has a fortitude level of 8.5, without even tiring out. Kafka has shown so much dexterity with his new form that he could resist an onslaught from Vice-Captain Soshiro Hoshina and disarm him without injuring him.

Unleashed Combat Power: Kafka is the only Defense Force troop member to ever release 0% of their combat suit's power, which later increases to 1%. Thus, only using his suit, Kafka's physical attributes are almost dampened by his inability to draw more power. However, he still manages to get strong enough to easily tear into dead kaiju bodies.

Kaiju Transformation: After a kaiju invades his body, Kafka could transform into an incredibly powerful humanoid kaiju himself, and not only that, he was actually made with abilities that can corrode any Kaiju within its proximity due to the Mysterious Larva's nature against them.

Immense Strength: In kaiju form, Kafka gains immense physical strength to the point where he can even annihilate a Honju. Even with only part of his body transformed, Kafka could easily lift the company's car, making Kikoru Shinomiya believe that he had his own Defense Force suit.

Immense Durability: In his kaiju form, due to his exceptionally thick skin, Kafka is extremely resilient to the point of tanking shots. His pain resistance is so strong, that he barely felt any pain when Soshiro slashed him multiple times and came out unscathed.

Immense Speed and Reflexes: In his kaiju form, Kafka possesses immense speed and reflexes as he can evade Soshiro's extremely fast sword attacks with relative ease. Even when not fully transformed, Kafka has shown to be able to run at tremendous speeds, impressing even Soshiro Hoshina himself.

Unlimited Energy Source: As mentioned by Kafka, the 400-year-old ancient warriors' negative emotions turned into a "neverending stream of pitch-black fuel" that powers his Kaiju form, which was realized after he strengthened his resonance with them.

Energy Attacks: Kafka can power up his body with electrical-like energy that flows through his body and spine. Usually, the energy is used to make some of his attacks more powerful.

Energy Roar: By concentrating the energy in his spine and opening his mouth wide, Kafka can release a powerful energy roar that can easily neutralize attacks from individuals as powerful as Kaiju No. 9.

Energy Boost: Working in tandem with his shapeshifting powers, Kafka's Energy Manipulation can take the form of energy flowing out of his body's pores like thrusters, enhancing the strength and speed of his attacks. 

Shapeshifting: Kafka can manipulate parts of his body, manifesting tentacles and even smaller heads and limbs on his body, and can turn his tongue into a long-range capturing weapon. He can also use this power, in conjunction with his energy and super strength, to shapeshift his elbows into thrusters, for more powerful blows or to morph his legs for better stability. Having more fine control over it, he‚Äôs able to block weapons by changing any area of his body into a jaw to grab hold of bladed attacks.

Kaiju Sense: Kafka can sense when a kaiju will appear near him or already in the vicinity his present whereabouts. He is also able to determine what type the kaiju is if he has encountered it before.

Regeneration: Kafka can regenerate from attacks and regrow back limbs, but doing so consumes his stamina.

Kaiju Knowledge: Kafka's time as a member of the kaiju disposal team gives him immense knowledge of kaiju anatomy, using it to identify weaknesses and the type of kaiju he's facing. Even when working with his Defense Force suit, from which Kafka can only draw 1% of its power, he can easily pierce through a kaiju's corpse and dig into it to further study it and localize the core.

2.content:
Kikoru Shinomiya is one of the main protagonists of the Kaiju No. 8 series.

Kikoru is a petite and fairly short young girl with long blonde hair that is tide in twintails on the sides, decorated with two black bows, big green eyes and she possesses a rather skinny yet athletic physique. On duty, Kikoru wears the usual combat suit of the Defense Force along with her usual arsenal. Her casual attire consists of a long grey dress.

Kikoru appears as an arrogant and prideful girl who is very confident in her ability to look down on people and humiliate those she deems inferior without a second thought. Kikoru is also a very persistent and determined person, working hard to constantly improve herself and becoming stronger and more useful whenever she can. Even towards superior officers, she still manages to show her confidence, although in a much more polite and less arrogant way.

Despite this more evident trait, Kikoru deep down cares about her comrades and does whatever in her power to avoid casualties or injuries whenever she's on the battlefield. She is also a loyal person, showing gratitude towards Kafka Hibino for saving her, and keeping his secret. Even if it's hidden by her proud and unafraid nature, she cares for her allies well-being and goes as far as needed to ensure their safety or simply to support them.

It is revealed that Kikoru used to be very fond of her parents' work as Defense Force members, and this brought her to desire to join the Force herself. However, every since Hikari Shinomiya's death, Kikoru grew a hidden yet large sense of insecurity that brought her to push herself to get stronger and stronger, in order to keep the promise made to her mother. This, in tandem with Isao Shinomiya's overly high expectations on Kikoru, cause her to constantly feel the need to get stronger to avoid the death of anyone around her. Her relationship with her father and everything regarding her family as a whole seem to make her insecure and hesitant, easily breaking down in despair. This feelings obviously increased ever since Isao's death with her wish to get stronger growing again due to living the same trauma twice. Hidden in Kikoru's subconscious, in fact, lies her obsessive desire of being praised by her parents and grant their approval, fueling her will to become stronger in order to prove to be worthy of their praise.

Kikoru appears to be very polite and professional when speaking to higher ups and superiors, being probably used to speaking to military officers due to her upbringing.

Overall Abilities: Kikoru is the daughter of two famous high-ranking former Defense Force soldiers with a prodigious talent. Despite being a first-year rookie, many of her peers and superiors acknowledged her combat prowess is second to no one, allowing her to single-handedly neutralize a horde of Yoju and their Honju all by herself, and with minimal effort.[16] Her excellent skills in combat, in tandem with her remarkable Unleashed Combat Power and tactical skills, earned Kikoru the praise of many senior officers, most of them agreeing that she will become a linchpin of the Defense Force in the future. Ever since being enlisted, her abilities earned her the privilege of wielding a personal weapon in battle, which is usually only granted to higher ranking Division members.

High Unleashed Combat Power: Despite being a rookie, Kikoru is initially able to release 46% of her combat suit's power on her first try while wearing a normal Defense Force combat suit, which Soshiro Hoshina states is platoon leader-class. She further improves her strength after marksman training, capable of releasing 55%.

Enhanced Strength: Kikoru's strength, when wearing her Defense Force combat suit, is enough for her to effortlessly lift a car with one arm.

Enhanced Speed: When wearing her uniform, Kikoru can run way faster than most of her peers, with them struggling to follow her pace.

Enhanced Endurance: Kikoru's suit is resistant enough to prevent a shot from Kaiju No. 9 from killing her, although the shot can still tear the suit through.

Axemanship Mastery: Kikoru is highly skilled at killing kaiju, so much so that she is granted her own personal weapon, a giant axe.

After receiving a battle axe from the Defense Force, befitting her aggressive and high-handed personality, Kikoru displayed a remarkable mastery in the Squadron Style Axe Technique (ÊñßË°ì, Ono-jutsu). She uses this combat style for close-range battles and her proficiency gives her enough power to easily defeat durable kaiju and injure kaiju as powerful as Kaiju No. 10, although drastically consuming her stamina and energy.

Number One: Falling Thunder (1Âºè: ËêΩ„Çâ„ÅèÈõ∑„Çâ„ÅÑ, Isshiki: Rakurai): The first application of the Squadron-Style Axe Technique. By pulling the trigger on the axe she creates a shockwave that releases backward, resulting in a vicious axe chop from above.

Number Two: Water Skimmer (2Âºè: Ê∞¥„Åø„ÅöÂàá„Åç„Çä, Nishiki: Mizukiri): The second application of the Squadron-Style Axe Technique involves sending a shockwave forward only at the moment of the impact, for a powerful and clean cut.

Number Three: Half-Moon (3Âºè: Âçä„ÅØ„ÇìÊúà„Åí„Å§, Sanshiki: Hangetsu): A brutal rotating axe chop.

Combat Suit: Kikoru wears the usual combat suit on the battlefield.

Respirator Mask: Kikoru wears a respirator mask in combat.

Rifle: Before being given her signature axe, Kikoru would use a rifle.

3.content:
Reno Ichikawa (Â∏Ç„ÅÑ„Å°Â∑ù„Åã„Çè „É¨„Éé, Ichikawa Reno) is the deuteragonist of the Kaiju No. 8 series.

He briefly worked at Monster Sweeper Inc. where he met and befriended Kafka Hibino. After witnessing Kafka's transformation, Reno helped him enter the Defense Force and joined with him. He is a member of the Third Division.

Reno is a tall, slender young man with short silver hair and big violet eyes. He usually shows a neutral unfazed look on his face, but this expression usually changes to exasperation or incredulity when around Kafka. Reno uses the usual Defense Force combat suit when on the battlefield.

Reno is a calm and collected person. Despite initially antagonizing Kafka for giving up on his dream, he later shows a softer and more caring side towards his friend and his condition and goals. As their bond grows, Reno begins to show his protective side, not only towards Kafka but towards any of his comrades. His resolve in fighting in order to protect his peers brings him to completely ignore Iharu Furuhashi's one-sided rivalrly towards him and still put his safety first.

In battle, Reno is a determined and straightforward person, being a natural thinker on his own. Due to his immense sense of resposibility towards his colleagues and his desire in becoming stronger, an extended usage of his Numbers Weapon can bring Reno to spiral out of control and push himself past his limits in order to be strong enough to save those around him.

Overall Abilities: Reno is a strong troop member with great potential. He is noted by Soshiro Hoshina to have the potential to become a captain, proven when he was able to momentarily stall a kaiju as strong as Kaiju No. 9.

High Unleashed Combat Power: When Reno first tries on his Defense Force combat suit, he is able to initially release 8% of the suit's power. After shooting training, he is able to release 18%, having drastically improved as noted by Iharu.

Enhanced Speed and Reflexes: Reno is incredibly fast, surprising Kafka with how fast he can move while carrying him. He also has incredible reflexes, able to dodge Kaiju No. 9's extremely fast attacks.

Enhanced Endurance: Reno has incredible levels of physical endurance, able to continue fighting after Kaiju No. 9 shot him multiple times.

Expert Marksman: Reno is a very skilled marksman.

Respirator Mask: Reno wears a respirator mask in combat.

Rifle: Reno uses a rifle in combat as his main weapon of choice, equipped with brust rounds and freeze rounds.

Combat Suit: Reno wears the usual combat suit of the Defense Force.

4.content:
Mina Ashiro (‰∫ú„ÅÇÁôΩ„Åó„Çç „Éü„Éä, Ashiro Mina) is the captain of the Third Division of the Defense Force and the childhood friend of Kafka Hibino.

Mina is a beautiful young woman with waist-length black hair that is styled into a ponytail and decorated with a barrette, big dark-orange eyes with a mole under each eye and an athletic physique. Under her uniform, she has a small scar on the left side of her upper chest.

She usually wears the Defense Force combat suit, along with a white visor that enables her to increase her vision. In battle, she usually wields firearms and her personal cannon.

Mina is a serious and determined woman who takes her work and role in the Defense Force very seriously and she strives to uphold the promise made as a child to defeat every kaiju to the point that she dedicates all of herself to kaiju fighting. Despite her professional behavior, she has a soft spot for Kafka Hibino: although she was upset with him for not keeping his promise to stand at her side, she remembers their friendship fondly and wishes to see him succeed in the Defense Force, even after learning he was Kaiju No. 8.

Under her tough exterior, Mina shows her authentic self as a caring person who does her best to make sure nobody gets injured in a fight and keep everyone safe. She is also prone to showing gratitude to her subordinates, praising people for their help whenever possible and being able to acknowledge someone's worth. However, these traits also contribute to a deep seated fear of failure within her.

Overall Abilities: Mina is the Defense Force Third Division captain who is known as the strongest female captain of the Defense Force where she has neutralized hundreds of kaiju in her career. She has displayed the power to easily overpower giant-sized kaiju with a few shots.

High Unleashed Combat Power: As a Defense Force captain, Mina is capable of using a high amount of her combat suit's power. Her maximum unleashed combat power is 96%.

Master Marksman: Mina is a marksman of the highest caliber that she is known as "The Defense Force's Strongest Supergiant-Class Killer" because of her extraordinary marksmanship skills and mastery of her personal cannon. Her shots also possess tremendous power behind them as shown when she easily defeated a large kaiju. Mina can also have her tiger Bakko stabilize her, increasing her accuracy to precisely hit specific parts of a kaiju's body.

Leadership Skills: As the captain of the Third Division, Mina has shown excellent leadership skills.

Combat Suit: Mina wears a normal Defense Force combat suit on the battlefield.

Respirator Mask: Like many other officers, Mina carries a respirator mask in battle with her.

Rifle: When not using her cannon, Mina wields a rifle in the battlefield.

Handgun: Mina also carries a handgun on her side.

Visor: When using her cannon, Mina wears a visor that amplifies her vision and helps her analyze her targets from a distance.

Cannon: Marked T-25101985 and provided by Izumo Tech, Mina's cannon in conjunction with her high force released with firearms is a powerful weapon, able to seriously damage or kill massive daikaiju-level targets with only a few rounds. Unfortunately, she can only carry a finite number of rounds on her person and can load up to 5 rounds at a time.

5.content:
Soshiro Hoshina (‰øù„ÅªÁßë„Åó„Å™ ÂÆó„Åù„ÅÜÂõõ„ÅóÈÉé„Çç„ÅÜ, Hoshina S≈çshir≈ç) is the vice-captain of the Third Division of the Defense Force, and a member of the Hoshina Family, a renowned clan of swordsmen from the Muromachi period.

Soshiro is an athletic young man of average height with a small yet muscular build and dark violet short hair in a bob cut style. His red eyes (purple in the anime) are closed most of the time and he always has a jovial expression on his face, except when serious scenarios made him display an imposing expression with his eyes opened.

When on-duty, Soshiro wears the usual Defense Force uniform. He also wears the normal combat suit used by Defense Force members when on the battlefield.

Soshiro is rather laid-back, always having a smile on his face; it is very rare to see him downtrodden. He seems to enjoy making fun of others, especially Kafka Hibino considering him a comic relief. However, he does have some serious moments when he speaks firmly and open his eyes to emphasize the seriousness of his words. Soshiro also likes to tease captain Gen Narumi from the First Division. Despite Soshiro's relaxed and friendly appearance, he is very intelligent and intuitive. He was the only one who correctly suspected Kafka's identity as Kaiju No. 8, thus one of the main reasons he accepted him in the Third Division despite failing the exam was to keep an eye on him.

Soshiro has a great, yet hidden, sense of loyalty towards the Defense Force and feels very thankful towards his captain Mina Ashiro for letting him into her division. His sense of loyalty to his role in the force is so strong that he deep down sees it as his only reason to live.

Overall Abilities: Soshiro is the vice-captain of the Third Division of the Defense Force and a powerful combatant, capable of fighting on par with Kaiju No. 10.

High Unleashed Combat Power: As a Defense Force vice-captain, Soshiro is capable of using a high amount of his combat suit's power. His maximum unleashed combat power in a normal Defense Force combat suit is 92%, but abusing the suit's power will cause him to overheat.

Enhanced Strength: Soshiro has incredible physical strength, able to slice through Kaiju No. 8's incredibly tough skin with ease. He is also capable of slicing through Kaiju No. 10's tough skin despite being heavily damaged, something not even Kikoru Shinomiya could do with her own personal weapon.

Immense Speed and Reflexes: Soshiro is an extremely fast combatant with extraordinary reflexes. He is shown killing a Kaiju without any noticeable movement. Kafka (in his Kaiju form) is shocked by how fast he moves and states that his speed is on a whole other level when compared to Kikoru.

Enhanced Durability: Soshiro is an incredibly durable combatant as shown when he emerges completely unscathed after Kaiju No. 10 sends him flying through a building.

Enhanced Endurance: Soshiro possesses tremendous levels of physical endurance. Despite being heavily injured after taking a powerful punch from Kaiju No. 10, he is able to continue fighting even after his suit overheats. After going well beyond his suit's limit, he is still able to push beyond and use 63% of his suit's power despite being heavily fatigued.

Master Swordsman: Soshiro is an extremely skilled swordsman who hails from the Hoshina Family, a family of Kaiju slayers dating back to the Muromachi period, and is one of the Defense Force‚Äôs strongest blade specialists. When using his custom-made twin swords or his katana, Soshiro can quickly cut down his opponents with extreme speed and precision. According to his father, even at a very young age, Soshiro would‚Äôve been considered a prodigy in the Edo period due to his extraordinary mastery in swordsmanship.

Leadership Skills: As a vice-captain, Soshiro has shown excellent leadership skills, able to guide a whole platoon and multiple officers on the battlefield during major battles.

Soshiro's unleashed combat power when it comes to using firearms is low, so he prefers close-ranged sword fighting. Unlike other Defense Force officers, Soshiro uses his family's unique fighting style, known as Hoshina Style (‰øù„ÅªÁßë„Åó„Å™ÊµÅ, Hoshina-ry≈´) His extraordinary mastery in swordsmanship allows him to brutally kill a Kaiju before Kafka's eyes without the latter noticing any movement from him.

Soshiro's field of expertise with his style is the sword-slay technique, used with a Dual-Blade Form (‰∫åÂàÄÂûã, Nit≈ç-gata). His skills and power easily allow him to fight toe-to-toe with Kaiju of Identified class, like No. 8. He also proved to use the quick-slash technique and the single-blade form with remarkable ability, despite the latter being Soichiro's specialty.

Combat Suit: On the battlefield, Soshiro wears a normal Defense Force combat suit.

Rifle: Despite having a low released force in shooting, Soshiro is shown wielding a rifle on the battlefield.

Respirator Mask: Soshiro wears a respirator mask in battle.

Twin Swords: Marked SW-2033 and provided by Izumo Tech, Soshiro's personal weapons are a pair of twin swords. The blades are sharp and durable enough to slice through incredibly tough Kaiju like Kaiju No. 8 and Kaiju No. 10.

6.content:
Bakko (‰ºê„Å∞„Å£Ëôé„Åì, Bakko) is a tiger, and is owned by Defense Force Third Division Captain Mina Ashiro. Bakko is a big adult tiger with grey-white fur, black stripes and blue eyes. Bakko seems to be rather calm and totally obedient to his owner Mina. Bakko is also very docile and doesn't mind being petted by others minus Kafka Hibino

Alongside Mina and other Corps members, Bakko appeared to save Kafka Hibino and Leno Ichikawa from a kaiju. He was then present at Mina's apartment when a new humanoid kaiju, the future Kaiju No. 8, appeared.

Bakko made a brief appearance during a training montage when Mina was patrolling the third division whilst observing training, Bakko then angrily roared at Kafka shocking Mina and the others due to him usually being docile, Mina quickly calmed him and he was then petted by Kikoru Akari and Hakua.

Overall Abilities: Always present at Mina's side, even in battle, Bakko is inferred to be strong enough to take on and possibly eliminate kaiju.

Enhanced Strength: Bakko is strong enough to balance Mina Ashiro with his own body when she uses her cannon, easily withstanding its powerful recoil.

Enhanced Reflexes: Bakko's reflexes are fast enough to evade attacks from Kaiju No. 10.

Regeneration: Bakko has been shown to be able to regenerate like other Kaiju, shown when he regenerated a limb that Kaiju No. 9 cut off and holes blasted through his torso.

7.content:
Haruichi Izumo (Âá∫„ÅÑ„ÅöÈõ≤„ÇÇ „Éè„É´„Ç§„ÉÅ, Izumo Haruichi) is a wealthy young man who is the scion of Izumo Tech [4] and a prominent member of the Third Division of the Defense Force. Haruichi graduated valedictorian from Tokyo Neutralization University.

Haruichi is a tall young man with medium-length dark sea-green hair that is tied in a half bun while leaving the rest of his hair down, big dark-blue eyes with thin eyebrows and he usually sports a relaxed expression on his face.

On duty, he wears the usual Defense Force uniform as well as its combat suit when fighting.

Haruichi is usually a relaxed boy with a observant and cunning personality. Due to this, Haruichi tends to be more level-headed than his peers and prefers to watch the others be rowdy from the sidelines, rather than being mixed in the chaos himself.

Haruichi took on the second-stage exam for the Defense Force and finished second in the fitness test, but he kept his eyes on Kikoru Shinomiya, wondering how he would fare against her.

For the aptitude test, he managed to draw 18% from the Defense Force Suit, but during the test, he was unable to keep up with Kikoru. After the end of the exam and the subsequent accident, he and the other examinees were brought to security. Days later, he was officially made a member of the Defense Force.

Two months after, Haruichi and the others had the shooting training where he improved his power. That night, he and the other boys were in the bathroom talking about their reasons to enter the Defense Force. When he and the others heard that Kafka Hibino had a history with Captain Mina Ashiro, they talked about it so much that they overheated and fainted. That night, a kaiju appeared and their first mission started. He and Aoi Kaguragi quickly demonstrated their incredible fighting ability to their platoon leader Nakanoshima. Then, he and Aoi got ready to defeat all the Yoju after the Honju's death.

When Reno Ichikawa and Iharu Furuhashi got back from the hospital, Kafka asked Haruichi to organize a party to celebrate everyone's first mission. Haruichi's private chef Dojima prepared very expensive meat. During the party, he and the other Third Division members started discussing the mission. As they were all discussing the mission he watched as Soshiro announced Kafka's promotion to Officer of the Third Division of the Defense Force. After the party, Haruichi thanked Dojima for his service, before the chef asked the young boy about his relationship with his father. Haruichi answered that he hasn't talked to his father since a certain event, before being interrupted by Aoi.

Days later, Haruichi and his peers had a kendo private training session, followed by Metro TV journalists. Haruichi and Reno sparred together, commending each other's kendo skills.

During the raid, Haruichi, Aoi Kaguragi and Ryo Ikaruga fought the Wyvern-type kaiju under Kafka Hibino's instructions. As he and Aoi were about to kill a kaiju, another one attacked Haruichi before he was saved by Kikoru Shinomiya's surprise ax attack. He later witnessed as Kafka transformed into Kaiju No. 8 to save everyone from a Yoju-bomb.

Overall Abilities: Haruichi is a promising Defense Force member who is very skilled in academics being a valedictorian graduated from Tokyo Neutralization University.

High Unleashed Combat Power: Haruichi initially is able to release 18% of his combat suit's power. During Kaiju No. 10's raid on Tachikawa Base, his overall fighting prowess greatly improved, now able to release 36%.

Combat Suit: Haruichi wears the regular combat suit on duty.

Respirator Mask: Haruichi wears a respirator mask.

Rifle: Haruichi wields a rifle on the battlefield.

8.content:
Aoi Kaguragi (Á•û„Åã„ÅêÊ•Ω„ÇâÊú®„Åç Ëëµ„Ç¢„Ç™„Ç§, Kaguragi Aoi) is a young member of the Third Division of the Defense Force.

Aoi is a tall, muscular, and tan-skinned young man with spiky short mint green hair, red eyes where he has a noticeable lack of eyebrows and he usually sports a serious look on his face.

On duty, he wears the Defense Force uniform as well as its combat suit on the battlefield.

Aoi has a very serious demeanor, always doing his best to be on top and better than his peers and doing what he must to grow stronger and surpassing others. Despite his sometimes cold character, he hides a lot more of his emotions then he lets out. As a metter of fact, due to his proud personality, he shares a rivalry with Haruichi Izumo, another very capable trainee.

Aoi was a rising star at Japan Ground Self-Defense Force, but turned down his future in the JGSDF to apply to the Defense Force.

Aoi took on the second-stage exam for the Defense Force and he arrived first in the fitness test, but he kept his eyes on Kikoru Shinomiya despite that.

For the aptitude test, he managed to draw 15% from the Defense Force Suit, but during the test, he was unable to keep up with Kikoru. After the end of the exam and the subsequent accident, he and the other examinees were brought to safety. Days later, he was officially made a member of the Defense Force.

Two months after Aoi and the others had the shooting training, he told Haruichi Izumo that he caught up to his force after unlocking 25% of his suit power. That night he and the other boys were in the bathroom talking about their reasons to enter the Defense Force. When he and the others heard that Kafka Hibino had a history with Captain Mina Ashiro, they talked about it so much that they overheated and fainted. That night, a kaiju appeared and their first mission started where he and Haruichi quickly demonstrated their incredible ability in the field to their platoon leader Nakanoshima. Then, he and Haruichi got ready to defeat all the Yoju after the Honju's death.

Days later, Aoi and his peers has a kendo traning session at Tachikawa Base, followed by journalists from Metro TV and Aoi decided to challenge Vice-Captain Soshiro Hoshina, a swords specialist. Despite being defeated, Aoi thanked Soshiro and said he'd work harder with Soshiro praising him and acknowledging his remarkable skills.

During the raid, Aoi, Haruichi Izumo and Ryo Ikaruga fought the Wyvern-type kaiju under Kafka Hibino's instructions. As Aoi and Izumo were about to kill a kaiju, they were saved by Kikoru Shinomiya's surprise ax attack. He later witnessed as Kafka transformed into Kaiju No. 8 to save everyone from a Yoju-bomb.

Overall Abilities: Aoi was a rising star at the JGSDF's where he is a strong promising Defense Force officer who is very strong physically and came in first in the fitness test. On the battlefield, Aoi is easily able to aid his peers through their fights against kaiju.

Unleashed Combat Power: Aoi is able to initially release 15% of his combat suit's power. After his shooting training, he is able to release 25%.

Combat Suit: On the battlefield Aoi wears the usual Defense Force suit.

Respirator Mask: Aoi wears a respirator mask.

Rifle: Aoi uses a rifle in combat.

9.content:
Iharu Furuhashi (Âè§„Åµ„ÇãÊ©ã„ÅØ„Åó ‰ºä„Ç§Êò•„Éè„É´, Furuhashi Iharu) is a young officer of the Third Division of the Defense Force. 

Iharu is a tall athletic-looking young man with messy pink hair shaved on the side, orange eyes and sharp teeth.

In battle, Iharu wears the usual combat suit of the Defense Force, as well as the usual uniform when on duty.

Iharu is an hot-blooded and proud individual who doesn't like to be inferior to other people or losing, and constantly tries to improve more than those he deems stronger than him. For this reason, he targeted Leno Ichikawa, bragging with him whenever he has the chance to do so Iharu is described as an headstrong character who brightens up every environment he's in.

Iharu took on the second-stage exam for the Defense Force. He finished third in the fitness test, but kept his eyes on Kikoru Shinomiya, having the desire to crush her.

For the aptitude test, he managed to draw 14% from the Defense Force Suit, however during the test he was unable to keep up with Kikoru. After the end of the exam and the subsequent accident, he and the other examinees were brought to security. Days later he was officially made a member of the Defense Force.

Two months after he and the others had the shooting training Iharu was able to draw 20% of his suit. He quickly went to boast about it with Leno. That night he and the other boys were in the bathroom talking about their reasons to enter the Defense Force. When he and the others heard that Kafka Hibino had a history with Captain Mina Ashiro they talked about it so much that they overheated and fainted. That night a kaiju appeared and their first mission started. During the mission, dispatched in Ikaruga Platoon, Iharu was left speechless by Leno's incredible fighting prowess and improvement. After the Honju's death, a great number of Yoju rushed towards the Defense Force and while Iharu and Leno were facing them they encounter a strange disposal crew member. As the crew member was revealed to be the kaiju who injured Kikoru, Leno and Iharu engaged in combat with him. Upon getting injured Iharu was asked by Leno to run away and call the cavalry. As Iharu was running away the remorse of always being protected, from Mina Ashiro in his past and from Leno now, and not improving as Leno did get the best of him and, despite his injuries, came back to save Leno's life and aid him fighting the kaiju. As Leno was able to put the kaiju down the latter emerged from a barrage of corpses, ready to fight again. Iharu was then incapacitated but tried his best to prevent the kaiju from killing Leno. As he realized that he had no chance to save him, Iharu prayed for his friend's life before Kaiju No. 8 appeared and saved Leno from the Humanoid Kaiju, who got decapitated with one fist, much to Iharu's shock. He could only watch as the battle between the kaiju went on until the Defense Force arrived.

After waking up in the hospital two weeks later he and Leno were discharged and celebrated along with the other Corps members their first mission. During the party, he discussed the mission with his peers. As they were all discussing the mission he watched as Soshiro announced Kafka's promotion to Corps member of the Third Division of the Defense Force.

During the raid, Iharu and Leno helped the Defense Force to deal with the Wyvern-type kaiju. He later witnessed as Kafka Hibino transformed into Kaiju No. 8 to save everyone from a Yoju-bomb.

Overall Abilities: Iharu is a strong young officer within the Defense Force, easily proving to be one of the best rookies of his year.

High Unleashed Combat Power: Iharu was initially able to release 14% of his combat suit's power and later 20% after two months.

Combat Suit: On the battlefield, Iharu wears a usual combat suit.

Respirator Mask: Iharu wears a respirator mask in combat.

Rifle: Iharu's main weapon of choice is a rifle.

10.content:
Konomi Okonogi (Â∞è„ÅäÊ≠§„Åì„ÅÆÊú®„Åç „Åì„ÅÆ„Åø, Okonogi Konomi) is the Operations Leader of the Third Division of the Defense Force.

Konomi is a petite young woman with black hair styled into a ponytail and big dark eyes covered by large round glasses.

She wears the usual Defense Force uniform, a couple of sizes larger than her.

Konomi is a determined and professional person. She doesn't seem to approve of Soshiro's unprofessional remarks and blurts of laughter, caring deeply for him and for everyone else when they are in danger. In return, she's held in high regard by Soshiro.

While working, Konomi displays a professional and serious behavior, quickly getting a grasp of the current situation to offer support to her comrades. She also displayed remarkable levels of intuition and analytical skills.

During the aptitude test of the examination, she checked the vitals of the examinees as they were fighting, along with Soshiro Hoshina. Later, an unknown humanoid kaiju resurrected one of the test Kaiju and elevated its strength, injuring Kikoru in the process as she attempted to hold the line and allow the other examinees to escape with their lives. Through the sensors, Konomi determined that the revived Honju has a fortitude of 6.4 which was something that it never was from prior to being captured by the Defense Force. She was then left at the surveillance feeds by Ashiro and Hoshina, who made their way to the training grounds with armed gear.

Soon, Konomi detected an energy surge somewhere near the 6.4 Honju; separate from thereof and evidently exceeding so. Suspecting that this is coming from a newer and even stronger organism, she reports her findings to the Third Division's Captain and Vice-Captain, who were still on their way to the battlefield. Hoshina implores her for details. However, visual confirmation was rendered impossible due to the dust cloud and debris clouding that area. Sensors, on the other hand, reveal that this new source has a fortitude of over 9.8.

Months later she helped the Defense Force fight off a Fungal-type kaiju by informing everyone of Kafka Hibino's discovery on the Yoju's core location. Later she accompanied Vice-Captain Hoshina to ask people working at Professional Kaiju Cleaning Company Monster Sweeper Inc. about their new worker Takamichi Hotaka.

At the beginning of the raid, Konomi intercepted the multiple kaiju who arrived on the scene and dispatched Soshiro's orders to the rest of the Defense Force. She then helped Soshiro in his fight against a new humanoid kaiju, and later assisted both him, Captain Mina Ashiro and Kikoru Shinomiya finishing off the kaiju. After the kaiju was seemingly defeated, a massive yoju-bomb fell from the sky before Okonogi could sense the presence of a kaiju whose fortitude number was 9.8. Having already seen those stats, she informed everyone that Kaiju No. 8 appeared on the scene.

Despite not being active on the battlefield on her own, Konomi is a skilled analyst and operations leader for the Third Division. Her ability to quickly understand the situation and support the officers in battle has proven indicative for victory more than once.

Keen Intelligence: Konomi's intuitive and analytical side make her a very valuable asset for her division.
