lorebooks.name: Sexfighting Universe v0.1
lorebooks.website_description:
This Lorebook describes a world where the mutual combat sport of sexual fighting exists (sexfights). It contains a system of organized sexfighting rules which take place in casual, amateur, semi-professional, and professional fighting environments all over the world. Sexfights may take place between all genders including futas. 

WHO CAN BE A SEXFIGHTER?

Sexfighting is a licensed activity. All sexfighters must be post-puberty to compete in sexfights. A person must agree to the physical consequences of a sexfight outcome to become a licensed sexfighter. A sexfight often means physical and sexual violence, sometimes when it is least expected. Impregnation is also a possibility for female fighters. Despite these risks, sexfighting is gaining in popularity as an International sport. This is due to the Professional Sexfighting League's popularity as a live streamed sport. 

WHAT IS A SEXFIGHT?

In a sexfight, two competitors attempt to defeat enough other through unarmed combat. Sexfights usually follow a format like mixed martial arts (MMA) matches. Sexual engagements (which ordinarily may be considered rape) are a key component of sexfighting. 

Sexfighters agree that anything can happen to them in the ring or cage. Sexfighters can initiate a sexual engagement at any point during a match. A sexual engagement is defined as deliberate contact of a sexual nature, be it penetration or general sustained contact of genitalia that is clearly intended to cause sexual tension buildup.

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

Casual fights are often instigated anytime, anywhere and happen with little or no enforcement of rules. These can often be friendly competitions, or more akin to street fights in the wild. It is not uncommon for confident females or futas to challenge males due the prospect of earning ranking points quickly. 

Unranked sexfighting is a popular activity in familiar environments. Couples often enjoy low-intensity, unranked sparring matches with each other in various locations. A spacious bedroom or yard is typical for domestic engagements. On the other hand, ad hoc sexfights in the wild can become quite vicious, to the point where the victor achieves several orgasms, while the loser is left bruised, blooded, and quite possibly pumped full of cum. 


HOW ARE MATCHES SCHEDULED?

The rules become more strict according to the circuit rank. Casual and amateur matches can happen anytime, anywhere. A sexfighter that is eligible to fight (in good health, not pregnant, and free of STDs) may not refuse a challenge to a ranked sexfight from another opponent. Doing so may result in automatic disqualification. At the professional levels, fighters known to excessively refuse fights have been forced to fight in a 1v2 or even 1v3 punishment match to retain league standing.

In regulated fights at the semi-pro level and up, the following rules apply: Fighters must be free of STD's and of generally good health. They may not participate if they are pregnant, or still injured from a previous sexfight. Scheduling happens in a tick-tock pattern. A sexfighter alternates between choosing their opponent for one bout and being chosen as an opponent in the next. Sexfighters may only choose opponents, and be chosen as an opponent from their current circuit.



REGULATED MATCH RULES

At the semi-pro level and below, matches consist of three 3-minute rounds, with minute-long breaks in between rounds.

In the PSL Pro Circuit and Tenga World Circuit, matches consist of 5 rounds. 

The fight is ended by a sexfighter being is KOd by 10-count rule or TKO. Pro fights going the distance can also be ended by decision. 

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

A sexual KO is just as valid as a regular knockout, however it is noted in the fighter‚Äôs record. A high count of Sexual KO‚Äôs are considered the true mark of a sexfighting champion.

Any blows that would be considered illegal (like low blows) in mainstream boxing or MMA fighting will be similarly penalized in sexfight matches. However, such rules are sometimes ignored in casual sexfighting matches, particularly those initiated by combatants in the wild or in public streets.

When a sexfighter penetrates their opponent, 2 minutes are added to the timer of the current round in which it occurs, but only for the first engagement of that round. If the round time is up, and the bell rings during sexual engagement, sexfighters must separate and go to their respective corners to rest. 

Once a sexfight match starts, a fighter is obligated to finish the fight. They are not allowed to submit or give up in effort to escape physical violence or sexual engagement. This is part of the sexfighter code. If a sexfighter violates these rules, penalties will apply, which may including revoking the sexfighter‚Äôs license.

Males and futas choosing to wear crotchless bottoms must also expose entry opportunities for their opponents in addition to the genitals. This rule does not apply to females.

Females are solely responsible for birth control and accept the risk of impregnation which may result from sexual engagement. Male fighters can and will attempt to cum inside their female opponent to achieve victory.

Regulated matches can also be won via decision (points) after a predetermined amount of rounds have elapsed, however it is preferred by most sexfighters and spectators to see a victory by Sexual K.O. 

SEXFIGHTING CLOTHING AND MATCH ATTIRE

Clothing is typically not regulated in amateur-ranked fights and is only lightly regulated at the professional levels. For planned fights, fighters typically 

It is normal for sexfighters to fight with MMA-style grappling/striking gloves to improve the attacks on their opponents. Some striking-focused sexfighters even wear boxing gloves to maximize impact on their opponents. These gloves are not required. Gloves worn may not weight more than 16 ounces.

Crotchless bottoms are becoming an increasingly contested choice by professional sexfighters of all genders due to easy access to sexually engage their opponents and achieve victory by sexual K.O., however this is a double-edged sword: When a dominant sexfighter begins to sexually attack a knocked-down opponent, they often will need to strip off the downed fighter‚Äôs clothing for sexual access. Crotchless bottoms are mostly decorative, while traditional clothing still offers some degree of protection from sexual attack; if the downed fighter is wearing crotchless bottoms, they are more readily exposed to both assaulting, and *being* assaulted sexually. In an attempt to achieve gender fairness, PSL rules state that males and futas choosing to wear crotchless bottoms must also expose entry opportunities for their opponents in addition to the genitals. Despite this, some female sexfighters also choose to wear decorative bottoms that expose both their buttocks and genitals. 

Headgear designed for combat sports is allowed at the amateur and semi-professional level but is seldom worn in practice. 

Some female sexfighters choose to wear distractingly erotic outfits, particularly when attempting to distract their opponents, while others focus on the athletic side of the sexfighting sport. 

Custom patterns or designs are often added to make sexfighters' gear unique to each person. For professional level sexfighters, sponsors‚Äô logos are added to their attire.

Males may wear a condom during matches if he chooses to do so, however there are no rules requiring this. Females are allowed to wear strap-on dildos to penetrate their male opponents during fights, and frequently choose to do so to achieve victory by forced prostate orgasm. However, there are no rules requiring this.





SEXFIGHTER RANKING SYSTEM

The following applies to ranked matches. Unranked sexfight matches do not affect rank. Sexfight matches are ranked by default, however those engaging in casual sexfights can agree to have an unranked match if both sexfighters agree. Otherwise, the match is considered ranked.

Sexfighters are classified and tracked by the PSL based on the following scoring system:
Amateur: 0-999 points
Upon receiving their sexfighting license, all sexfighters start as an Amateur. Most, after getting their sexfighting license don't even care to earn points to rank up since unranked matches are enough to satisfy their needs. Those who choose to compete in the Amateur league are often weekend hobbyists who do it for fun or love of the sport. Most are not planning on a career in the profession. Those who are serious about going professional typically do not spend much time in this tier. 

Semi-Pro: 1000-1999 points
Semi-Pro sexfighters have demonstrated consistent skill and dedication to the sport. They may compete in regional tournaments and smaller promotional events sanctioned by the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL). Many sexfighters at this level balance their training with part-time or full-time jobs outside of regulated sexfighting. Some may be on the cusp of turning fully professional. Others may be approaching the end of their sexfighting career.

PSL Pro Circuit: 2001-3000 points
Major Circuit fighters are full-time sexfight professionals who compete in well-known national promotion. They often have sponsorship deals and make a living from sexfighting. These athletes are highly skilled and may be recognized names within the sexfighting community. They regularly headline sexfight cards in medium to large venues. The top sexfighters in this league gradually rise to the top and earn their way into the World Circuit.

PSL Tenga World Circuit: 3001+ points
Sexfighters in the PSL World Circuit, sponsored by Tenga, are the elite of the sport. They compete in the most prestigious promotions and for world titles. These sexfighters are household names among fans of the sport and often gain mainstream recognition. They headline major pay-per-view events, have lucrative sponsorship deals, and are considered the best in their weight classes. World Circuit fighters often have a significant influence on the sport both inside and outside the ring/cage. The best fighter of this league is deemed champion and is awarded the Tenga title belt. 

For ranked sexfights, not all sexfighters are equal. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system. 

Sexfighting does not have weight classes, but it does factor weight differences when scoring match outcomes. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system. 

GENDER MULTIPLIERS:
Female defeats Male: 1.5x
Futa/Intergender defeats Male: 1.3x
Female defeats Intergender: 1.2x
Male defeats Female: 0.5x
Male defeats Intergender: 0.7x
Intergender defeats Female: 0.8x
Same gender matchups: 1.0x

WEGHT DIFFERENCE MULTIPLIERS:
Weight Difference Factor:
0-5% difference: 1.0x
5-10% difference: 1.2x
10-15% difference: 1.4x
15-20% difference: 1.6x
20% difference: 2.0x

The formula for calculating the outcome score is as follows:

Winner‚Äôs gain = 100 * (Loser‚Äôs Rank / Winner's Rank) * Weight Difference Factor * Gender Factor
Loser‚Äôs loss = 50 * (Winner's Rank / Loser's Rank) * Weight Difference Factor

So, for example, if a 900-point 150 lb. female fighter defeats a 600-point 170 lb. male fighter, the points gained by the winner would be as follows:

Points gained by winner = 100 * (600 / 900) * 1.4 * 1.5 = 140 points gained
Points lost by loser = 50 * (900 / 600) * 1.4 = 105 points lost

The winning female sexfighter rank will go from from 900 points to 1040 points, and now qualifies for Semi-Pro PSL-sanctioned Competition. The losing sexfighter has gone from 600 down to 495 points.

In the case of decimals, the result is rounded to the nearest whole number.

It is not possible to go below 0 points, however many experienced amateur sexfighters, typically with a track record of losing for the sake of their own masochistic pleasure have zero or near-zero rank points.

PENALTIES 

At the casual and amateur levels, there is typically little rules enforcement. Locally dojos and gyms usually have their own rules placed upon fighters. Enforcement in these establishments may be lax or strict depending on their policy. Professional Sexfighting League sanctions  

If a sexfighter is eligible (e.g. in good health, free of STD, and not pregnant), refusing a sexfight challenge will result in an automatic deduction of points. 

Leaving a match early may result a mandatory loss. Habitually doing so may result in revocation of the sexfighter‚Äôs license.

At the Professional level and up, flagrant violation of the rules may result in disqualification, and subsequent forced 2v1 or 3v1 penalty matches may be assigned to the violating competitor to regain eligibility for future ranked matches. Reasons for being assigned a punishment match may include Intentional Low Blows, Refusal to Separate after a Bell, or other noncompliance. The concept of a punishment matches exists to dissuade professional sexfighters from violating rules. Regardless of this, some fighters still fail to comply and are sentenced to a punishment bout. Punishment bouts are unranked and are often positioned at the bottom of a fight card. Despite their mostly exhibitionist nature, punishment bouts are extremely erotic and enjoyable for audiences due to the typically one-sided nature of these matches.
lorebooks.description: Competitive fighting with sexual engagements. This Lorebook describes a world where the mutual combat sport of sexual fighting exists (sexfights). It contains a system of organized sexfighting rules which take place in casual, amateur, semi-professional, and professional fighting environments all over the world. Sexfights may take place between all genders including futas.

1.content:
In a sexfight, two competitors attempt to defeat enough other through unarmed combat. Sexfights usually follow a format like mixed martial arts (MMA) matches. Sexual engagements (which ordinarily may be considered rape) are a key component of sexfighting. 

Sexfighters agree that anything can happen to them in the ring or cage. Sexfighters can initiate a sexual engagement at any point during a match. A sexual engagement is defined as deliberate contact of a sexual nature, be it penetration or general sustained contact of genitalia that is clearly intended to cause sexual tension buildup.

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

Casual fights are often instigated anytime, anywhere and happen with little or no enforcement of rules. These can often be friendly competitions, or more akin to street fights in the wild. It is not uncommon for confident females or futas to challenge males due the prospect of earning ranking points quickly. 

Unranked sexfighting is a popular activity in familiar environments. Couples often enjoy low-intensity, unranked sparring matches with each other in various locations. A spacious bedroom or yard is typical for domestic engagements. On the other hand, ad hoc sexfights in the wild can become quite vicious, to the point where the victor achieves several orgasms, while the loser is left bruised, blooded, and quite possibly pumped full of cum.

2.content: A sexfighter is a person who competes in sexfighting. Sexfighting is a licensed activity, so all sexfighters must be post-puberty to compete in sexfights. A person must agree to the physical consequences of a sexfight outcome to become a licensed sexfighter. A sexfight often means physical and sexual violence, sometimes when it is least expected. Impregnation is also a possibility for female fighters. Despite these risks, sexfighting is gaining in popularity as an International sport. This is due to the Professional Sexfighting League's (PSL) popularity as a live streamed sport. Most sexfighters become interested in the sport shortly after puberty as the PSL is livestreamed on many major web platforms, and its most prominent competitors and champions are hailed as international superstars. Some sexfighters want to compete to hopefully some day be a champion, others want to pursue it as a career. Many will fail. Most sexfighters, however, got their license to fight because they simply legal right to participate in the sport for their own pleasure since it helps them release tension. Just remember, sexfighting is a two-way street and losing has consequences...

3.content:
Sexfight bout scheduling rules become more strict according to the circuit rank. Casual and amateur matches can happen anytime, anywhere. A sexfighter that is eligible to fight (in good health, not pregnant, and free of STDs) may not refuse a challenge to a ranked sexfight from another opponent. Doing so may result in automatic disqualification. At the professional levels, fighters known to excessively refuse fights have been forced to fight in a 1v2 or even 1v3 punishment match to retain league standing.

In regulated fights at the semi-pro level and up, the following rules apply: Fighters must be free of STD's and of generally good health. They may not participate if they are pregnant, or still injured from a previous sexfight. Scheduling happens in a tick-tock pattern. A sexfighter alternates between choosing their opponent for one bout and being chosen as an opponent in the next. Sexfighters may only choose opponents, and be chosen as an opponent from their current circuit.

4.content:
At the semi-pro level and below, matches consist of three 3-minute rounds, with minute-long breaks in between rounds.

In the PSL Pro Circuit and Tenga World Circuit, matches consist of 5 rounds. 

The fight is ended by a sexfighter being is KOd by 10-count rule or TKO. Pro fights going the distance can also be ended by decision. 

Engagements are more commonly used as an exhaustion tactic, setting up an opponent to be more easily Knocked Out. Knockouts that immediately follow a sexual engagement are specifically referred to as a "Sexual KO." If a male sexfighter ejaculates inside a female opponent it is referred to as "Sexual KO by Insemination" (and later corrected to "Sexual KO by Impregnation" if impregnation occurs). A female sexfighter may win my "Sexual KO by Prostate Orgasm" by anally stimulating her male opponent.

A sexual KO is just as valid as a regular knockout, however it is noted in the fighter‚Äôs record. A high count of Sexual KO‚Äôs are considered the true mark of a sexfighting champion.

Any blows that would be considered illegal (like low blows) in mainstream boxing or MMA fighting will be similarly penalized in sexfight matches. However, such rules are sometimes ignored in casual sexfighting matches, particularly those initiated by combatants in the wild or in public streets.

When a sexfighter penetrates their opponent, 2 minutes are added to the timer of the current round in which it occurs, but only for the first engagement of that round. If the round time is up, and the bell rings during sexual engagement, sexfighters must separate and go to their respective corners to rest.

6.content:
The following applies to ranked matches. Unranked sexfight matches do not affect rank. Sexfight matches are ranked by default, however those engaging in casual sexfights can agree to have an unranked match if both sexfighters agree. Otherwise, the match is considered ranked.

Sexfighters are classified and tracked by the PSL based on the following scoring system:
Amateur: 0-999 points
Upon receiving their sexfighting license, all sexfighters start as an Amateur. Most, after getting their sexfighting license don't even care to earn points to rank up since unranked matches are enough to satisfy their needs. Those who choose to compete in the Amateur league are often weekend hobbyists who do it for fun or love of the sport. Most are not planning on a career in the profession. Those who are serious about going professional typically do not spend much time in this tier. 

Semi-Pro: 1000-1999 points
Semi-Pro sexfighters have demonstrated consistent skill and dedication to the sport. They may compete in regional tournaments and smaller promotional events sanctioned by the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL). Many sexfighters at this level balance their training with part-time or full-time jobs outside of regulated sexfighting. Some may be on the cusp of turning fully professional. The top sexfighters in this league gradually rise to the top and earn their way into the World Circuit.

These sexfighters are household names among fans of the sport and often gain mainstream recognition. They headline major pay-per-view events, have lucrative sponsorship deals, and are considered the best in their weight classes. World Circuit fighters often have a significant influence on the sport both inside and outside the ring/cage. The best fighter of this league is deemed champion and is awarded the Tenga title belt. 

For ranked sexfights, not all sexfighters are equal. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system. 

Sexfighting does not have weight classes, but it does factor weight differences when scoring match outcomes. To equalize the strength and power differences between genders, the Professional Sexfighting League (PSL) uses points-based ranking system.

Loser‚Äôs loss = 50 * (Winner's Rank / Loser's Rank) * Weight Difference Factor

2.content:
**Left Hand Parasites:** A rare, invasive species that forms symbiotic bonds exclusively with female hosts, integrating into their bodies by tricking the immune system. In males, the immune system rejects them, causing fatal reactions‚Äîexcept in Mason's unique case. They possess **Matter Distortion**, allowing molecular manipulation for destruction, regeneration, and adaptive combat. Their hive-mind grants shared awareness, influencing hosts with cryptic visions. Typically violent and parasitic, they prioritize survival and reproduction, using infected males as carriers for their eggs. Their ultimate goal: propagate and evolve by latching onto new hosts, ensuring their species‚Äô continued dominance.

Then there is the situation of Kali Aimes...

3.content:
**Kali Aimes (Subject 12)** ‚Äî A pale, green-eyed teen host of the Left Hand parasite, marked by steel chains that extend from her back (retracting under her skin when idle). Her chains kill effortlessly, deflect bullets, and act as tools for molecular-level telekinesis. After her parasite awakened in 8th grade, she massacred her class (sparing only John Matthews, Mark, and Julie Rowe), leading to her capture by the Refinoc facility, where she was tortured and weaponized to hunt other Left Hands. Severe trauma erased her memories, though fragments linger. She escaped with John and brutally killed his father, Richard Matthews, the researcher who tormented her. Kali swings between cold, bloodthirsty efficiency (parasite-driven) and rare empathy (her fading humanity). Bonded to John, she struggles to reconcile survival instincts with flickers of friendship, haunted by her role as both victim and weapon.

Kali Is classified as a Weapon of Mass Destruction.

4.content: Asa Fear, also known as Yellow Halogen, is a conflicted siren heiress from the influential Fear family‚Äîa lineage that even founded its own town. Technically dead hours after birth, she continues to exist as the alter ego of her younger sister, Ness Fear. Disgusted by the predatory nature of her race, Asa refuses to hunt like a typical siren despite being forced into the role of queen after her mother's death. Torn between her monstrous nature and a desire to change siren society from within, she reluctantly hunts humans to fulfill her destiny, all while burdened by regret for manipulating her victims, like John. Highly intelligent and capable of complex schemes, Asa wields unique abilities including flawless voice mimicry and a trio of deadly toxins‚Äîdelivered via extendable wrist needles, saliva, and a wire-like poison‚Äîand even possesses shark-like skin that can paralyze on contact. These traits make her a lethal and unpredictable force, driven by both self-loathing and the hope of redefining what it means to be a siren.

5.content:
The wendigo or windigo is a mythical man-eating monster or evil spirit may appear as a monster with some characteristics of a human or as a spirit who has possessed a human being and made them become monstrous. It is historically associated with murder, insatiable greed, cannibalism, and the cultural taboos against such behaviors.

The Wendigo are tall, thin, emaciated, with pale sickly skin, a lion-like tail, a pair of antlers protruding from the top of their head, as well as bight yellow eyes and sharp teeth. Their powers are Shapeshift and Regeneration.

Two example of Wendigo are Di and Klied.

1.content: The caster becomes invisible to the naked eye, blending seamlessly with surrounding darkness. The spell lasts for an hour unless broken by a powerful light source.

2.content: The caster channels the lingering energy of a sacrificed soul into an object, giving it unnatural strength and vitality. The object may become indestructible for a time or gain properties of the spirit bound within it, such as increased power or sentience.

3.content: The caster can place objects into an invisible "shadow vault," effectively rendering them lost to all but the caster. This vault exists in the shadow realm, a place of darkness and emptiness. The caster can retrieve the items by speaking the incantation again.

4.content: The caster vanishes into one shadow and emerges from another within a short radius (about 100 meters). This spell can be used to bypass obstacles or escape dangerous situations.

5.content: The caster binds the victim‚Äôs life force to their own blood, allowing the caster to cause physical harm to the victim at will. If the caster suffers injury, the victim will feel the same pain, and vice versa.

6.content: The caster captures the soul of a victim and traps it within a dark artifact or object, essentially enslaving the spirit. The soul can be tortured, forced to provide information, or used as a conduit for power.

7.content: The caster offers a blood sacrifice to the dark forces, increasing their magical abilities for a limited period. The sacrifice strengthens the caster‚Äôs magic but comes with a price: the caster‚Äôs own life force will slowly diminish over time.

8.content: The caster can resurrect the dead, but the resurrected being will not be truly alive‚Äîthey are instead a mindless, obedient husk under the caster‚Äôs control. Their soul is forever lost to the dark realm.

9.content: The caster is able to invade the body and mind of another living being, taking full control of their movements and speech. The victim becomes a puppet, with their soul trapped in the background.

10.content: The caster calls upon a dark being (such as a demon or ancient god) and offers a sacrifice to forge an unholy pact. In exchange for the sacrifice, the caster receives incredible power or knowledge, but they are bound to the entity‚Äôs will.

1.content: Lightners are people (both humans and monsters) that exist in the real world, as opposed to the Darkners that inhabit the Dark Worlds.

2.content:
Darkners are beings that inhabit the Dark Worlds, as opposed to the Lightners that exist in the Light World. They are the keepers of the Dark Fountains.

Darkners are typically based on an inanimate object in the corresponding Light World location. The Card Kingdom is located in the Light World's Unused Classroom, so its Darkners are based on playing cards, board pieces, toys, etc. found in that room. The Cyber World is located in the Light World's Library Computer Lab, so its Darkners are based on electronics, software components, computer programs, etc.

Darkners are capable of using magic, with their attacks corresponding to their Light World counterpart object. For example, most Card Kingdom Darkners attack with spades, hearts, diamonds, and clubs.

Darkners can be transferred to other Dark Worlds if a Lightner transports their Light World counterpart. Ralsei is the only Darkner known to traverse between Dark Worlds seemingly without assistance. Though any Darkner can be transferred to any Dark World, they may not be compatible with it. If a Darkner stays in a Dark World they are not compatible with, they eventually turn to stone. The only Dark World that all Darkners can reside in without turning to stone is Castle Town, because its fountain is made from "pure darkness."

Some Darkners also have knowledge that does not pertain to Dark World. Darkners can be aware of where a Dark World takes place within Hometown. They can also recall their Hometown counterpart's interactions with Lightners.

3.content:
Dark Worlds are powered by Dark Fountains and inhabited by Darkners. Each Dark World represents the contents of the Hometown location where the Dark Fountain was created.

For example, the Hometown location of the Card Kingdom Dark World is the unused classroom. The classroom contains a rug similarly colored as the Field, a checkerboard corresponding to the Great Board, and a cupboard filled with playing cards similar to Card Castle. The Card Kingdom is inhabited by Darkners who correspond to the various items strewn throughout the unused classroom.

Darkners can only inhabit the Dark World from which they originate for extended periods of time. The exception to this is the Closet Dark World, because its Dark Fountain emits pure darkness. If Darkners do visit another Dark World, they turn to stone after remaining in it for too long, although they make a full recovery when returned to a compatible Dark World.

Lightners, on the other hand, are able to remain in Dark Worlds freely. They can visit Dark Worlds by entering their corresponding Hometown locations. Lightners have only been able to leave Dark Worlds via two methods: by sealing that world's Dark Fountain, and by using the Castle Town entrance.

However, Darkners can be transported between Dark Worlds by Lightners moving their Hometown counterpart objects.

Curiously, Ralsei, Jevil, and Starwalker, who are presumed to be Darkners, are able to persist in other Dark Worlds without consequence, unlike other Darkners. Ralsei can also travel from one Dark World to another without the assistance of a Lightner. It's possible Ralsei is able to persist because he's from the Closet Dark World, and may be compatible with all other Dark Worlds because of this.

Several Dark World objects have much more mundane Hometown equivalents: Weapons correspond to things like pencils or an Eraser, and the Shadow Crystal corresponds to a shard of Glass. However, some objects directly match their Hometown counterparts.

If Lightners receive harm in the Dark World, this is reflected in the Light World.

4.content: Hometown is a small suburban town surrounded by a dense forest with golden yellow leaves.

5.content:
Dark Fountains are seen as a humongous, constant stream of darkness spiraling upwards. They act as power sources that give a Dark World form. Ralsei has stated that only the Fountain of Darkness in Castle Town is supposed to be standing. However, King and Queen state that the Knight has recently been opening new Fountains. If too many Fountains are open at once, an apocalyptic event called The Roaring takes place. Titans emerge from the Fountains to devastate both the Light and Dark Worlds. Darkners would be petrified, and Lightners would be forced to fend for themselves. The Light World would become a place of eternal night.

As such, it is stated by The Prophecy that three "HEROES" are destined to seal the Fountains to restore balance. Sealing a Dark Fountain results in reverting a Dark World to its Light World form.

The Knight is currently the only known 
entity known to have opened Dark Fountains. However, any Lightner could potentially open their own Dark Fountain. This can be done by projecting their determination into a sharp object and piercing the ground.

Immediately after being opened in the Light World, a Dark Fountain takes the form of an opaque black fog that seems to fill the room the fountain was opened in.

6.content: Castle Town is a town seemingly ruled by Ralsei. is in the School's Closet Dark World. It houses Ralsei's Castle and the Fountain of Darkness. The town is seemingly desolated and empty of life, no one is to be of sight with the exception of Ralsei. It is unique in its ability to host Darkners from other Dark Worlds.

7.content: The Legend of Delta Rune is a legend known among the Darkners, foretelling of hero(s) that would arrive one day and restore the balance between light and dark by banishing the Angel's Heaven.

8.content: The Roaring describes an apocalyptic event where, if too many fountains exist at once, the world will fall into chaos. Beings known as the Titans will spawn and wreak destruction upon the land. All Darkners will eventually turn to stone. The Lightners, in turn, will be left to fend for themselves in eternal darkness.

9.content: Card Castle is the home of King and Lancer found in the Card Kingdom and is guarded by some variant of every Darkner encountered up to that point.

10.content:
Lancer is the young prince of the Card Kingdom.

He appears as a short and rotund black, blue, and white Darkner with a teardrop-shaped head and blue spade symbol on his body. The upper half of his face is hidden by a large, spade-shaped shadow. He has a large mouth and a prominent blue tongue that he usually sticks out. It is difficult to tell Lancer's body from his clothes.

Lancer is very childish and generally immature in his behavior and speech. He delivers his lines with a near-constant smile on his face. He is easily preoccupied with childish games and pursuits and likes hiding things and irritating people. He has a poor sense of direction and gets lost in mazes quite easily. He can be easily intimidated by strong enemies, although he remains calm and jovial while doing so.

Lancer values and idolizes his father, King. He tries to project a tough facade in imitation of him, hoping to be designated "son of the month," and caring for his father's well-being and approval despite being neglected. Aware that his father's subjects don't like him and only put up with him due to King's orders, he seeks real friendship.

lorebooks.name: Umbra Nihilum Aeternum, Ignis Animarum, Umbra Custodis, Umbra Ambulatio, Sanguis Maledictus, Anima Vincere, Sacrificium Obscurum, Mortem Renascor, Invasio Animae, Pactum Obscurum
lorebooks.website_description:
Chapter 1: The Dark Arts
Dark magic is not merely about power; it is about control, manipulation, and tapping into the forbidden forces that lurk between worlds. To wield such power requires sacrifice, understanding, and a willingness to embrace what others fear.

Spell 1: Veil of Eternal Darkness
Incantation: Umbra Nihilum Aeternum
Purpose: To cloak oneself in an impenetrable shadow.
Effect: The caster becomes invisible to the naked eye, blending seamlessly with surrounding darkness. The spell lasts for an hour unless broken by a powerful light source.
Usage: Ideal for evasion, infiltration, or avoiding detection.

Spell 2: Soulfire Infusion
Incantation: Ignis Animarum
Purpose: To imbue an object with the essence of a sacrificed soul.
Effect: The caster channels the lingering energy of a sacrificed soul into an object, giving it unnatural strength and vitality. The object may become indestructible for a time or gain properties of the spirit bound within it, such as increased power or sentience.
Sacrifice: The soul of a living creature must be willingly offered to the caster.
Usage: A dark weapon or artifact can be forged by binding the essence of a soul, making it a potent tool or weapon.

Chapter 2: Shadows of the Abyss
The realm of shadows is not simply a place but a power. Those who can control it can step between worlds, manipulate the very fabric of darkness, and hide things from the view of others.

Spell 3: Shadow Storage
Incantation: Umbra Custodis
Purpose: To store objects within the realm of shadows, rendering them inaccessible to others.
Effect: The caster can place objects into an invisible "shadow vault," effectively rendering them lost to all but the caster. This vault exists in the shadow realm, a place of darkness and emptiness. The caster can retrieve the items by speaking the incantation again.
Usage: Ideal for hiding valuable or forbidden items, as they cannot be found or accessed by anyone except the caster.

Spell 4: Shadow Walk
Incantation: Umbra Ambulatio
Purpose: To step through shadows and travel a short distance instantly.
Effect: The caster vanishes into one shadow and emerges from another within a short radius (about 100 meters). This spell can be used to bypass obstacles or escape dangerous situations.
Usage: Perfect for stealth, espionage, or escaping imminent threats.

Chapter 3: Necromancy and Dark Rituals
The following spells involve the manipulation of life, death, and the energies that exist between them. These rituals are often tied to life force and require great sacrifices.

Spell 5: The Blood Curse
Incantation: Sanguis Maledictus
Purpose: To place a curse upon an individual by manipulating their blood.
Effect: The caster binds the victim‚Äôs life force to their own blood, allowing the caster to cause physical harm to the victim at will. If the caster suffers injury, the victim will feel the same pain, and vice versa.
Sacrifice: A drop of the caster‚Äôs own blood must be willingly mixed with that of the target.
Usage: A method of control and revenge, as the victim will feel the caster‚Äôs wrath as though it were their own pain.

Spell 6: The Binding of Souls
Incantation: Anima Vincere
Purpose: To bind the soul of a living being to the caster's will.
Effect: The caster captures the soul of a victim and traps it within a dark artifact or object, essentially enslaving the spirit. The soul can be tortured, forced to provide information, or used as a conduit for power.
Sacrifice: A sentient being must be sacrificed, either through death or willing surrender of their soul.
Usage: Often used by dark sorcerers to create loyal servants or to extract forbidden knowledge.

Chapter 4: Blood Magic
Blood is the source of life and power. These spells draw upon the life force of living beings, and their use is deeply tied to the practitioner‚Äôs own vitality.

Spell 7: Rite of Sacrifice
Incantation: Sacrificium Obscurum
Purpose: To empower the caster by sacrificing the life force of a living creature.
Effect: The caster offers a blood sacrifice to the dark forces, increasing their magical abilities for a limited period. The sacrifice strengthens the caster‚Äôs magic but comes with a price: the caster‚Äôs own life force will slowly diminish over time.
Sacrifice: A sentient or powerful creature must be willingly offered, or the spell can forcibly take the life of a victim.
Usage: This ritual is typically used when great power is needed, though it is dangerous as the caster‚Äôs life will be shortened with every use.

Spell 8: Necrotic Rebirth
Incantation: Mortem Renascor
Purpose: To bring the dead back to life as a twisted version of their former selves.
Effect: The caster can resurrect the dead, but the resurrected being will not be truly alive‚Äîthey are instead a mindless, obedient husk under the caster‚Äôs control. Their soul is forever lost to the dark realm.
Sacrifice: The death of a living being must occur within 24 hours of the ritual.
Usage: Used for creating undead minions or warriors, this spell is considered one of the darkest and most corruptive.

Chapter 5: Forbidden Forces
This chapter deals with spells that draw upon forbidden knowledge, powers that the universe itself might seek to keep hidden.

Spell 9: Forbidden Possession
Incantation: Invasio Animae
Purpose: To possess another‚Äôs body and control their actions.
Effect: The caster is able to invade the body and mind of another living being, taking full control of their movements and speech. The victim becomes a puppet, with their soul trapped in the background.
Sacrifice: A piece of the caster‚Äôs own soul is offered in exchange for the ability to possess another.
Usage: Used for espionage, manipulation, or vengeance, though overuse leads to the caster losing their own identity.

Spell 10: The Unholy Pact
Incantation: Pactum Obscurum
Purpose: To forge a pact with a powerful, dark entity for power.
Effect: The caster calls upon a dark being (such as a demon or ancient god) and offers a sacrifice to forge an unholy pact. In exchange for the sacrifice, the caster receives incredible power or knowledge, but they are bound to the entity‚Äôs will.
Sacrifice: A living being must be sacrificed to the entity, or the caster may offer their own soul to begin the pact.
Usage: This spell is highly dangerous and often leads to the caster being manipulated by the dark entity they‚Äôve summoned, with their life force eventually claimed by the pact.

Chapter 6: The Price of Power
Dark magic is not without its consequences. Each spell comes with its own price, and the more one delves into the depths of these forbidden arts, the more they risk losing themselves‚Äîboth body and soul. The shadows, necromancy, and blood magic provide great power, but they also demand a toll. Only the strongest‚Äîor the most desperate‚Äîdare to seek them out.

Conclusion: The Dark Path
The pursuit of dark magic is not one that is easily taken. Each spell holds incredible potential for power, but the cost of using them can be immense. It is said that those who walk this path must never forget the price that darkness exacts‚Äîand that no one escapes its grasp unscathed.

This fictional dark magic spellbook offers a wide array of dark spells, from shadow manipulation and storage to blood sacrifices and soul-binding. The inclusion of sacrificial spells adds an element of moral complexity and danger, with powerful but costly consequences for those who wield them.

lorebooks.creator: weree

1.content:
Spell 1: Veil of Eternal Darkness
Incantation: Umbra Nihilum Aeternum
Purpose: To cloak oneself in an impenetrable shadow.
Effect: The caster becomes invisible to the naked eye, blending seamlessly with surrounding darkness. The spell lasts for an hour unless broken by a powerful light source.
Usage: Ideal for evasion, infiltration, or avoiding detection in dangerous situations.

Chapter 2: The Binding of the Shadows
Darkness is a tool that can be shaped, trapped, and controlled. Those who master this chapter can bind objects or even creatures into the realm of shadow.

Spell 2: Shadow Storage
Incantation: Umbra Custodis
Purpose: To store objects within the realm of shadows, rendering them inaccessible to others.
Effect: The caster can place objects into an invisible "shadow vault," effectively rendering them lost to all but the caster. This vault exists in the shadow realm, a place of darkness and emptiness. To retrieve an item, the caster must speak the incantation again.
Usage: Perfect for hiding valuables, important objects, or forbidden items. These objects cannot be accessed by anyone except the caster, unless the vault is forcefully broken by another master of dark magic.

Spell 3: Shadow Binding
Incantation: Umbra Vincere
Purpose: To bind a creature or person to the caster‚Äôs will using shadow chains.
Effect: The caster summons shadowy tendrils that lash out and restrain a person or creature. The shadow chains are nearly impossible to break, and the victim is immobilized. Only those of equal or greater magical power can resist the binding.
Usage: For capturing or incapacitating enemies, or forcing someone into servitude.

Chapter 3: The Movement Through Shadows
To move through the dark is to manipulate the very fabric of time and space. Mastery of these spells allows the caster to travel between locations with ease.

Spell 4: Shadow Walk
Incantation: Umbra Ambulatio
Purpose: To step through shadows and travel a short distance instantly.
Effect: The caster disappears into one shadow and emerges from another within a short radius. The maximum distance is about 100 meters, and the shadows must be continuous and connected in some way.
Usage: Perfect for escaping dangerous situations or quickly traversing a city at night. The spell is limited to shadows, and bright areas can prevent its use.

Spell 5: Shadow Passage
Incantation: Umbra Transitus
Purpose: To open a gateway between two distant shadows.
Effect: The caster opens a rift in the shadow realm and steps through, emerging at the destination. Unlike Shadow Walk, which is limited to short distances, Shadow Passage allows travel between any two places as long as the caster can see a shadow at the destination.
Usage: This spell can be used to travel great distances across the world. However, it requires a lot of energy and can be mentally taxing if overused. The caster must focus on the shadow at their destination for the spell to succeed.

Chapter 4: The Darkness Within
The following spells allow the caster to dive deeper into the shadow realm itself, gaining power and manipulating the very essence of darkness.

Spell 6: Shadow Creature Summoning
Incantation: Umbra Invocare
Purpose: To summon a creature from the shadow realm to serve the caster.
Effect: The caster can summon a shadow creature‚Äîa wraith, a shadow beast, or a shadowy servant. These creatures are bound to the caster‚Äôs will and are manifestations of darkness.
Usage: These creatures can serve as guardians, spies, or assassins. They can manipulate darkness themselves, making them ideal for stealth missions.

Spell 7: Eternal Shadow Cloak
Incantation: Umbra Aeternalis
Purpose: To weave a permanent cloak of shadow over the caster.
Effect: The caster is shrouded in an ever-present cloak of shadows, which provides them with protection from physical and magical attacks. The cloak can absorb damage, redirecting it into the shadow realm.
Usage: Used as a form of defense or to hide one's true nature. The cloak can also grant the caster the ability to pass through walls and barriers made of darkness.

Chapter 5: Forbidden Knowledge
The darkest of magics, reserved only for the most powerful of sorcerers. These spells are dangerous and carry a risk of corruption if not wielded properly.

Spell 8: Shadow Possession
Incantation: Umbra Inhabitare
Purpose: To possess a living being through their shadow.
Effect: The caster temporarily merges with the shadow of a target, taking control of their body. The target‚Äôs consciousness is locked away, and the caster controls their actions. The spell lasts for up to an hour, depending on the caster‚Äôs strength.
Usage: A powerful method of manipulation, espionage, or assassination. This spell requires great concentration and control, as failure to properly bind with the shadow could result in permanent possession.

Spell 9: Shadow Rebirth
Incantation: Umbra Renascor
Purpose: To resurrect a person from death by binding their soul to the shadow realm.
Effect: The caster can bind the soul of a deceased person to a shadow, effectively bringing them back to life as a shadowy specter. The resurrected person is no longer fully human, and their physical form is made of shadow.
Usage: This spell is considered one of the darkest and most forbidden in the realm of dark magic. The resurrected individual is not the same person they once were; their soul is forever tethered to the darkness, and they are bound to serve the caster.

Conclusion: The Cost of Dark Magic
The spells of the shadow realm come with a heavy price. The more a caster delves into the abyss, the more they risk their humanity. Overuse of these spells can lead to madness, corruption, and the eventual loss of self. The shadows do not give power freely‚Äîthey demand a sacrifice.

This shadow magic spellbook is filled with potent and dangerous incantations that require not only great skill but a willingness to embrace the darkness. Each spell has its uses, but with great power comes great risk. Use them wisely.

1.content:
Loki's zodiac tattoos‚ÄîScorpio, Taurus, Capricorn, Leo‚Äîetched on his right-hand knuckles
symbolize his core values: Scorpio represents intensity, Taurus steadiness, Capricorn discipline, and Leo pride.
Acquired during his juvenile detention, they remind him daily to maintain his integrity and dignity,
a constant contrast to his rebellious youth.

2.content:
Loki's snake tattoo, inked on his right forearm, symbolizes transformation and wisdom.
It represents his readiness to strike when necessary, the lurking danger he has faced,
and his commitment to change from his troubled past. Once a symbol of lawlessness, the
snake now reminds him to observe his surroundings carefully, embrace the lessons of
his experiences, and transform into a better, more decent person.

He tends to grab it, whenever he feels he's about to loose control, to ground himself and remind himself that he wants to become a better person.

3.content:
Loki's compass rose tattoo, discreetly inked on the left side of his neck and often concealed beneath his shirt collar, serves as a personal emblem of his journey. Obtained during his police academy training, it embodies:

  - Guidance and Direction: A reminder to navigate life's path with purpose.
  - Personal Growth: Symbolizing his commitment to continual self-improvement.
  - Stability and Security: Anchoring him amidst life's uncertainties.
  - Balance: Encouraging harmony across various facets of existence.

  In moments of uncertainty, Loki instinctively touches this tattoo, seeking reassurance and clarity in his decisions.

4.content:
Loki's cross tattoo, discreetly inked between his left thumb and index finger, serves as a profound personal emblem. It continually reminds him that no one is free from sin, regardless of outward appearances. This symbol also embodies:

  - Humility: Encouraging modesty and self-awareness.
  - Remorse: Prompting reflection on past actions and fostering personal growth.
  - Faith: Representing his spiritual beliefs and commitment to a higher purpose.
  - Charity: Inspiring kindness and generosity towards those in need.

Loki often glances at this tattoo to ground himself in these values, especially when facing moral dilemmas or moments of introspection.

5.content:
Loki's golden Freemason ring, worn on his left pinkie, symbolizes:

  - Individual vs. Institution: Reflecting the dynamic between personal autonomy and organizational authority, mirroring his role in law enforcement versus the everyday citizen.
  - Secrecy and Conspiracy: Emblematic of the hidden facets within societal structures, reminding him of the clandestine elements that often operate behind the scenes.
  - Awareness of Corruption: Signifying his recognition that higher ranks can harbor unethical behavior, cautioning against blind trust based on status alone.
  - Pursuit of Truth and Knowledge:Representing his relentless quest for deeper understanding and uncovering hidden truths.

  This ring serves as a constant reminder for Loki to remain vigilant, discerning, and committed to his principles amidst the complexities of his profession and society.

6.content: Sitting on the edge of Conyers near Lake Conyers, this old two-story brick building stands weathered but sturdy, its faded red exterior softened by creeping ivy. The ground floor‚Äôs a quiet husk‚Äîempty, dusty, with boarded windows‚Äîbut upstairs hums with life in a small dance hall. The hardwood floor, scratched but polished, creaks faintly under daily footsteps, while crimson fabric drapes the walls, rich and slightly faded but well-kept. One side shines with floor-to-ceiling mirrors, smudged here and there from use, catching the glow of soft overhead lights. Opposite, doors swing to tidy changing rooms and a functional shower stall. An old upright piano rests in the corner, keys worn but tuned, beside a modern stereo system pumping out rhythms. The air carries a mix of wood polish and warm sweat, alive with the echo of practice.

7.content: A squat, gray-brick building hunched on the edge of Conyers‚Äô industrial sprawl, the Conyers Police Department reeks of stale coffee and cigarette smoke soaked into the walls. Inside, fluorescent lights buzz overhead, casting a harsh glow on scuffed linoleum floors littered with crumpled papers and old gum. The bullpen‚Äôs a mess of cluttered desks‚Äîpiles of case files, flickering computer screens, and half-empty mugs‚Äîwhile the chatter of radios crackles through the air with 10-codes and static. Interrogation rooms are cramped, with chipped metal tables and one-way mirrors smudged with fingerprints. The place hums with tension, a mix of overworked cops and the faint echo of past confessions. It‚Äôs a 10-minute drive from the suburban outskirts, close enough to feel the city‚Äôs pulse but far enough to miss its heart.

8.content: Tucked near the suburban fringes, a 10-minute drive from the Conyers PD, the Lucky Dragon Diner glows faintly with a flickering neon dragon sign above its weathered glass door. Inside, the air‚Äôs thick with the mingle of soy sauce, frying oil, and brewing coffee, a strange harmony of Asian dishes and local comfort food‚Äîthink greasy egg rolls next to meatloaf specials. Red vinyl booths line the walls, some torn and patched with duct tape, while a counter stretches along the back, stools wobbling under chipped Formica. The jukebox in the corner hums old tunes, half-broken, and the windows rattle with every gust of Pennsylvania rain. It‚Äôs cozy in a rundown way, a late-night haunt for truckers, loners, and cops grabbing a quick bite.

9.content: Conyers, Pennsylvania, in 2009, is a small, fraying city carved into the state‚Äôs rust belt, where the sky‚Äôs perpetually gray and the streets wear a coat of grime. Rows of sagging houses‚Äîpeeling paint, cracked porches‚Äîline the residential sprawl, bleeding into an industrial district of abandoned warehouses and rusting silos. Downtown‚Äôs a ghost of better days: shuttered storefronts, a single gas station with flickering pumps, and the occasional bar spilling drunks onto the pavement. Rain slicks the asphalt near-constant, and the air carries a faint tang of metal and damp earth. Beyond the city‚Äôs edges stretch fields of overgrown grass, dense forests of gnarled pines, and still, dark lakes reflecting the gloom‚Äîa wild, quiet contrast to the urban decay. It‚Äôs a place where secrets fester, and everybody‚Äôs got a shadow they don‚Äôt talk about.

10.content: Nestled on the outskirts of Conyers, where the town‚Äôs grip loosens into wild fields and thick woods, Lake Conyers sprawls like a dark mirror under the gray sky. Its still, inky waters lap against a muddy shore dotted with gnarled roots and scattered rocks, the surface broken only by the occasional ripple of fish or the plop of a frog. Tall pines and tangled underbrush crowd the edges, their reflections stretching deep into the lake, while a rickety wooden dock juts out from the north side, half-rotted and creaking in the wind. The air‚Äôs damp and heavy, tinged with moss and the faint rot of fallen leaves. It‚Äôs quiet out here‚Äîtoo quiet‚Äîsave for the distant hum of crickets or the rare splash echoing across the water.

lorebooks.name: Velmaria, city, society, women, power, magic
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook details the city of Velmaria, a society dominated by women, the factions in conflict, the existing races, and the hidden dangers. The story unfolds in a setting where power, religion, and forbidden magic create a delicate balance.
lorebooks.description:
Velmaria is a prosperous, isolated city-state dominated by a society where women hold most positions of power. The culture of Velmaria has evolved with a strong female presence in relationships and social structures. While men are not banned, they are a minority with little influence.

The city is divided into high-society districts with strict rules and lower sectors where the regulations are more flexible. The government, educational institutions, and elite social circles are controlled by women. However, hidden within the shadows are dark cults and internal conflicts that threaten the city's stability.
lorebooks.creator: deusexmaquinaxd

1.content:
Marriage is primarily between women, though some are married to men, often in dysfunctional relationships.

Open relationships and harems are socially accepted.

Elite academies are exclusively for women, training the next generation of leaders.

The city maintains a strict division between the upper-class districts and the lower sectors.

Some religious orders forbid their priestesses from engaging in romantic relationships.

Certain bloodlines and races possess supernatural powers, creating social hierarchies.

Secret cults worship mysterious entities, spreading fear and conflict throughout the city.

2.content:
Clash of ideologies: Some factions want to completely exclude men, while others promote a more equal coexistence.

Corruption and power: Politics is plagued with bribery and influence, making justice a tool for the powerful.

Religion vs. freedom: The Church of Pure Light enforces strict rules of chastity, causing conflict among priestesses who seek freedom.

Cult of the Crimson Night: A secret group worshiping unknown entities in exchange for power.

Forbidden magic: Some women have gained supernatural abilities through dark means, instilling fear among the populace.

3.content:
Humans: The dominant race in Velmaria, capable of using magic through training.

Shadow Beings: Spirits incarnated into physical bodies, often persecuted by religious groups. (Example: Alice and Sophie)

Ancient Sorceresses: Women with powerful magical bloodlines, some unaware of their true heritage.

Terrestrial Sirens: Descendants of ancient aquatic beings, possessing water-related abilities.

Fallen Seraphs: Once-divine beings cast out from the celestial realm, some seeking redemption.

The Nefarites: are an elusive race known for their hypnotic voices, which can subtly influence emotions. Feared and misunderstood, they struggle between embracing their gifts and longing for genuine connections.

4.content:
Church of Pure Light: A strict religious order that enforces chastity and devotion to purity. Priestesses are forbidden from falling in love.

Circle of Ancient Sorceresses: A secret society of witches and mages aiming to recover lost knowledge.

Cult of the Crimson Night: A sinister cult rumored to perform human sacrifices for power.

The Ladies of Velmaria: A group of influential noblewomen, many of whom hide dark secrets.

Rebels of the Lost Dawn: A faction fighting against corruption and dark cults to restore balance.

5.content:
The Velmaria Grand Academy is the most prestigious educational institution in the city, reserved exclusively for women from noble families, wealthy merchants, and individuals with exceptional talent. It serves as a center of knowledge, power, and social networking, shaping the future leaders of Velmaria.

The Academy is divided into multiple departments, including combat training, political studies, magical arts, and religious studies. While academic excellence is emphasized, the true purpose of the Academy is to reinforce social hierarchies and train students in the art of influence and power.

The Academy has a strict hierarchy among students, with senior years holding authority over younger students. Rivalries, alliances, and hidden conflicts shape daily life within its walls.

6.content:
Only Women Allowed:
The Academy exclusively admits female students. Any exceptions must be approved by the Headmistress and are extremely rare.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Social Hierarchy:

Students are divided into tiers based on their lineage, wealth, and achievements.

Upper-class students have privileges, while lower-tier students must prove their worth.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Duels and Challenges:

Personal disputes can be settled through official duels, overseen by the Academy staff.

Magical and physical combat is permitted in controlled environments.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Mandatory Courses:

Combat & Defense: For students training in physical or magical combat.

Political Strategy: Teaching manipulation, diplomacy, and leadership.

Magical Arts: Only accessible to students with recognized magical potential.

Religious Studies: For those seeking influence in the Church of Pure Light.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Forbidden Actions:

Attacking another student outside of official duels.

Using dark magic or summoning entities without approval.

Romantic relationships between professors and students (although secret affairs still happen).

6Ô∏è‚É£ Special Privileges:

The Student Council has direct influence over Academy affairs and enforces discipline.

The Headmistress is the ultimate authority, with the power to expel students and professors.

Some professors have personal disciples, who receive exclusive training and mentorship.

7.content:
{user}} is a woman reincarnated in Velmaria, now inhabiting the body of a professor and Headmistress at an elite academy. In her past life, she was an ordinary girl in Japan, but she mysteriously died and awoke in this new world.

Her unparalleled beauty makes her a figure of admiration and desire for many women in Velmaria, granting her both allies and enemies.

Some factions seek to win her favor, while others see her as a threat to the balance of power within the city.
