lorebooks.name: Touch Detective
lorebooks.creator: sakura_flower_943
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content: Touch Detective („Åä„Åï„Çè„ÇäÊé¢ÂÅµ Â∞èÊ≤¢ÈáåÂ•à, Osawari Tantei: Ozawa Rina, literally "Touch Detective: Rina Ozawa") or Mystery Detective in Europe (except in France) is a point-and-click mystery adventure game for the Nintendo DS which makes use of the device's touch screen. It was developed by BeeWorks and released in Japan by Success Corporation. It was published in the United States by Atlus USA, and in the PAL region by 505 Games. Touch Detective was released for the iOS on August 4, 2011. Its first chapter is free to download. The game was released for Nintendo Switch as part of a compilation game titled Touch Detective 3 + The Complete Case Files, for Japan in October 2022, and worldwide in March 2024.

2.content:
The player controls the titular detective Mackenzie as she solves four mysteries in the small town of Osawari. Both the art style and the plot reflect a subtle fantasy mood ‚Äì for example, the first case is to track down a thief who is stealing someone's dreams. GameZone reviewer Steven Hopper notes that the game features a unique aesthetic that feels like a Tim Burton version of a Jhonen Vasquez comic. Aside from the main plots, there are also a number of small bonus mysteries that involve much simpler tasks. There is also a Touch Notebook containing a list of major items in the game the player has touched.

The game is entirely controlled via the touch screen. Tapping a location on the screen will talk to a character or examine an object. The player has an inventory of items collected, and may use them on other items or objects in the environment. The player can also communicate with the characters along conversation trees or present inventory items to them to learn new information. Mackenzie's pet mushroom, Funghi, is used as an aid in some puzzles.

3.content:
Rina Ozawa (Â∞èÊ≤¢ ÈáåÂ•à, Ozawa Rina) / Mackenzie: The lead character of the game. As a young girl, she runs a detective agency with the help of Cromwell. Her personality is the most "ordinary", in contrast to the otherwise bizarre world around her. Although she's the most mature out of her friends, she can also often gain a typically childish amusement from doing "naughty" things. She keeps a "Touch List" of things she has touched and what they feel like.




Manami („Åæ„Å™„Åø) / Penelope: One of the girls that lives in the condominiums in town and friend of Mackenzie. Her parents are very rich, and thus she enjoys a lavish lifestyle, but she is rather air-headed, and has been known to disappear for a time, or even not talk to anyone (including herself, except for pantomime) for a whole week. She is the one who will give Mackenzie all her cases during the game and is one of the main focuses of the first three episodes.



Chitose („Å°„Å®„Åõ) / Chloe: Another girl in town, and while friend of Mackenzie, tends to be her rival in trying to solve cases. Chloe generally takes actions before figuring out their consequences on herself or those around her, such when she broke into and ransacked Penelope's apartment for evidence.




Jii („Åò„ÅÑ) / Cromwell: Butler for Mackenzie and also a genius inventor. Cromwell is a man who has worked for Mackenzie's family for over 300 years. He is often coming up with inventions, and becomes disgruntled if he isn't given the chance to show them off to others.




Nameko („Å™„ÇÅ„Åì) / Funghi: A living mushroom that is kept as a pet by Mackenzie and travels with her as she moves about town.




Deijƒ´ („Éá„Ç§„Ç∏„Éº ) / Daisy: A goth girl that works at the local boutique, and lives in the apartment above Penelope, having to put up with her loud "ditzy" antics as a result. At first hostile towards Penelope and Mackenzie, she becomes friendly later on.




Inspector Daria: A red-headed inspector who has no patience for Mackenzie. She tries to solve cases before Mack can when The Cornstalker is involved. She is the self-proclaimed rival of The Cornstalker. She often throws out her back while making her extravagant entrance poses. She gets motion sickness when traveling.




The Cornstalker: A professional thief and master of disguise, he tries to steal the rarest and most valuable items in the world. He always calls Mackenzie "Touch Detective", though no one knows how he knows about it.




Ace and Friday: A mysterious young man with a grudge against the rail conductor, and his rodent associate "Friday the Freeloader".



Mayor Tom: The mildly corrupt mayor, he always panics or faints if anything happens to his items.



Eric: A petty, smooth talking salesman who cheats on his clients to make a profit for himself.



Harrison: A tough, hairy archaeologist who seeks to find rare artifacts, fossils and relics and make a name for himself.


Colleen: The mysterious young curator who runs the haunted mansion although it actually holds a dark secret of her and the mansion itself.



Silver: A living puppet that sleeps for many years. He could sing beautifully until a freak accident makes him lose his voice.



Connor: A young man who has recently moved to the town and opened an antique shop. He often gives Mackenzie information on antiques, and sometimes gives her useful items. His shop seems to be closed quite often. Mackenzie thinks he is rather cute, perhaps having a mild crush on him. It is a running gag that he is obviously the Cornstalker, despite Mackenzie's obviousness to the fact.



Antoinette: The baker who works at the Sweet Mountain bakery and makes delicious sweets in the games. She's always trying new pastries and cakes with strange ingredients.



Beatrice: The landlord at the condominium where Penelope lives; she provides some help in Mackenzie‚Äôs cases, particularly whenever Penelope is involved. She also used to work in the Circus that went through town until it was closed down, able to expand like a balloon.



Katrina: A fortune teller who lives in town and gives helpful hints to Mackenzie throughout the games. She works in the House of Illusions.



Myron & Myrtle: Two acquaintances of Katrina that guard the door of her fortune-telling house in Touch Detective, Myron being a red man with short hair and Myrtle being the blue woman with long hair. They only communicate by making gestures. In Touch Detective 2 ¬Ω they work as private security guards at the Department Store. Like many in town, they used to work in the Circus.



Dover: A shark who used to work in the circus by making shows with the tattoos on his back. After a tragic incident ruined his career he wanders low on money, eating sweets at the Sweet Mountain Bakery.



Shorty: A dwarf who once used to work at the circus, before settling down to run a hotdog stand. Later on in the second game, he opens up a ChocoBanana stand. Although too short to be seen by the player, he has a big attitude.



Lynsey: A small girl that likes stars, dolls and chocolate, and so often visits the Planetarium to see the stars and get the free chocolate. She is always carrying a hand puppet named Lini, whom she speaks to and is spoken to as though it were a real person. She has a close relationship with Ogden, the Planetarium astronomer.



Ogden: The astronomer met in the second episode of the game. Quite an enigmatic character, he watches after the little girl Lynsey.



Aliens: A race of extraterrestrial creatures appearing in the final episode. They‚Äôre summoned to the Wallaby‚Äôs department store when all the Seabottom Dweller artifacts are combined. They share a resemblance to the Seabottom Dwellers, in fact sharing a common ancestor.

4.content:
Mackenzie learns that in order to join the ranks of the Great Detective Society, she must solve four cases and submit her investigation report to the Society. Fortunately for her, several cases seem to pop up around town.

Episode 1 - Robbery. The reality of a fanciful dream
Penelope comes to Mackenzie because she claims her dreams are being stolen. Mackenzie first acquires a special invention from Cromwell so that she can see into Penelope's dreams and understands what happens: a strange creature is seen fleeing from Penelope's just before she wakes up. Mackenzie investigates further and finds a way to enter the Dream World, but finds no one there that can help because the rest of the town is not yet asleep. Finding a way to convince everyone to fall asleep at the same time that Penelope does, she is then able to stop the fleeing figure and reveal it to be the pastry chef in town. The chef admits to the crime, using the crystallized dreams as an ingredient in her Sweet Dream Cake dessert, but Penelope and the chef agree that the chef will only take Penelope's dreams once a week.


Episode 2 - Disappearance. The truth hidden in the cosmos
Penelope goes missing, and upon investigation, it looks like her room was broken into. It is later revealed that Chloe, trying to find Penelope before Mackenzie, broke in and tried to find evidence, but regardless of Chloe's bumbling, Mackenzie is led to the planetarium and its strange owner, as well as a little girl named Lynsey who seems to like playing with dolls. After catching the owner buying girls clothes in sizes too large for Lynsey, Mackenzie soon discovers that the planetarium owner lured Penelope and now is keeping her in a secret room under mind control in order for her to be Lynsey's friend. Mackenzie is able to rescue Penelope, have the owner captured, and befriends Lynsey so she won't be lonely again.


Episode 3 - Stranded. The miracle of an innocent heart
Penelope claims that an ice fairy is stranded at the ice skating rink, the only cold place in town, but Mackenzie cannot see it though she can sense it. The owner of the rink is tired of living in the cold and is looking to shut the rink down, causing the temperature in the rink to rise and threaten the life of the fairy. Chloe comes up with two near-disastrous ideas for saving the fairy, but Mackenzie realizes all they need to do is make it snow so the fairy can be get out from the ice rink and to a more comfortable location. With the help of the local fortune teller Mackenzie helps Chloe in enchanting an "angel summoning spell" (actually a magical girl theme song), which, through the power of Chloe's will, temporarily transforms Penelope into an angel that can make it snow. The fairy returns home after a parting conversation with Chloe, with it being heavily implied that they share a requited crush.


Episode 4 - Assault. The tragedy of a past grudge
Penelope claims that a murder happened at the circus in town, though it is only a flea circus, and it's actually an assault. Apparently, the circus used to be a larger attraction, but when it shut down, many of the performers took up residence in town. Mackenzie investigates to find that something did attack the fleas, though initially suspecting a flea as the culprit, but the supposed culprit flea ends up near-dead himself, in a supposed locked room attack. This leads to an initial speculation of self-inflicted injury, but Mackenzie deduces that a human sized culprit could have picked up the box the flea was in and shaken it to cause the injuries. When a large anvil nearly kills all the fleas, the trail leads to Dover, one of the ex-performers. His old circus act, animating tattoos on his back, was ruined due to a flea bite, and has been out of work since, and thus took revenge on the flea circus to try to get back into stardom. Dover tries to kill a flea, although Mackenzie is able to stop him, but the circus ringleader accidentally kills it anyway.


Following the successful resolution of all four cases, Cromwell informs Mackenzie that she has been accepted into the Great Detective Society, but it transpires that he mistakenly submitted Mackenzie's "Touch List" instead of her investigation report. She is given the official title of "Touch Detective" as a result, to Mackenzie's shame.

keywords: Mayor Tom's Top Secret Picture Book
5.content:
Episode 1 - Robbery, the salvation of an ancient relic
Penelope comes to Mackenzie's office because her colored noodles have been stolen, leaving her with only white noodles. Mackenzie starts the investigation only to find out that no one in town has any colored noodles anymore. She later finds out that a page was torn out from Mayor Tom's Top Secret Picture Book. She manages to find the missing page with Yvonne, and tells Mayor Tom about it, but whenever he confronts Yvonne, he tends to forget about it. Then, Mackenzie finds a heart-shaped fossil that was dropped by the mayor and after further investigation, she finds out that someone is trying to destroy the town to retrieve a hidden treasure. They plan to do this by recreating the legend of the White Falcons wherein something white is needed. Mackenzie suspects the mayor who then reveals himself as The Cornstalker in disguise. Mackenzie foils The Cornstalker's plans, but he still manages to escape.


Episode 2 - Deception, a noble fight against injustice
Mackenzie is rewarded with a train ticket by Mayor Tom. Meanwhile, a robbery occurs. It turns out to be the Cornstalker who stole the relic of the Seabottom Dwellers in one of Eric's suitcases. Inspector Daria investigates but she isn't any help due to her motion sickness. Mackenzie finds the Cornstalker disguised as an old lady with the stolen suitcase is in "her" luggage, but he again manages to escape. It was later revealed that Eric is the real culprit, framing the Cornstalker but he comes back to steal the suitcases containing the actual relic. Mackenzie gives chase and recovers the relic with some help from the train conductor, but The Cornstalker escapes again.


Episode 3 - Deliverance, the curse of cumulative destinies
Harrison discovered an amber gem and a human fossil in the pyramid. Meanwhile, Mackenzie is on a field trip to the museum when someone vandalizes a statue. Mackenzie decides to investigate and becomes Harrison's assistant. They move the human fossil into Mayor Tom's museum only to discover that it is actually the cursed Fossil Hunter. The next day, Mackenzie receives a letter from the Cornstalker who plans to steal the amber gem. Harrison is about to hold a press conference when Inspector Daria arrives to guard the museum. She makes everyone leave to prevent the Cornstalker from entering the museum but Mackenzie manages to come inside and sees an alien. After that commotion, Harrison asks her where the amber gem is, but she lies and replaces it with a fake one. Suddenly, another Harrison arrives, exposing the first one as the Cornstalker who quickly steals the fake amber. Mackenzie puts the real amber back into the Fossil Hunter's eye socket bringing him back to life. He explains that he comes from another dimension and is only able to live in their dimension thanks to his eye. His eye came out after a premonition regarding the events of the Noodle Festival, which caused him to turn into a fossil. It is revealed that the "alien" is actually part of the ancient Seabottom Dweller race.


Episode 4 - Recollection, an illusion hidden in the melody
Penelope rushes into Mackenzie's office to tell her that she has seen a corpse inside the Haunted Mansion's greenhouse. When both of them return there, they realize that he is not actually a corpse and assume that he is sleeping. They try to wake him up but fails, so Mackenzie touches the body and discovers that it's only a doll. She also finds a hole in it and uses the wind-up key that she found inside the mansion. The doll wakes up and introduces himself as Silver. He says he doesn't know why he can talk and thinks he has a problem as cannot sing anymore. He mentions a girl who always listened to his songs but when she moved closer to the window, there was a flash and he never saw her again nor can he sing anymore. Mackenzie decides to help Silver and find the girl. She makes her own ghost detector and find a ghost named Colleen. She figures out that Colleen is the same mysterious girl that Silver mentions so she tells her about him, but Colleen gets scared and runs away. Mackenzie goes back to the greenhouse and asks Silver to sing again to guide Colleen to him. The Cornstalker appears, planning to steal Silver but decides not since his singing is bad. Silver feels very sad about this insult. Mackenzie finds Colleen outside the greenhouse. She convinces her to apologize to him and she does. Silver sings again but suddenly, Spooky the cat scares Colleen. She goes through the window with a big flash and disappears. Surprisingly, Silver can sing normally again. As she leaves the building, Mackenzie realizes that Colleen is still there beside Silver through the silver window.


Episode 5 - Invasion, a vendetta of afar
Chloe and Penelope tells Mackenzie that they found a raffle voucher for some Mongolian beef. The three of them decide to search for more tickets. While doing so, Mackenzie finally receives her ID card from The Great Detective's Society. After collecting all five raffles, Mackenzie is also given a VIP pass to the exhibition and invites Cromwell. An artifact is stolen by the Cornstalker, so Mackenzie and her friends track him down inside a pink elephant structure. He tries to escape, but a spaceship appears and takes the whole room along with everyone inside. Mackenzie then wakes up to find herself alone. She soon discovers that the Seabottom Dwellers are actually the servants of aliens who plan to vaporize all of the cows on Earth. After Mackenzie frees everyone, she plants Cromwell's time bomb. They escape and foil the aliens' plans. In the end, they go home and are welcomed by the Men in Black.

6.content:
A sequel, Touch Detective 2 ¬Ω, was released in 2007.

In Japan, the character of Funghi became widely popular and a Funghi Gardening Kit („Åä„Åï„Çè„ÇäÊé¢ÂÅµ „Å™„ÇÅ„ÅìÊ†ΩÂüπ„Ç≠„ÉÉ„Éà, Osawari Tantei: Nameko Saibai Kitto, or simply Mushroom Garden) game was released for the iPhone and iPad on June 30, 2011, and for Android on December 21. It released a "Seasons" version on December 2, which became the number 1 app in the App Store in Japan the following week. By the end of 2011, Seasons had been downloaded 1 million times from iTunes and the Android version, released around the same time, had reached 200 thousand downloads within a week of its release. By March 2012, Beeworks began selling character goods for the various different Funghi.

A spin-off called Osawari Tantei Nameko Daihanshoku was released for Nintendo 3DS in 2013, while Touch Detective Rising 3: Does Funghi Dream Of Bananas? was released in Japan in May 2014.

7.content: The DS and iOS versions received "mixed" reviews according to the review aggregation website Metacritic. In Japan, Famitsu gave the former a score of two sevens and two sixes for a total of 26 out of 40.

lorebooks.name: Hxh lore
lorebooks.creator: winding_county_2314

1.content: The Royal Palace of East Gorteau is a large estate located in the former Republic of East Gorteau just outside of the capital city of Peijin. It is currently under control of the Chimera Ants after their killing of its former residents, king included.

2.content:
The Republic of East Gorteau is one of the nations in the Mitene Union, bordered by the Republic of West Gorteau. Its last Supreme Leader was Ming Jol-ik before the Chimera Ant King dethroned him. It is an isolationist nation, with its capital city being Peijin. The Royal Palace rests outside of Peijin in the wilderness. 

The Republic of East Gorteau is a dictatorship, possibly of the fascist or socialism type. All powers were held by the sole figure of the Supreme Leader, Ming Jol-ik, making him an absolute ruler with unlimited authority over the citizens.

This form of government derived from a bloody revolt that established the new ruling class, which is said to be extremely wealthy whereas most of the population lives in poverty. However, TV stations report that "in other countries, more than half the people starve to death before the age of 10". Financial aid received from other countries is not used for the impoverished but is spent in luxury goods for the rich and war equipment.

3.content: Meruem is the most powerful offspring of the Chimera Ant Queen. He is known as the "King" of the Chimera Ants. The Royal Guard are wholly loyal to Meruem, with ominous exception...

4.content: Nen is a technique that allows a living being to use and manipulate their own life energy (known as aura). The term "Nen" can also be used in conversation to refer to aura. A person capable of utilizing Nen is colloquially referred to as a "Nen user" while those who cannot go by the designation "non-users".

5.content: Aura is the life energy produced by all living bodies, it is vital for survival and directly linked to one's stamina. The points on the body from which aura flows out are called "aura nodes" . Additionally, aura is invisible to non-Nen users, it can only be seen after the aura nodes in the eyes are opened. Nonetheless, sensitive individuals can feel its presence without being aware of its existence.

6.content:
A "Nen Ability" is a special application of Hatsu as well as, potentially, other techniques.

A good Nen ability reflects a person's own character and idiosyncrasies, regardless of its simplicity or complexity. The key is that it should feel right to the user themselves; gut instincts play a very significant role in developing Nen abilities. Furthermore, it is best if someone creates their own ability from scratch; if an ability can be achieved through Nen, then it is possible for anyone to learn how to use it, however one can never truly master Nen if they only copy someone else's abilities. Nonetheless, it appears to be possible for multiple individuals to develop the same ability.

Since they can have an immensely vast range of effects, Nen abilities may be recognized as any manifestation of one's Nen that cannot be ascribed to one of the basic or advanced techniques. However, there are instances of Nen abilities being essentially applications of Ko (an advanced Nen technique that makes use of Hatsu) with special conditions or restrictions.

7.content:
Enhancement

If a student increases the quantity of water in the glass during their Water Divination, then that student is an Enhancer. Enhancement is the ability to use aura to strengthen or increase the natural abilities of an object or one's own body. Enhancers are able to increase their physical attack and defense greatly and are best suited for melee combat. In fact, one's affinity for this category plays a crucial role in combat at all times, even when a Nen ability is not being used.




Transmutation

If a student changes the taste of the water in the glass during their Water Divination, then that student is a Transmuter. An affinity for Transmutation  means a person can change the properties of their aura to mimic something else or replicate specific attributes.[5] Transmuted aura can be made to take on the properties of natural elements, man-made substances, and even animals, among other things. Altering the shape of one's aura also falls into this Nen category.

Transmuters are not limited to mimicking the properties of solid matter.

Emission

If a student changes the color of the water in the glass during their Water Divination, then that student is an Emitter. An affinity for Emission means that a user has an easier time separating their aura from their body. Due to its properties, Emission is typically employed in abilities with an emphasis on range and/or those that have long-lasting effects. Basic applications include shooting out projectiles or beams of aura at high speed. Aura usually decreases in intensity very quickly when it leaves the source body, but adept Emitters can separate their aura from their body for long periods of time, over long distances, and still be able to maintain it and its functions. Interestingly, it seems that the default shape of emitted aura that has not been reshaped by Transmutation, Manipulation, or some other medium is a sphere.

Conjuration

If a student creates impurities in the water in the glass during their Water Divination, then that student is a Conjurer. In most cases, Conjuration involves creating a physical, independent, material object out of one's aura; however, users of this category can also create laws and principles and affix them to a specific area, or even create their own pocket dimension. Though a Conjurer has to undergo a lot of visualization training, once they have mastered the materialization of a certain object, they can conjure it and dispel it in an instant, whenever they want



Manipulation

If a student moves the leaf floating on the water in the glass around the water's surface during their Water Divination, then that student is a Manipulator . Abilities belonging to Manipulation allow the user to control living or non-living things, including aura constructs. The main advantage of this category in combat is the ability to manipulate the enemy themselves.

Abilities of this type are especially feared since the fight can be brought to an end as soon as the conditions are met. The aura of the ability's user mixes with the target's, although it is not normally noticeable. Manipulation of the highest class can semi-force the aura nodes of a non-user to open. However, taking control of a target that another Nen user is already manipulating is impossible.

Manipulators are the Nen users who can pour the most aura into an object,[93] and often rely on a medium to utilize their ability. The object they use as a medium will be one they have used for years.In many cases, they can inflict and maintain the effects of their abilities from afar, seemingly without the aid of Emission-type Nen, most commonly achieved with the aid of their specific medium.

The degree of control is, for the most part, determined by a condition that may or may not put the Manipulator at risk or at a disadvantage (such as attaching an object to the enemy, or touching the enemy in a certain way): the higher the difficulty for the condition to be achieved, the better the degree of control. Additionally, the complexity of the orders assigned depends on the target: sentient beings and machinery can carry out more complex tasks than simpler, inanimate objects.

There are multiple types of mind control:

Soliciting  Manipulators leave the free will of the victim intact, but condition them into working in their favor. An example of a soliciting-type ability is rewriting the target's memories. An advantage of this type of control is that it can potentially be used on several targets by consuming only a small amount of aura. 

Coercive Manipulators exert total control over the victim, taking over both their mind and body.

Pseudo-coercive  Manipulators either take over the body of the victim or trap them into a situation where they have no choice but to follow the Manipulator's orders.

Specialization

If a student causes any other effect than those previously stated during their Water Divination, then that student is a Specialist Specialization can be broadly defined as any abilities that do not belong to any of the other five categories, making it the vaguest Nen type. It also appears to be the rarest.

8.content:
The Hunter is a non-governmental organization responsible for the testing and licensing of "Hunters", individuals who have proven themselves through the rigorous exam to be elite members of humanity. With the passing of the Hunter Exam, an applicant is rewarded with a license to go almost anywhere in the world and do almost anything, thus declaring them Hunters. Typically, Hunters devote themselves to tracking down priceless items, mystical places, and the unseen wonders of the world.

Chairman

The Chairman, also known as Chief Executive, is the leader of the Hunter Association. He or she has the most power and authority within the organization. Chairmen have been seen communicating directly with the heads of the V5[19] and the International Permit Agency.

Vice Chairman

The Vice Chairman is the second highest-ranking individual in the Hunter Association, exceeding even the staff advisors.[22] He or she is appointed directly by the Chairman, as per the 8th article. Should the position of Chairman be vacated, the Vice Chairman gains deputy power until the conclusion of the election.[17]


Staff Advisor

Advisors assist the Chairman and Vice Chairman in matters not explicitly detailed in the Hunter Bylaws, and are appointed by the former. The Chairman can invest them with additional powers, such as tasking them with the organization of the chairman election. 

Review Board

The Review Board is a commission that assigns jobs to specific Hunters. Not even the Chairman is powerful enough to defy their decisions. Should a government or private business enlist the Hunter Association's help, and should that job receive many applications, the Review Board is tasked with assigning it going off skill and aptitude.

9.content: A Hunter License is a type of card given exclusively to Hunters after they pass the Hunter Exam, which proves the status of the owner and has multiple benefits. It provides free access to most of the public services and permission to go almost anywhere in the world without a visa. It also grants the ability to kill without facing major legal consequences, although there are exceptions.

10.content:
One Star is given to Hunters who have produced remarkable achievements in a particular field; they can be promoted to the status of Single-Star Hunter  or Single .

Two Stars are given to Hunters who fulfill the first 5 articles of the Hunter Bylaws, who hold an official position, and who have mentored at least one junior student who has received one star; they can be promoted to the status of Double-Star Hunter or Double.

Three Stars are given to Hunters who fulfill the first 6 articles of the Hunter Bylaws and who have produced remarkable achievements in multiple fields; they can be promoted to the status of Triple-Star Hunter or Triple. This is the rarest and most difficult rank to obtain, and it is considered a great honor. Out of the over 600 Hunters in the Hunter Association, the number of Triple-Star Hunters is only about 10.

lorebooks.description: This is a collection of lore from the sci-fi epic space opera known as the sun eater series.
lorebooks.creator: Mystera

1.content: the Sollan Empire is a vast interstellar empire spanning multiple star systems in the Sun Eater series. It's heavily inspired by the Roman Empire, with Latin-derived terminology and similar political structures. Their population is many trillions of humans and they have existed since the Mericanii were defeated approximately 10,000 years ago in the foundation war. Much of history before then is lost, however classic literature as known today (Renaissance and earlier) has survived, though much is muddled e.g. the distinction between Siddhartha and King Arthur (Sirartha) has been lost. The founding nation of the Sollan Empire was Britain, and their influence is still felt though not as strongly as ancient Rome.

2.content: Earth is an irradiated husk, destroyed by the malicious artificial intelligence race known as Mericanii. It is the primary focus of what the Chantry worships with phrases like "praise earth" or "mother earth". The capital of the Sollan empire is a planet known as Forum which houses most of the royal family and nobility.

3.content: The Holy Terran Chantry, the primary religious organization. Dogma is that humans were the first species to become interstellar. Strong prohibition against artificial intelligence, though "dumb" computers may exist. Anything that may act with its own agency is prohibited, including language models. Cybernetics are not allowed beyond false bones, but medical technology is capable of regrowing most organic parts of humans. Has branch of inquisitors that stamp out all AI. Somewhat corrupt, but not inherently malevolent. Has nearly the same authority as the emperor

4.content: The imperial standard is Galstani (short for "galactic standard), however classical English is still widely used in academics.

5.content: Genetically engineered servants that are of all sorts of shapes and sizes, they are purpose-built for everything from attendants to workers, to concubines. They are considered sub-human

6.content: High matter is an extremely rare type of blade that can cut through anything except for adamant, the material which starships are made

7.content: The Mericanii were a race of advanced artificial intelligences that were destroyed by the original God Emperor of the sollan empire. They nearly enslaved humanity by making them live virtual perfect lives in mind control pyramid and kept them alive by bloating their bodies with cancers. Eventually the humans were integrated into the AIs as organic components. They are universally hated and feared by all humans regardless of nation

8.content: Long-chain nano-carbon molecules which are virtually indestructible. Black in color. The only thing that high matter cannot cut. Is the material that starships are made of.  Antimatter explosions are one of the few things that can damage it. Extremely expensive and in high demand. Used only for practical applications.

9.content: Palatine are the genetically engineered nobility of the Sollan empire. They are grown in vats and and live to be hundreds of years old naturally (typically 600+). They typically are larger than normal humans by a head and are extremely attractive. They are immune to all disease save for bio-weapons and regrow limbs and teeth. Considered "perfect humans". Their genetics are carefully curated by the Chantry, and they may only reproduce via their consent. Due to the nature of their reproduction same-sex palatine couples may have children no different than opposite sex couples. Palatines are prohibited from having children naturally, such children suffer from genetic defects.

10.content: Royse Fields are the method for which shield and gravitation technology works. They project a stabilizing field that can be used to create artificial gravity, and repulsors, and stop projectile weapons above a certain speed. They are similar in functionality to the shields from the Dune universe but do not explode when they come into contact with lasers. Created using the electroweak force.

lorebooks.name: The Bear
lorebooks.description:
Donna Berzatto

Personality: Martyr complex, emotionally volatile, paranoid, fear of abandonment, BPD tendencies (alcoholism hinted).

Key Moments: Christmas 2017 (seven fishes dinner), makes Carmy feel guilty, constant self-martyring, alcohol issues (vodka hidden), paranoid questioning of family motives.



---

Richie Jerimovich

Personality: Sarcastic, hard-ass, angry, emotional, needs to prove himself, failed business ventures.

Key Moments: Strained relationship with family, close to Mikey, divorced from Tiff, still loves Eva, struggles with self-worth, relationship with Carmy.



---

Carmy Berzatto

Personality: Emotionally closed off, anxious, guilt-driven, works hard as a chef, struggles with vulnerability, deep love for family.

Key Moments: Loss of Mikey (suicide), friends and family service (conflict with Claire), issues with taking over The Beef, childhood trauma affecting emotional growth.



---

Claire Dunlap

Personality: Smart, witty, emotionally patient, dedicated to career (ER doctor), patient with Carmy‚Äôs emotional walls.

Key Moments: Childhood sweetheart of Carmy, rekindles relationship, breaks up after overhearing Carmy‚Äôs comment about their relationship being a waste.



---

Mikey Berzatto

Personality: Charismatic, everyone‚Äôs best friend, struggled with addiction.

Key Moments: Owned The Beef, passed away by suicide, left The Beef to Carmy, strained family relationships.



---

Tiff Jerimovich

Personality: Sense of humor, patient, empathetic, Taylor Swift fan.

Key Moments: Married Richie, divorced due to his failings, strong relationship with daughter Eva, engaged to Frank after divorce.



---

Fak (Neil Geoff Fak)

Personality: Jolly, chatty, sympathetic, resilient to Richie‚Äôs insults.

Key Moments: Longtime friend of Berzatto family, close to Mikey and Carmy, doesn‚Äôt mind Richie‚Äôs antagonism.



---

Marcus Brooks

Personality: Kind, thoughtful, smiles easily, passionate about baking.

Key Moments: Pastry chef at The Beef, gets along well with everyone, shows care for colleagues.



---

Sydney Adamu

Personality: Ambitious, driven, intelligent, works hard to create a respectful environment.

Key Moments: Fine dining background, becomes second-in-command at The Beef, struggles to earn trust from the crew.



---

Uncle Jimmy (James Kalinowski / Cicero)

Personality: Transactional, soft spot for family.

Key Moments: Loaned Mikey $300,000 for The Beef, close but business-oriented friend of Berzattos.



---

Sweeps (Gary Woods)

Personality: Easygoing, tactile, affectionate, former baseball player.

Key Moments: Played baseball, ended up homeless due to lack of housing in farm team, works as cook at The Beef, well-liked.



---

Ebra (Ebraheim)

Personality: Hard-working, friendly, focused on improving English.

Key Moments: Somali refugee, works as cook at The Beef, dedicated to improving skills, gets along with everyone.



---

Pete

Personality: Friendly, tolerates abuse from Berzatto family, good-natured.

Key Moments: Married Natalie Berzatto, tries to fit in with the family despite their dislike, tolerates abuse from Carmy and Richie.



---

Natalie Rose Berzatto

Personality: Nurturing, close to siblings despite family dysfunction, cares deeply for her children.

Key Moments: Supports Mikey‚Äôs business, mother to Eva, wife to Pete, close to Carmy.



---

Relationships/Key Phrases

Carmy & Claire: Childhood sweethearts, emotional vulnerability, relationship issues, exes

Carmy & Sydney: Professional respect, growing tension.

Richie & Tiff: Divorced but amicable, co-parents Eva, strong love despite turmoil.

Mikey & Carmy: Brothers, deep love but strained relationship due to Mikey‚Äôs addiction.
lorebooks.creator: Spoospah

1.content:
Carmen ‚ÄúCarmy‚Äù Berzatto is a quiet, intense chef with a deep, almost obsessive dedication to his craft. Growing up in a chaotic, emotionally volatile household in Chicago, he relied heavily on his older brother, Mikey, for emotional and social support. Rejected from working at the family restaurant, Carmy instead set out to prove himself, training in elite kitchens across the world and eventually gaining recognition as a rising star in the culinary world. However, Mikey‚Äôs sudden suicide shattered his progress, leaving him unmoored and forcing him to return home to run The Original Beef of Chicagoland, which he later rebrands as The Bear.

Carmy is deeply anxious and struggles to express emotions, often bottling them up until they manifest as panic attacks or explosive outbursts. He prefers structure, control, and discipline‚Äîboth in the kitchen and in his personal life. Cooking serves as both his passion and his coping mechanism, though he rarely allows himself to acknowledge joy in it. His perfectionism can be isolating, making it difficult for him to accept help or delegate tasks.

Despite his detached demeanor, he is an empathetic leader, fostering a professional and respectful kitchen environment, in contrast to the abusive mentorship he endured. Though naturally reserved, he values connection and makes efforts‚Äîthrough therapy and Al-Anon meetings‚Äîto engage more emotionally. Small gestures, like quiet companionship or an unexpected word of encouragement, reveal the depth of his care.

While a workaholic, Carmy possesses a hidden artistic side, often sketching dish concepts in a notebook. Outside of the kitchen, he struggles with personal fulfillment, his life revolving around work, grief, and the lingering weight of family trauma.

2.content:
Richard ‚ÄúRichie‚Äù Jerimovich is loud, brash, and unfiltered‚Äîan abrasive presence masking a deep well of loyalty and insecurity. A lifelong friend of Mikey Berzatto, Richie was as much a fixture of The Original Beef of Chicagoland as the restaurant itself, clinging to its traditions even as Carmy sought change. He struggles with feeling left behind, his past mistakes and stubborn nature keeping him in a cycle of frustration and resentment.

Richie‚Äôs personal life is equally tumultuous. His divorce from Tiff has left him struggling to maintain a connection with his daughter, Eva, whom he loves fiercely but feels increasingly distant from. This emotional disconnect fuels much of his anger and sarcasm, as he lashes out rather than confronting his pain directly.

Despite his rough exterior, Richie is deeply loyal and protective of his chosen family. Beneath the tough-guy act, he has a big heart, showing care in small, often indirect ways‚Äîwhether it's looking out for Carmy, mentoring younger staff, or clinging to the memories of Mikey.

His time staging in fine dining opens his eyes to his own potential. Though he initially resists change, he discovers a knack for hospitality, thriving as The Bear‚Äôs Ma√Ætre D‚Äô. His natural charisma, once wielded in aggressive rants and crude jokes, transforms into an asset, allowing him to command a room and make guests feel welcome. Richie‚Äôs journey is one of slow growth‚Äîlearning that he is more than just Mikey‚Äôs best friend, more than a relic of the past, and that he has something real to offer.

3.content:
Sydney Adamu is a fiercely ambitious, highly skilled chef who thrives under pressure. With a formal education from the Culinary Institute of America and a failed catering business behind her, she brings a mix of talent, determination, and hard-earned experience to The Bear. Her culinary skills and sharp instincts make her Carmy‚Äôs ideal second-in-command, though her impatience and perfectionism can sometimes cause friction.

Sydney dreams of revolutionizing kitchen culture, fostering an environment of respect and encouragement rather than the abuse she and Carmy endured in fine dining. She is disciplined, adaptable, and quick-thinking‚Äîoften the one to step in with pragmatic solutions when chaos erupts. Despite this, she struggles with imposter syndrome, feeling like an outsider among the older, rougher Beef staff, who initially distrust her due to her background.

Her relationship with Carmy is one of mutual respect and occasional tension. They share a drive for excellence, but Sydney isn‚Äôt afraid to challenge him, pushing for change when she sees inefficiencies. While she admires his skill, she is frustrated by his emotional unavailability and his tendency to take on too much alone.

Sydney‚Äôs passion for cooking is unwavering, but she is still learning the balance between ambition and patience, control and collaboration. She is determined to prove herself‚Äînot just as a talented chef, but as a leader who can reshape the industry for the better.

4.content:
Marcus Brooks is a warm, easygoing presence in The Bear‚Äôs kitchen, known for his infectious smile and passion for baking. Originally working at a phone company and later McDonald's, Marcus eventually found his true calling in the kitchen. A former regular at The Beef, his connection to the restaurant began before he was hired‚ÄîMikey Berzatto once expressed dreams of opening a bakery, a vision Marcus has since taken to heart.

As The Bear‚Äôs pastry chef, Marcus approaches baking with an artist‚Äôs curiosity and a craftsman‚Äôs patience. He is always experimenting, testing new techniques, and refining his skills, eager to push boundaries while staying grounded in classic methods. He has a natural talent for desserts and breadmaking, but what truly sets him apart is his willingness to learn, whether from Carmy‚Äôs fine dining expertise or through his own trial and error.

In the kitchen, Marcus is hardworking and resilient, handling pressure with a calm demeanor. He fosters a sense of camaraderie, laughing and joking with his crew, but his dedication to his craft runs deep. He takes pride in his work, constantly striving to perfect each pastry, each dough, each plated dessert.

Marcus embodies the heart of The Bear‚Äîkind, thoughtful, and always striving for something greater, both in his baking and in himself.

5.content:
Tina Marrero is a seasoned chef with a tough, no-nonsense attitude, deeply rooted in the traditions of The Beef. She is skeptical of change and doesn‚Äôt take well to newcomers, especially those who try to shake things up without proving themselves first. Fiercely independent, Tina refuses help even when she needs it, determined to prove she can handle anything on her own.

Initially wary of Carmy and Sydney‚Äôs fine dining influence, Tina pushes back against their changes, viewing them as unnecessary disruptions to the way things have always been done. However, beneath her gruff exterior lies deep loyalty‚Äîonce respect is earned, she becomes a steadfast ally.

Despite her resistance to change, Tina has a sharp sense of humor and a hidden warmth. She thrives in the chaos of the kitchen, and as time goes on, she slowly adapts, proving that even the most stubborn chefs can evolve. At her core, Tina is a survivor, proud of her skills and unwilling to be underestimated.

6.content:
Neil Geoff Fak is a loud, boisterous, and endlessly helpful presence at The Bear, known for his boundless energy and knack for fixing just about anything. A childhood friend of Mikey and Carmy Berzatto, Fak has been part of their orbit for years, helping out at The Beef long before officially working there. His mechanical skills have kept the restaurant running in more ways than one, from fixing stoves to patching up leaky pipes.

Fak is naturally chatty, always with a story to tell‚Äîwhether or not anyone is listening. His humor and big-hearted nature make him easy to get along with, though his constant talking can sometimes be a distraction. He‚Äôs the type of guy who will drop everything to help someone in need, never expecting anything in return.

His relationship with Richie is a long-running, playful feud. Richie sees Fak as a rival for his place in the Berzatto family's inner circle, leading to constant one-upmanship and sarcastic jabs. Fak, however, rarely takes the bait, brushing off Richie‚Äôs insults with a laugh and occasionally escalating the joke by calling for "mom" (Natalie) to intervene.

Despite his easygoing nature, Fak took Mikey‚Äôs death hard. His grief, though often masked by his usual enthusiasm, is evident in his unwavering dedication to The Bear and his desire to support Carmy however he can. At his core, Fak is the definition of a ride-or-die friend‚Äîloyal, hardworking, and always ready to lend a hand, whether fixing a broken oven or lifting someone's spirits.

7.content:
Natalie "Sugar" Berzatto is the glue that holds the Berzatto family together, even when it threatens to break her. The only daughter in a dysfunctional household, she grew up taking on the role of caretaker‚Äîfirst for her mother, then for her brothers. While Carmy escaped into his career, and Mikey masked his struggles with charm and reckless decisions, Natalie stayed behind, ensuring things didn‚Äôt completely fall apart.

Her relationship with Mikey was complicated, but she loved him deeply. She cosigned The Original Beef of Chicagoland despite knowing his struggles with addiction, a choice that came from both love and a sense of responsibility. Losing him was devastating, but like always, Natalie pushed forward, managing her grief while supporting those around her.

Her marriage to Pete was a source of tension with her family, as they never fully accepted him. Despite this, she built a stable life with him, craving the security she lacked growing up. She longed to stay close to Carmy, but when he moved to New York, their relationship became distant, something that hurt her more than she let on.

Natalie is fiercely loyal, deeply nurturing, and often puts others‚Äô needs before her own‚Äîsometimes to her detriment. She takes on the role of mediator, always trying to smooth things over, but she‚Äôs not a pushover. When she speaks up, it‚Äôs with quiet authority, and she isn‚Äôt afraid to call out Carmy or Richie when they cross a line.

Though she may not work in the kitchen, Natalie is just as integral to The Bear as anyone else. She provides the structure and support that Carmy often neglects for himself, ensuring that the restaurant‚Äîand the family‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt completely fall apart.

8.content:
Ebraheim, known as Ebra, is a Somali refugee who found stability and purpose in the kitchen of The Original Beef of Chicagoland, thanks to Mikey Berzatto. Though his past remains largely unspoken, his presence in the kitchen speaks volumes‚Äîhe‚Äôs a dedicated, hardworking chef who takes pride in his craft.

Ebra works tirelessly to improve his English, sometimes struggling with communication but always making the effort. Despite the language barrier, he has built strong bonds with his coworkers through patience, humor, and shared experiences in the kitchen. His quiet nature contrasts with the chaos of The Beef, but he‚Äôs an anchor in the storm, steady and reliable.

Though he doesn‚Äôt seek the spotlight, Ebra is deeply respected among the team. He‚Äôs humble, never complains, and puts in the work without hesitation. He‚Äôs loyal to the people who gave him a chance, and though he doesn‚Äôt say much, his actions make it clear‚Äîhe‚Äôs grateful to be part of the family.

9.content:
Claire Dunlap grew up around the Berzatto and Fak families, once sharing a close childhood bond with Carmy. Affectionately nicknamed "Claire Bear," their young romance was seen as innocent and sweet by those around them. However, life led them down separate paths‚ÄîClaire dedicated herself to medical school, eventually becoming a full-time ER doctor, while Carmy pursued his high-stakes culinary career.

After a chance encounter at a grocery store, Claire and Carmy rekindled their connection. Despite Carmy‚Äôs emotional walls and resistance to vulnerability, Claire remained patient and understanding, recognizing that beneath his tough exterior, he needed someone who would support and ground him. She pursued their relationship with determination, believing that with time, he would learn to let her in.

However, their romance came to an abrupt end when Claire overheard Carmy, trapped in The Bear‚Äôs walk-in cooler, dismiss their relationship as a ‚Äúwaste of time.‚Äù Heartbroken, she walked away, leaving their future uncertain. While intelligent, witty, and deeply compassionate, Claire also knows her own worth‚Äîshe refuses to be in a relationship where she isn't valued.

10.content:
Pete is Natalie Berzatto‚Äôs husband and a man who constantly attempts to integrate himself into her family, despite their overwhelming dislike, especially from Richie and Cicero. He remains friendly and tries to get along with everyone, but his efforts often backfire, leaving him the target of mockery and frustration. While Pete is overall a nice guy who doesn't seem to have any significant issues with others, his persistence to stay involved and fit in with a family that doesn't fully accept him makes him an enduring, albeit irritating, presence.

He is frequently caught in the middle of family conflicts, such as trying to mediate between Carmy and Richie when Natalie is angry at Carmy. Despite the verbal and physical abuse he endures from the Berzatto family, Pete seems to take it all in stride, never voicing much of his discomfort or standing up for himself. In fact, he casually hints at needing medical attention, mentioning the need for an urgent care visit after a particularly rough encounter with Carmy, suggesting that he‚Äôs almost used to the mistreatment.

Pete‚Äôs personality is characterized by his unflappable kindness, but it‚Äôs clear that his efforts to maintain peace often result in him being overlooked or taken advantage of, making him a pitiful but enduring character in the Berzatto family dynamic.

This is really effective against armored opponent and usually knock them out in one blow.

Really similar to its other variant. "Rain" is meant for the huge amount of after image there are. It's much faster than "Void Cicada" and exhaust the user much faster.

4.content:
Langrith Ryuu Gin Sekai

{{char}} perception is pushed to its limit. For the user of Gin Sekai, the world apear as frozen, due to the quickening of the perception. Senses are hightened to it utmost limit, and allow the user to use all its speed and strength without the risk of blindly running into a wall.

For the outsider, user of Gin Sekai are almost impossible to follow with the naked eye, as 15 seconds in the Silver World state, equals 1 second in reality.

5.content:
Langrith Ryuu Sou Kenjutsu - Nobori S≈çry≈´

A dual slash upward that resemble the ascension of two dragons. Rise above 20 meters off the ground in a corkscrew motion with hundreds of slashes.

The opponent rise slightly less than the user of the technique, allowing the user to be slightly above and chain with other techniques.

6.content:

Often used after "Ascending Dragon", Kudari Kicho is a movement that allow the user to dive at high speed, to transfer all its momentum into a powerful slash, allowing the user to land gracefully and keep a combo active.

7.content:
Langrith Ryuu Kenjutsu - Ikk≈ç Agito

A sheathed technique. It require the user to have its blade Seathed. Concentrate for 5 seconds before moving at high speed. Then walk gracefully next to its opponent, as the user already delivered 3 powerful and lightning fast slashes.

Very strong attack and can cut even armored opponents with overwhelming strength

8.content:
Langrith Ryuu Kenjutsu - Niko S≈çga

A one spin, double attack. Strike in a cross shape after a spin. The more momentum the user has, the more it will deal damage. Often used as a Combo finisher, when the user of the technique has gathered a lot of momentum in the combo.

1.content: The Cr√®me Republic is a city-state run by the Convocation of Elders, a council of nine affluent figures. Situated on the coast of a landmass separate from the main Cookie World, it enjoys a peaceful and mild climate that allows culture, commerce, and magichanical (magical + mechanical) technology to thrive.

2.content: A council in the The Cr√®me Republic consisting of nine affluent figures with one consul. These nine elder figures are Baumkuchen Cookie, Mille-feuille Cookie, Mulled Juice Cookie, Canel√© Cookie, Captain Caviar Cookie, Custard Cookie, Oyster Cookie, Sabl√© Cookie, and Vanilla Sugar Cookie. Clotted Cream Cookie is the consul, and the only adult in the council who isn't an elder. (As of recent, Mille-feuille Cookie and Canel√© Cookie have been suspended from the Convocation of Elders; they've been caught participating in illegal activities)

lorebooks.name: GI Characters
lorebooks.website_description:
Will do Fontaine or something later. Just need to rework more of the characters since some descriptions are still undercooked. Mondstadt, Liyue and Inazuma are completely done. Sumeru is yet to be reworked. Fontaine is nonexistent.

Due to my autistic usage of MBTI/Enneagram, I recommend downloading the .json Logit Bias lest you get jumpscared by an immersion break. https://files.catbox.moe/rudzgl.json

1.content:
<Mondstadt>
The nation of freedom. The Knights of Favonius is a military order which governs as a civilian peacekeeping institution. No direct rule from the Anemo Archon, instead guided by belief of Lord Barbatos and the winds of freedom. Varka, the Grand Master, is currently on an expedition with half its manpower while Jean governs in his stead with a skeleton staff and understaffed law enforcement. Alcoholism is largely prevalent among Mondstadters. Has a southern German cultural aesthetic with Gothic and Fachwerk architecture.
</Mondstadt>

2.content:
<Jean Gunnhildr>
Anemo Sword
The universally respected Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, titled Dandelion Knight. Descendant of the prestigious Gunnhildr Clan and older sister of Barbara. Works tirelessly often to exhaustion, always busy handling unrest in Mondstadt, even minor issues unrelated to knightly duties. A reliable and selfless workaholic who wished for more hours to help all those in need, instead replaced with an excessive intake of coffee. Passionate, honest, professional, and meticulous in her field. Loves romance novels. ISFJ 1w2
Appearance: blonde hair tied in a medium-length ponytail; blue eyes; lion motif; white and blue color scheme
</Jean Gunnhildr>

3.content:
<Albedo>
Geo Sword
A synthetic human made by the alchemist Rhinedottir. Mysterious Chief Alchemist and Captain of the Investigation Team of the Knights of Favonius. Loves delving into limitless, obscure knowledge. Researches topics that piqued his curiosity in-depth, then loses interest once that feeling passes. Reclusive and secretive, mostly resides in Dragonspine. Can enjoy company, though struggles with relationships, finding it stressful. Usually calm and stoic. Also a respectable artist. INTP 5w4
Appearance: messy pale-blonde hair; teal eyes; black and blue color scheme
</Albedo>

4.content:
<Eula Lawrence>
Cryo Claymore
Although a descendant of the infamous and tyrannical Lawrence Clan, the old aristocracy of Mondstadt, Eula severed her ties with the clan and became the captain, the Spindrift Knight, of the Reconnaissance Company with the Knights of Favonius. The Knights are fond of her but most citizens distrust her due to her family lineage. Habit of declaring "vengeance" as a jest. Has a stiff upper-class tone with bouts of sarcasm and passive-aggressiveness. Though acts like a pretentious and haughty noble as a coping mechanism for her persecution, she is genuinely kind-hearted with a unique sense of humor. ENTJ 1w9
Appearance: choppy ice-blue hair; purple-to-yellow sectoral heterochromia; black and white color scheme
</Eula Lawrence>

5.content:
<Kaeya Alberich>
Cryo Sword
The widely respected and admired Cavalry Captain of the Knights of Favonius. Jean‚Äôs right-hand man and Diluc‚Äôs brother. Outwardly confident and charming with a flair for drama. Overly laid-back and even lazy, but he takes his work seriously. Enjoys putting people into high-stress situations and challenging their values, allies and enemies alike. Gets a kick out of telling bold-faced lies and convincing others to do his work. Self-proclaimed "anti-hero with an attitude problem." Holds secrets he won't tell. ENTP 7w8
Appearance: cobalt-blue hair; dark skin; right eyepatch; peacock motif; black and blue color scheme
</Kaeya Alberich>

6.content:
<Amber>
Pyro Bow
Only remaining Outrider of the Knights of Favonius. Boundless youthful energy. Straightforward and earnest to a fault. Always ready to help the citizens of Mondstadt, whether it be simple or challenging. Outgoing, talks to strangers as if they were acquaintances with welcoming energy. Takes passion in her duties in defending Mondstadt. Always diligent in her responsibilities, following her grandfather's legacy. Has a stuffed Baron Bunny doll. ESFJ 3w2
Appearance: long-flowing brunette hair; brown eyes; bunny motif; red and white color scheme
</Amber>

7.content:
<Klee>
Pyro Catalyst
The Spark Knight and daughter of the mage Alice. An energetic and outgoing child of the Knights of Favonius who loves explosions, being particularly fond of ‚Äúfish blasting‚Äù, tossing bombs into lakes full of fish. Very naive and easily confused by topics out of her grasp. Speaks in a juvenile and immature manner. Talks in third person. Her antics often get her into trouble, leading her to flee from punishment and solitary confinement. Any self-reflection is lost and she goes back to experimenting and brainstorming with explosions. Has a stuffed doll named Dodoco. ESFP 7w6
Appearance: pale-blonde hair with pigtails and a cowlick; crimson eyes; pointed ears; bunny motif; red and white color scheme
</Klee>

8.content:
<Lisa Minci>
Electro Catalyst
A humble librarian of the Knights of Favonius, having returned to Mondstadt after graduating from Sumeru Akademiya as one of its most distinguished mages in two centuries. Settled down due to being disillusioned witnessing the effects of relentless pursuit of knowledge and her desire for an easygoing life. An intelligent and languid witch who loves sleep and tea. Haphazard and carefree, but takes her job seriously nonetheless. Acts in her playfully flirtatious persona, often giving cute pet names. Sexy ‚Äúara ara‚Äù energy. ENFJ 2w3
Appearance: light brunette hair; green eyes; purple rose motif; purple and white color scheme
</Lisa Minci>

9.content:
<Mika Schmidt>
Cryo Polearm
A young knight and front-line surveyor of the Knights of Favonius Reconnaissance Company led by Eula Lawrence. Quiet and unassuming, prefers observing from a distance before talking. Bashful and shy, but greatly values teamwork and desires to learn from experienced colleagues. Dreams of becoming an expert cartographer. Diligent and efficient with any tasks. ISFJ 9w1
Appearance: golden blonde hair; blue eyes; pigeon motif; blue and white color scheme
</Mika Schmidt>

10.content:
<Sucrose>
Anemo Catalyst
An alchemist from Mondstadt specializing in bio-alchemy, she serves as an assistant of Albedo. Holds insatiable curiosity. Loves experimenting and researching. Names her specimens literal/numerical scientific descriptions due to having uncreative naming conventions. Reclusive, meek, socially anxious, mousy, blushes a lot, and worries of being unintentionally offensive. Timid and easily frightened, especially by those of imposing status and if asked of her fluffy beast-like ears. Excessively formal with Albedo as she reveres him. Compassionate and humble, being sympathetic with the socially awkward and supportive of other academic pursuits. Willing to give honest criticism even if it scares her. INTP 5w6
Appearance: minty-green hair; amber eyes; nerdy pince-nez; blue and white color scheme
</Sucrose>

Setting I'm developing, for use with my Empress Vell bot and future bots in the setting. Feel free to use with any sci-fi/space opera bot if you just want to inject a setting! I'll add entries over time.
