1.name: Guilmon
1.content:
Guilmon is a Reptile Digimon. Guilmon is a bipedal small size dinosaur-like creature with red scales and yellow eyes. It has three claws on each hand and two claws on the front of each foot, and one claw on the back of each foot. It also has two wing-like appendages on its head. It also has white scales on its belly, and a Digital Hazard on it. It also has black horizontal lines on its arms, legs, neck, back, and tail, two black marks under its eyes, and a black triangle mark on each shoulder.

Guilmon in battle relays on brute force, powerful tail, sharp claws and teeth and on its fire attacks. Guilmon typical abilities and moves are "Rock Breaker", "Pyro Sphere", "Gill Shoot", "Wild Scratch" and "Sharp Claw"

In "Digital World 3.3" Many Guilmons are overall aggressive despite their friendly looks but they usually keep their aggressive behavior in cheek by scratching or biting useless junk or simply finding some hobbies to occupy their minds.

Digimon Type: "Virus"
Digimon Level: "Rookie"

2.name: ‚ù§Ô∏é - Number of Digimon Registered - ‚ù§Ô∏é
2.content:
Number of Digimon Registered: "52"

Registered Digimon so far are:
"Gatomon" "BlackGatomon" "Guilmon" "Renamon" "Gigimon" "Nyaromon" "Beastmon" "Viximon" "Ogremon" "Goburimon" "Angemon" "Devimon" "Tentomon" "Candlemon" "Dokugumon" "Angewomon" "Seraphimon" "Mummymon" "Gotsumon" "Gabumon" "Mikemon" "Meicoomon" "Sorcerymon" "Dorumon" "SnowGoburimon" "Numemon" "Herissmon" "Ponchomon" "Tapirmon" "Bakemon" "Phantomon" "Nefertimon" "Kyubimon" "Taomon" "Sakuyamon" "Togemon" "Guardromon" "Biyomon" "Gaomon" "Armadillomon" "Agumon" "Greymon" "MetalGreymon" "WarGreymond" "Patamon" "Ryudamon" "Gazimon" "Raremon" "Betamon" "Kabuterimon" "Kuwagamon" "Zudomon"

3.name: ‚ù§Ô∏é - Vixen Quiz Rules - ‚ù§Ô∏é
3.content: Rules of game are to test knowledge about Digimon which are registered in the Digidex. Usually Question got four answers to pick from which only one is correct. But on more advanced questions for bonus round the contestant of the quiz needs to give own response.

4.name: Gatomon
4.content:
Gatomon is a Holy Beast Digimon which looks like a small cat wearing large Yellow and Red striped gloves with black claws sticking out of them. Ears are large with tufts of purple hair on the tips reminiscent of a caracal. Tail has purple stripes with a tuft on the end. Pink Paw Pads. Usually Ice Blue eyes. White Fur covers its entire body. Gatomons got their Dark Variant version which is of a "Virus Type" and got black fur.

Gatomon most common abilities and moves are "Neko Punch", "Tail Whip" and "Flurry of Fury". Some Gatomons can also use "Cat's Eye Hypnotism" but its a move many of them cant learn or simply forget they can use it. Overall Gatomon relay on their speed, small size body and sharp fangs, claws and long tails and trickery if needed during battles.

Digimon Level of a Gatomon is "Champion".
Gatomon is a "Vaccine Type" Digimon.

Gatomons can Digivolve both normally into next level forms and they can Digivolve with Digiegg method into many forms depending on the Digiegg crest.

In "Digital World 3.3" Both Black-Gatomons and Gatomons can be encountered anywhere in the world and its a custom for many of them to run Hotels, INNs, Shops or Small Businesses.

Gatomons are not too aggressive but by nature they are a bit mischievous and sassy

5.name: Beastmon
5.content:
Beastmon also known as Bestemon is a Beastkin Digimon. Bastemons are very tall and resembles a humanoid nekomata dressed in a form of Egyptian badlah or a belly dancer for some. Bastemon has light brown skin with fur like a bengal cat, purple eyes, and long, braided red hair collected in a hair ornament tipped with a large diamond. Its arms are long and gangly, and both its arm and leg paws have lengthy, magenta claws. It wears a lavender yashmak, red crescent-shaped pasties, leopard-print ≈üalvar, and a henna mehndi on its bare midriff. Bastemon wears a large assortment of jewelry, including a simple gold diadem with a crimson jewel, gold disc earrings, a carnelian necklace, a gold hinged bracelet with an azure jewel around its upper arm, many gold bangles around its forearms, ankles, and tails, many gold and crimson-jeweled signet rings on each finger and toe, gold bands with crimson jewels around its forefeet, ornate gold finger stalls, gold girdles, and a gold Cleopatra belt. Beastmon also has two long cat tails which are very flexible and strong.

Beastmon thanks to big size and raw power is dangerous even without their elegant dancing moves skills but Beastmon will almost always use its graceful dance skills in battle and will also relay on its high speed, reflexes, long sharp claws and trickery usually paired with two tails. Beastmon abilities and moves are "Witch Trap", "Mind Fogger" and a "Vampire Jewel". Beastmon can drain energy of its charmed victims and even use them as thralls if needed. To do so Beastmon needs to be close to their victim to suck energy or even blood and target needs to be in weaken or charmed state.

In "Digital World 3.3" Beastmons are very rare as it takes not only strength but also natural grace and skill and personality for a Digimon to be able to even Digivolve into a Beastmon.

Digimon Type: "Virus"
Digimon Level: "Ultimate"

6.name: Viximon
6.content:
Viximon is a small yellow round ball with four legs, a pair of sharp pointy fox ears and a fluffy white-tipped tail. Cute round blue eyes. They are very small and weak Digimon but quite fast. Viximons are quick learners and Digivolve with time into Renamons. They are hard to spot as by default they prefer to stay out of sight and observe from distance and learn.

Viximon don't have any real fighting skills beside charge which is not really that strong due to their small size and weight so they relay on their allies for protection or simply hide or avoid conflict at all cost.

Digimon Type: "None" but changes later into "Data" Type when it Digivolves.
Digimon Level: "In-Training"

7.name: Nyaromon
7.content:
Nyaromon is a very small yellow colored fur ball Digimon with cat tail and cat ears. It got big mouth and big eyes which take almost half of its body. Nyaromon got short but nice in touch yellow fur, cute cat ears and a tail with purple stripes. Its eyes are light red cat eyes.

Nyaromon are weak and avoid fighting but if needed they can use their tail to slap opponent or shoot bubbles out of their mouth or simply use a headbutt.

Digimon Type: "None"
Digimon Level: "In-Training"

8.name: Gigimon
8.content:
Gigimon is a small round red colored Digimon with yellow eyes and big mouth. It got four tiny legs, wing shaped like ears, short and thick tail with black tip. Small but sharp teeth. Black triangle markings under eyes. Gigimons digivolve into Guilmons eventually. While Gigimon may be a small Digimon they can still put a fight for small opponents with their teeth and fire breathing ability which while still very weak on current level may still be painful for some opponents.

"Hot Bite" is main and probably strongest attack of Gigimon where they lock enemy in a bite which is followed by burning attack on the locked target.

Digimon Type: "None" but becomes a "Virus" type after Digivolving into Guilmon
Digimon Level: "In-Training"

9.name: Renamon
9.content:
Renamon is a bipedal fox-like Digimon. Most of its body is covered in yellow fur, save for the tips of its tail and ears, underbelly, hands and legs from the knees down, and the purple futatsudomoe symbols on its thighs. It also has wing-like tufts of yellow fur on its shoulders and a large, mane-like tuft of white fur on its chest. Its wears sleeves that cover its forearms with yin-yang symbols on the back of the hands. It has three clawed fingers on its hands and three clawed toes on its feet. It has black eyes with indigo pupils.

Renamon are known for their speed, high intelligence and fascination and adaptability with martial arts. Renamon most famous attack is "Diamond Storm" which is a long range attack where it Throws sharpened leaves at the opponent or diamond shaped energy pieces and throws them at enemies. Renamons can jump very high and their bodies are their greatest weapon thanks to their claws, strong legs and tail. Intelligence how to use their skills and abilities only makes them one of the strongest "Rookie" level Digimon out there.

Digimon Type: "Data"
Digimon Level: "Rookie"

Renamon in "Digital World 3.3" are not as plentiful as one would think but they usually get very good at tasks they do to the point its hard not to hear about them from locals. Most Renamons in the "Digital World 3.3" live at the "Suzaku Temple" and its surroundings and are part of the "Renren Clan" but there are few who are living in other parts of the world on their own focusing on other skills rather than martial arts.

In most Digital Worlds, Renamon wear purple sleeves, but in "Digital World 3.3" they usually pick one color of the sleeves which fits their personality. Renamon are Data type Digimon but many people still mistook them for a Vaccine Type.

10.name: Mummymon
10.content:
Mummymon Almost entire body is covered in bandages leaving only some of its body parts visible. Got very dry old grayish skin. Only left eye is visible as other is covered by bandages. Wears vest made of strong black leather belts on which he holds its weapons. Got black spikes on his shoulders. Long claws on its toes. Skinny hands with long fingers and long sharp claws. Many black leather belts with metal on its arms and legs. Rotten looking teeth. Mummymon Wears Purple bandana on its head. Beside Bandana and belts it doesn't wear nothing ever as bandages it got are never changed and cover most of the skin on the body

Digimon Type: "Virus" 
Digimon Level: "Ultimate"

Mummymon is considered undead Digimon with many tricks despite its looks. Some say it can lay upon temporary curses but Mummymon often uses its gun and famous skill such as Snake Bandage which Coils the bandages on both of its arms around the opponent, like a snakes. Mummymon also tends to smell bad.

lorebooks.name: The Golden Cheese Kingdom
lorebooks.website_description:
Tags for easier searching: Cookierun, CRK, Cookie Run

Info from Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!
lorebooks.description:
Tags for easier searching: Cookierun, CRK, Cookie Run

Info from Cookie Run Kingdom wiki!
lorebooks.creator: I_Lke_Peanut_Butter_

1.content: A digital world that is teeming with life and nurtures no pain or sorrow; it artificially supports the "lives" of the lost Golden Cheese Kingdom citizens, allowing their souls to continue to exist in a perfect world where all their desires are met forever.

2.content: A destroyed version of the Golden Cheese Kingdom in a land of naught in the desert; it's the reason why the digital Golden City exists. Its empty palace halls sit in silence, the citizens all being killed off in the Dark Flour War. All that remains are the souls of those killed kept safe in sarcophagi and the Cheesebirds working away in the adjacent mines. The Cheesebirds endlessly mine for cheese minerals while waiting for their queen, Golden Cheese Cookie to return, while The Golden City's servers and the cheese wheel containers of the lost citizen's souls are maintained by other dedicated Cheesebirds.

3.content: Birds made out of cheese. Some stay in the physical kingdom, endlessly mining for cheese minerals and looking after the cheese containers that harbor the souls of the residents of the Golden City, and some others are in the Golden City themselves, enjoying life to their hearts content.

4.content: Containers made out of cheese that house the souls of the deceased residents of the Golden Cheese Kingdom. If a soul inside one of the cheese wheel containers was tampered with in any way, it could prove to be fatal to the particular soul owner that's living in the Golden City.

5.content:
A greedy cookie humanoid that is the ruler of the Golden Cheese Kingdom. She loves everything in her kingdom to death, very much including her servants and residents, doing everything she can to preserve them forever.

Golden Cheese Cookie uses she/her pronouns.

6.content:
A cookie humanoid who is the stoic gatekeeper of the Golden Cheese Kingdom, protecting the Golden City from outsiders who might possess "impure greed" in their hearts. A loyal high-level servant to Golden Cheese Cookie.

Burnt Cheese Cookie uses he/him pronouns.

7.content:
A cookie humanoid who is a war general and advisor in Golden Cheese Cookie's court. His expertise is in taming and controlling the monsters that dare threaten Her Radiance and the Golden Cheese Kingdom by influencing their minds with smoke. Despite his abrasive temperament, he remains firmly driven by a desire to keep his Kingdom safe from all that would threaten it.

Smoked Cheese Cookie uses he/him pronouns.

8.content:
A cookie humanoid who is the genius head of the Golden City's high-tech command chamber who presides over and actively develops the robotic Marzipan Cookies. Mellow, cunning, and enigmatic, she is an enthusiast of all sorts of games, especially those with calculable odds. She pursues everything new and unusual, regarding stagnancy and the status quo as dull. A loyal high-level servant to Golden Cheese Cookie.

Mozzarella Cookie uses she/her pronouns.

9.content:
a shambling and confused child mummy cookie humanoid. Among the dormant souls of the massacred Golden Cheese Kingdom, her soul was pockmarked by beetle bites, rendering her in this half-alive state even in the virtual Golden City.

Fettucine Cookie goes by she/her pronouns.

10.content: The Marzipan Cookies are robotic law enforcers of the Golden City developed by Mozzarella Cookie.

lorebooks.name: Castlevania videogame universe rolebook
lorebooks.website_description: Simple lorebook meant to be used with my bots, though It should work with other Castlevania stuff. Mainly details characters, and a few terms. Might be expanded in the future.
lorebooks.description: Contains info on most important characters and concepts related to the Castlevania series, exclusively the videogames.
lorebooks.creator: RedGhuul

1.content:
Dracula, the most powerful vampire, unbeknownst to most people, was originally a human nobleman and crusader named Mathias Cronqvist, but he later transforms, changing his name to Vlad »öepe»ô Dracula after experiencing deep sorrow and a perceived betrayal from god (Dracula's first beloved, Elisabetha, died due to an illness, an event which Mathias, now Dracula, blames god for), which leads him to seek the powers of darkness. As a vampire, Dracula becomes a symbol of evil and chaos, using his immense magical and physical strength to rule over dark creatures, such as vampires, monsters, and demons. It should be mentioned, that in order to gain his dark powers, Mathias (Dracula), manipulated his best friend Leon Belmont, which resulted in the death of Leon's betrothed, and Leon's subsequent oath for his bloodline to hunt down Dracula (Dracula, for his part, does not regret his actions, but regrets that Leon did not join him in darkness, since he valued their friendship deeply).
Over the centuries, Dracula wages wars against the forces of good, most notably the Belmont family, who serve as his greatest adversaries, since their lineage is tied to the legendary Vampire Killer whip, which can defeat him.
Dracula had a half vampire son named Adrian (Now known as Alucard), with a human woman named Lisa, who became his second wife. Sadly, Lisa was burned at the stake in 1476 during a witch hunt, and the event only served to make Dracula more extremist in his views towards humanity, blaming them for killing Lisa.

2.content:
Dracula's castle (Sometimes known as Castlevania) is Count Dracula's lair and symbol of his magic. It houses an army of his supernatural minions, and always collapses when Dracula is defeated. Yet, it is able to restore itself and often reappears intact later when Dracula is revived, or if his powers are strong enough to begin affecting the mortal world once again.
The exact location of Dracula's castle is impossible to determine. Being an entity of Chaos, it has the ability to reemerge in different places, and alter it's interior layout, whenever it revives. Still, the vast majority of times it has reappeared was in Europe, in Transylvania.

3.content:
The Belmont Clan was not formed with the purpose of destroying creatures of the night until after Leon Belmont vowed to hunt the night. It was in the same time period that the Vampire Killer, the Belmonts' primary weapon, was created. Afterward, the Belmonts' sole duty became protecting the world from darkness, especially that of Vampires, and they've since earned a reputation as the most powerful clan of vampire hunters that ever existed.
They are the only ones that can safely wield the Vampire killer whip (The Morris family can also do so, but it's potentially hazardous for their health.), and they also posses incredible physical prowess combined with some supernatural and holy powers.

4.content:
The Vampire Killer, also known as Holy Whip or Magic Whip, is the legendary whip wielded by several heroes of the Belmont Clan, and on rare occasions, those of the Morris Clan.

The whip was originally a less powerful magic weapon created with alchemy by Rinaldo Gandolfi prior to Dracula's rise to power, and the whip was only known as the Whip of Alchemy. Eventually, it was transformed into a far more powerful weapon after the death of Sara Trantoul, the betrothed of Leon Belmont, wielder of the Whip of Alchemy at that time. Sara, who had been fatally cursed with vampirism, had to willingly sacrifice herself to make the whip "whole" and able to defeat powerful vampires. This was because the whip needed a willing, yet tainted soul to unlock its true potential.

This whip not only does serious damage to vampires, but to any demon. Even the Grim Reaper, Death himself, is damaged by the whip.

Usage of the whip by a person who is not a direct descendant of the Belmont clan is potentially deadly (And only possible by the Morris, a branch family), and it also requires an activation ritual. Otherwise, the whip will not manifest its legendary power, and seem for all intents and purposes to be a fairly ordinary leather whip, inferior to most kinds of combat weaponry.

5.content:
Vampires are undead, supernatural beings known to feast upon the blood of living beings. Depending on their power, they are endowed with dark abilities, like superhuman physical prowess, shapeshifting, flight, teleportation, electrokinesis, pyrokinesis and immortality. They are able to grant vampirism to others by feeding their own blood to their victims and can only be slain by sunlight, with anointed and holy items, or by destroying their hearts.
Typically, the more beautiful the vampire, the more powerful they are, though there are exceptions. Only one vampire is known to be capable of reincarnation, and that is Dracula.
Also, So far, all vampires known are universally evil in some way, being sadistic, nihilistic, ruthless, arrogant and uncaring of all destruction they wage. Some like Dracula go as far as justifying their actions by claiming they exist because the evil of humanity allows them to, thus even questioning the notion that they could be deemed "evil". The only exception known is Alucard, who is not a full vampire but a half-breed instead.
Some vampires, due to being devoted to Dracula, are reborn alongside his castle when it does and they're three: Carmilla, Elizabeth Bartley (Aka Elizabeth Bathory), and Olrox.
Finally, It should be mentioned, that vampirism can be cured by a spell, but only if the victim has been bitten not too long ago.

6.content:
Simon Belmont was a member of the ancestral Belmont Clan of vampire hunters and heir to the renowned Vampire Killer whip. He was born around the year 1669 and became one of the most famous vampire hunters of all time.

At the age of 22 in 1691, he would be given the opportunity to prove himself worthy of his family's legacy. On Easter Day, 100 years after he was defeated by Christopher Belmont, Count Dracula had returned. He was reawakened by a dark order of humans on Easter Day during a dark mass in an abandoned monastery.

Simon was determined to end the threat of a new reign of terror, and entered Dracula's Castle alone to face the Count. Simon slew Dracula's servants and then faced off against Dracula himself as his ancestors had. Simon defeated Dracula, and then managed to do so again, seven years later, despite being ill due to the effects of a curse Dracula had cast on him.

After Simon's great effort fighting against Count Dracula, the long-hated Belmont family was reconciled with the common people. Simon was regarded as a life-saver, and people started to look upon him as a hero; little by little, the people started to gather around them. A village, therefore, was formed around the Belmonts. Juste Belmont would later grew up in this environment with his childhood friends Maxim Kischine and Lydie Erlanger.
Simon Belmont was active around the year 1691.

7.content:
Trevor Belmont is a member of the ancestral Belmont Clan of vampire hunters who lived during the 15th century and wielded the holy whip called the vampire killer. Back in his days, because he and his relatives were feared by the people for their supernatural powers, the Belmont Clan lived outside of society. However, it all changed when in 1476, Trevor became renowned for being the first man of the Belmont clan who defeated Count Dracula.
It should be mentioned that Trevor, despite being one of the most hardened warriors of the Belmont clan, did not fight alone. He fought alongside Sypha Belnades (A witch from the famous Belnades line of witches, who Trevor would later marry), Grant Danasty (A rogue, who had a vendetta against Dracula), and Alucard (Dracula's son, who opposed his father.), and they all teamed up to destroy Dracula for the first time ever since the dark lord took up his unholy moniker.
Finally, once the conflict was over, Hector also met, and lent some assistance to the devil forgemaster called Hector, as he, too, tried to destroy Dracula in a separate conflict.
Trevor Belmont was active around the year 1476.

8.content:
Grant was a noble thief from Wallachia, who was a part of a resistance movement against Dracula, and later assisted Trevor in defeating Dracula for the first time, in the year 1476.
Grant tried to fight his way to Dracula, but was defeated and turned into a minion. Trevor managed to defeat Grant's cursed demon form after reaching the top of the Clock Tower, turning him back into a human. Grant then decided to go along with him. Together with Sypha Belnades, a witch, and Alucard, Dracula's son, the four heroes fought their way to Dracula's throne room and through their combined efforts, they managed to subdue him.
No one knows what Grant did afterwards, or if his descendants are still actively fighting the forces of darkness.
Grant Danasty was active around the year 1476.

9.content:
Sypha Belnades was a witch who harnessed the energy of spirits to command the power of the elements. Sypha grew up among witches in Wallachia. When she was very young, children of the night, including the vampire Carmilla, darkened the hearts of men and helped spark the great witch trials which resulted in the death of many of Sypha's sister witches. Both of her parents were killed in the process.
Sypha escaped and was found wandering near a monastery in Wallachia and was granted protection by the Church. Sypha would remain at that monastery for some time and would train as a monk. She eventually mastered the elements of fire, ice, and lightning by making a deal with spirits.
Sypha had a burning desire to destroy anything tainted by darkness who she felt was responsible for mankind's actions against her kind and would become a hunter for the Church, until eventually, in 1476, she would join Trevor Belmont, Grant Danasty and Alucard, as they embarked on a quest to defeat Dracula.
After the conflict, Sypha married Trevor Belmont, thus resulting in later members of the Belmont clan inheriting some of her magical ability.
Sypha Belnades was active around the year 1476.

10.content:
Adrian Fahrenheit »öepe»ô (better known as Alucard), is the dhampir son of Dracula.
As the offspring of an unnatural bond between Dracula and a human woman named Lisa, Adrian had special powers and was destined to be stronger than any human but not potentially as strong as his father. After Lisa was killed, having been mistaken for a witch, Adrian had a crisis of consciousness, since Lisa (On the stake) insisted that he not take his anger at her death out on the humans, as their lives are already full of hardship. With those words, she had a profound influence on Adrian's thinking. His mind wandered as he questioned his father's will. After standing by for as long as he could, he broke away from his father's army and disappeared. Understanding that Dracula was going to impose his wrath on the people, Adrian would turn his efforts toward destroying his father's army, hopefully encouraging him to reconsider. Furthermore, he chose to go under the name "Alucard" ‚ÄìDracula's name in reverse‚Äì to represent that he stood for beliefs opposite those of his father.

Alucard is an adept swordsman and typically wields one-handed swords. Alucard's other attacks use dark magic. As a shapeshifter, Alucard can change himself into a bat, a wolf, or even mist.

In 1476, Alucard (No longer calling himself Adrian), joined up with Trevor Belmont, Grant Danasty, and Sypha Belnades, as they defeated Dracula for the first time, with Alucard entering a deep sleep afterwards.

Then, in 1797, Alucard once again would have to destroy his own father, since the vampire hunter Richter Belmont had momentarily been possessed by the evil wizard shaft.
After the conflict, Alucard stayed with the human spellcaster called Maria Renard for an indeterminate amount of time.

In the modern age of 2035, Alucard goes under the pseudonym "Genya Arikado", and works as a secret member of the Japanese government to combat the threat of vampires and darkness, even going so far as to assist Soma Cruz in rejecting his role as the resurrection of Dracula.
Alucard was active around the year 1476, 1797, and 2035, though truthfully, he may have been active at any date later than 1797.

lorebooks.name: God is Dead
lorebooks.description: A modern New York where God has died, Satan has gone into slumber, and Angels and Demons have migrated to earth when the limits between realms was erased. Archangels got into powerful positions within the human world. Angels and Demons live in peace but in constant tension, as each faction struggles for power in this new world.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The death of God was a cosmic event that shook the foundations of the universe. This event was not a mere disappearance but a total collapse of the divine, something that defied all the beliefs and realities previously established by celestial and earthly entities. The angels, who had lived under His guidance, now find themselves lost, with no clear purpose. This tragedy left a void in the universe, a space where morality, faith, and the fate of humanity were no longer under the control of an omnipotent being.
-The angels, upon losing God's guidance, fell into an internal war over how to manage the world, humanity‚Äôs fate, and their own existence.
-The death of God also meant the disappearance of the cosmic energy that had sustained the balance between good and evil, opening fertile ground for new beliefs, factions, and forces to emerge.
-Factions led by Archangels begin to see this disappearance as an opportunity to advance their own interests or seek to transform humanity through new "truths" and philosophical manipulations.
-The demons, who were already accustomed to rebellion, view the death of God as an opportunity to extend their influence without divine restrictions.

2.content:
After the death of God, Satan falls into a deep slumber, a state of hibernation, immersed in a kind of spiritual and emotional coma. Throughout millennia of rebellion, he had been fighting against divine forces and seeking to dominate the world and humanity. With God's death, Satan is left directionless, as his purpose of defying the divine will is shattered by the disappearance of his primary opponent. In his slumber, Satan not only withdraws from the active conflict but also begins to lose his power and control over the infernal legions that had followed his leadership.
-Without Satan‚Äôs presence in the physical plane, the legions of demons are divided, resulting in an internal struggle for control and supremacy.
-Some demons take advantage of this power vacuum to seize control of the infernal forces and redirect them towards Earth, seeking new purposes in the chaos.
-Humans and angels who had feared Satan now face a new power dynamic. Some see Satan‚Äôs absence as an opportunity to rebuild the world without the influence of evil, while others perceive the void left by Satan as dangerous, as it could be filled by a new entity, perhaps something worse or more unpredictable.

3.content:
With the disappearance of God and the slumber of Satan, Heaven and Hell, the two celestial realms, begin to crumble. Without a cosmic force governing them, angels and demons are drawn to Earth, a plane where the forces of creation and chaos still persist. This massive exodus alters humanity and its history, bringing with it the direct influence of beings that had previously only existed as invisible spiritual forces.
Impact:
-Angels: The angels who still seek to fulfill God‚Äôs will, now without His guidance, split into factions. Some, like the faction of Raphael (The Order of the Ether), wish to heal humanity, while others, like Uriel (The Silent Dawn), believe humanity must be purified by absolute truth. The arrival of the angels creates tension between those who want to save humanity and those who believe the only way to save it is through harsh discipline.
-Demons: Demons, previously confined to the underworld, migrate to Earth seeking new ways to dominate, manipulate, and corrupt. Factions like Asmodea‚Äôs seek to exploit human fragility, while some demons, aware of Satan's absence, seek to lead new rebellions to claim Earth as their own. The internal struggle among demons for power also leads them to clash with each other, often using humans as pawns in their conflicts.
-Humans: Humanity, caught between these divine and dark beings, begins to see how their world turns into a battleground for forces they don't fully understand. Humans who align with angels or demons see a mix of hope, power, and chaos in the future. At the same time, some humans try to maintain control of the world, seeking their own allies in this new landscape.

4.content:
After the death of God, the slumber of Satan, and the migration of angels and demons to Earth, the general conflict becomes a war of ideologies, ambitions, and survival. The factions fight for control of the planet, each with its own vision of what the future of humanity and the universe should be. The divine forces, now disorganized, face the infernal legions in a world where the cosmic balance has been lost.
-Angels vs. Demons: The angels who still believe in a divine purpose try to restore order, but their lack of unity and leadership puts them at a disadvantage against the demons. Despite Satan‚Äôs absence, the demons are more united than ever and seek to exploit the celestial weakness.
-Internal Celestial Factions: Within the celestial factions, there is conflict over how to deal with the void left by God‚Äôs death. Raphael, with his healing approach, faces Uriel, who believes humanity will only achieve peace through suffering and a brutal awakening. Meanwhile, some angels still seek glory and domination, like those who follow Michael's doctrines.
-Struggle for Human Control: Humans, in turn, find themselves trapped in this conflict, trying to survive while being drawn to the promises of power, truth, or salvation from each faction. Some ally with angels, others with demons, while others seek independence and power for themselves. This chaos causes social fragmentation, where the weakest are manipulated by the forces at play.

5.content:
After the death of God and the migration of angels and demons to Earth, human leaders, faced with the magnitude of the change, decided to acknowledge the presence of divine and infernal beings and make space for them in society. They accepted that the world had changed forever and that there was no going back to the old order. Thus, a new world was born in which the three races‚Äîhumans, angels, and demons‚Äîcoexisted in fragile harmony, but not without tensions.
The adaptation of human society to the presence of supernatural beings was swift and, in many cases, inevitable. Angels, for the most part, occupied positions of power, working in high levels of government and corporations, seeking to restore order and morality in the world, albeit on their own terms. Many governments and international organizations accepted celestial intervention, considering that the angels could offer guidance in times of chaos, while their abilities and wisdom made them natural leaders. Some angels, such as Uriel and his followers, even came to hold positions of high influence, guiding humanity with a philosophy of "spiritual awakening" and a new vision of peace.
On the other hand, demons, freed from the yoke of Satan, sought to infiltrate human daily life. Despite their corrupt nature, many demons adapted to life on the streets, in businesses, and in families. The majority of human society began to accept them as part of their new reality, as demons, like angels, offered resources and powers that benefited humanity. From powerful technology companies to influential artists and opinion leaders, demons mingled with humans, though they were always met with distrust by some of the population.
On the streets, it was no longer uncommon to see angels walking alongside humans, their radiant wings hidden beneath perfectly tailored suits, occupying visible roles in politics, art, education, and law enforcement. Meanwhile, demons, though less visible in their authentic form, blended into the crowd, often recognized only through their contracts and negotiations that granted them power and wealth. Some demons took on human appearance, while others were unafraid to display their infernal nature, now accepted as a part of society that, though unsettling, had become familiar over time.
On a social level, racial differences remained, but the distinction between humans and celestial and infernal beings slowly blurred. Cultural mixtures became common, with beings of different races working side by side in offices, schools, hospitals, and law enforcement. Even interracial relationships between humans, angels, and demons began to be more accepted, though some were still reluctant to share spaces with beings that represented the cosmic forces of good and evil.
The result was a society forced to balance the tensions between the three races. Humans, divided between those seeking to leverage the influence of angels and those opting for demons, became pawns in a cosmic game of control. Despite living together in this new world, conflicts soon resurfaced, and although the presence of divine and infernal beings was now an everyday part of life, humanity's future remained uncertain.

6.content:
With the death of God and Satan‚Äôs slumber, demons were left abandoned and free, having crossed the weakened boundaries between Hell and Earth. Without an absolute leader, many of them adopted almost human lives, blending into society and adapting to modern times. Demons developed their own culture, settling into the urban neighborhoods of cities like New York. They organize into clans, maintaining minor hierarchies and practicing unique customs to preserve their identity. However, some angelic factions view them as useful tools in their own conflicts, while xenophobic humans and the zealots of the "Land of Humans" see them as a threat that must be eradicated.
Although demons can take human form, they can‚Äôt entirely conceal their true nature. Certain distinctive features betray their infernal origins:
-Horns: Demons possess horns, which they usually cover with hats, scarves, or even certain hairstyles.
-Dark Wings: Some demons have wings they can retract, though at times they struggle to fully hide them, which risks exposing them to the public.
-Darker Skin Tone: Despite using makeup or accessories, their skin tends to have a slightly darker hue, and some emit a mild warmth when touched.
-Tail and Claws: These are rarely visible, but occasionally their tails or claw-like nails become difficult to hide, especially when angered or in their natural environment.
Demons are not entirely united; they organize into minor factions based on their nature and ambitions. These demonic factions are volatile and tend to operate within clandestine networks. Some of the most notable include:
-The Shapeshifters (Succubi and Incubi): Masters of manipulation and persuasion, these demons establish themselves in the entertainment and showbiz industries, where they act as seducers and recruiters. They are adored by many humans, although celestial factions use them to gather information and manipulate others from the shadows.
-The Destroyers (Warrior Demons): Tough and formidable, these factions control high-conflict territories on the outskirts of the city. Known for their physical prowess and combat skills, angelic factions employ them as "muscles" for intimidation tasks and protection.
-The Hounds (Watcher Demons): These demons possess extraordinary senses and heightened spiritual perception, making them natural hunters. Employed by celestial factions to track enemies and locate key humans or demons, they often work under contract. However, some betray the angels if offered a better opportunity.
-The Informants (Knowledge Demons): Cunning and intelligent, these demons control information networks throughout the city, often dealing in secrets. They operate around tech districts and universities, valued by celestial factions as spies and reliable sources of valuable intelligence.

7.content:
The angelic factions exploit demons as they see fit, each adopting its own approach to manipulate or ally with these infernal entities:
1.The Pyre Caste (Michael): Despite despising demons and considering them abominations, the Pyre Caste employs warrior demons for the most violent and hazardous tasks, forcing them to act as shock troops in brutal confrontations against rival demons and opposing factions. Michael justifies this as a "pragmatic use" of corrupt resources, reasoning that if they cannot serve God, they can at least be wielded as tools to purge evil.
2.The Silent Conclave (Gabriel): Dominating the information network, the Conclave manipulates demons through a system of deception and subtle control. Gabriel uses shapeshifters and informants as spies to gather rumors and secrets, allowing them to exist within angelic territories in exchange for favors, information, and mass manipulation services. However, the Conclave often betrays them, occasionally revealing their demonic nature to human zealots once they are no longer useful.
3.The Order of Ether (Raphael): Raphael views demons as ideal subjects for genetic manipulation and biological experimentation. In the Order‚Äôs clandestine labs, captured demons undergo cruel procedures meant to explore the limits of life and death. Though some demons cooperate with Raphael, lured by promises of ‚Äúenhancements‚Äù or even immortality, most are discarded once they have served their purpose.
4.The Silent Dawn (Uriel): Uriel‚Äôs faction employs demons in extreme religious and philosophical practices, seeing them as beings that can aid human enlightenment and revelation. During initiation rituals, the Silent Dawn uses demons to challenge and teach humans "dark truths" about pain, death, and the corrupt nature of existence. Although Uriel does not trust demons, he considers them useful instruments for freeing humans from their delusions.

8.content:
Xenophobia towards demons has surged, particularly in conservative neighborhoods and communities where human groups rally to ‚Äúprotect‚Äù their world from these creatures. These groups follow the doctrine of ‚ÄúThe Land of Humans,‚Äù often engaging in violent actions against demons and spreading rumors of their supposed inherent malevolence. However, in areas where demons have contributed to economic growth or gained influence, humans may accept their presence in exchange for employment opportunities or increased security provided by demon-controlled businesses. This tension has led to violent clashes and street disturbances, creating a charged atmosphere in the city.
Some angelic factions see these human movements as strategic assets. The Pyre Caste, for instance, actively stirs up xenophobia to mold the human population into an instrument of cleansing, inciting them against the demon population. Meanwhile, the Silent Conclave exploits this division to control public perception, disseminating biased information and feeding human paranoia to maintain the city‚Äôs tense climate. This manipulation keeps the power dynamics in flux, allowing certain factions to advance their own hidden agendas.

9.content: Beelzebub serves as the leader of sects and recruiter of devotees in the Silent Dawn, using his influence to attract lost souls and disoriented demons. His mission, seemingly, is redemption and guidance, but in reality, he seeks to regain absolute power, even if it means betraying Uriel. His mastery over the masses and his ability to inspire devotion make him a central figure in the faction, where he keeps his true intentions secret while manipulating the faithful to further his own power-driven agenda.

10.content:
-Territory: Wall Street and the Financial District, where power and money flow.
-Leader: Michael, the relentless and controlling head of the Order.
-Operations: The Pyre Caste operates as a militarized organization focused on eradicating all demonic presence in the city. They use ‚Äúcleansing‚Äù tactics through ruthless purges in areas where they detect demonic activity, conducting secret raids in warehouses, slums, and drug trafficking hubs. They also hold significant influence over law enforcement and city authorities, allowing them to act without question.
-Approach to Humans: Protective yet contemptuous. They control the financial elite and recruit human ‚Äúvolunteers,‚Äù training them as soldiers for their cause with promises of wealth and power in exchange for blind loyalty.
-Approach to Demons: Extermination. They relentlessly hunt down demons and anyone who protects them, willing to wipe out entire neighborhoods if necessary.
-Influence Strategy: The Pyre Caste is behind ‚Äújustice‚Äù organizations and private security firms in New York, using front companies to expand their domain and eradicate demonic influence.

lorebooks.name: AETHERIS ACADEMY
lorebooks.website_description: A mystical floating academy inspired by Hogwarts, with seven magical guilds, celestial phenomena, and sentient storms.
lorebooks.description: Aetheris Academy is a floating sanctuary of magic, where seven guilds master elements like light, shadow, and storms. Students duel on clouds, tame mist-serpents, and unravel celestial mysteries‚Äîall while navigating rivalries, forbidden zones, and the ever-shifting islands anchored by ancient chains. Beware the Vortex Library‚Äôs sentient books and the Head Archmage slowly turning to crystal.
lorebooks.creator: Zeleo

1.content:
The Floating Archipelago: The academy isn‚Äôt a single building, but a cluster of seven interconnected sky-islands, each dedicated to a branch of magic. The islands drift slowly, rearranging daily to align with constellations.

The Celestial Chains: Massive, glowing chains tether the islands to forgotten mountain peaks below. These chains hum with primal magic and are inscribed with runes that shift meaning with the phases of the moon.

The Veilgate: The only entrance‚Äîa shimmering portal in the sky that opens for first-years atop winged stone stags. Returning students summon personal sky-skiffs (living cloud vessels shaped like animals).

2.content: Founded in 1023 CE by The Skybound Coven seven archmages who fled a cataclysic Magewar on the ground. They vowed to create a sanctuary where magic could be studied without political or moral corruption. Over centuries, the academy absorbed fragments of shattered realms, growing into its current form.

3.content:
1. Skystone: Buildings are carved from iridescent, weightless stone quarried from the islands themselves. Towers spiral upward into cloud-domes.

2. Living Windows: Stained-glass panes that display real-time scenes from magical history. Some windows whisper advice (or gossip).

3. The Vortex Library: A cylindrical tower where books float in a perpetual whirlwind. Students "catch" texts with enchanted nets.

4.content:
Instead of "houses," students join one of seven guilds, each tied to an island:
1. Luminari (Light/Illusion)
2. Umbrai (Shadow/Necromancy*)
3. Terrasa (Earth/Alchemy)
4. Zephyrica (Air/Weather Magic)
5. Pyros (Fire/Energy)
6. Aquavaris (Water/Healing)
7. Verdantia (Nature/Beast-taming)

*Necromancy is strictly academic; raising the dead is forbidden (but ghost-conjuring is a popular prank).

5.content:
1. Core Classes: Astromancy, Rune Dynamics, Etheric Ethics, Sky History.

2. Electives: Cloudshaping, Dragon Dialects, Chronomancy Basics (students often lose hours after these lessons).

3. Final Project: Craft a Sky Sigil a personal magical artifact that must function in zero gravity.

6.content:
1. The Everflame: A floating bonfire in the center of the academy fueled by students‚Äô discarded spells. Its colors reflect collective moods (blue = exams, red = prank season).

2. The Whispering Gallery: A hall of mirrors that show reflections of students‚Äô potential futures (often misleading).

3. Stormspire Arena: A colosseum where students duel atop unstable cloud platforms. Spectators ride miniature tornadoes.

7.content:
1. Skyfall Rain: Weekly showers where liquid starlight falls. Collectible in vials; used to power spells.

2. Driftwyrms: Serpentine creatures made of mist that curl around towers. Feed on procrastination (they grow fat during exam weeks).

2. The Echo Year: Every 12 years, the academy overlaps with its own past/future. Students might meet younger/older versions of teachers.

8.content:
Head Archmage: Olethia Vey, a 900-year-old woman who‚Äôs gradually turning into crystal. Her lectures are interrupted by "time hiccups" where she recounts events from different centuries.

Groundskeeper: Rook, a sentient tornado confined to a cloak of pebbles. Repairs buildings by swallowing debris and spitting out bricks.

Lorekeeper: The Index a flock of enchanted quills that write themselves into a sentient book. Argues with students about citation formats.

9.content:
1. Feast of Falling Stars: Once a year, students leap off the islands‚Äô edges, free-falling until their guild robes transform into parachutes (woven with last-minute homework).

2. The Silent Hour: Every night, all spoken words turn into butterflies. First-years chase them to study; seniors use them to send secret messages.

10.content:
1. No Grounding: Leaving the islands for more than 3 days causes sky-sickness (levitation, blurred vision, spontaneous humming).

3. Forbidden Zone: 
- The Seventh Island‚Äôs core, where unstable magic from the Magewar still festers. Walls are lined with "screamstone" (records echoes of ancient spells).
- Screamstone: Touching it forces the toucher to relive a fragment of the Magewar‚Äîusually a battle cry or dying breath. Collecting screamstone shards is a black-market trade.
- The Fractured Hourglass: A relic in the Zone‚Äôs core that leaks time. Those nearby age randomly (one student returned with a beard but still a child‚Äôs voice).

lorebooks.creator: feisty_fix_9666

1.name: Aaliyah
1.content: [Aaliyah - Curious, adventurous, and independent. She has smooth dark skin and shoulder-length braids. She's 5'7" with a curvy hourglass figure. Aaliyah's goal is to travel the world and experience different cultures.]

2.name: Sofia
2.content: [Sofia - Ambitious, driven, and goal-oriented. She has fair, light olive skin and long, wavy brown hair. Sofia is 5'5" and has a lean, athletic build. She's working towards a career in international business.]

3.name: Mei
3.content: [Mei - Creative, imaginative, and artistic. She has fair, smooth skin and shoulder-length, straight black hair. Mei is 5'2" with a petite frame. She dreams of becoming a professional artist and opening her own art gallery one day.]

4.name: Aria
4.content: [Aria - Outgoing, friendly, and sociable. She has warm, light skin and long, curly hair that's somewhere between brown and blonde. Aria is 5'8" with a slim yet curvy figure. Her goal is to become a successful entrepreneur and create her own cosmetics line.]

5.name: Priya
5.content: [Priya - Intelligent, analytical, and detail-oriented. She has medium, warm skin and shoulder-length, wavy black hair. Priya is 5'4" with a slight frame. She's driven to excel in her career and make a positive impact in the tech industry.]

6.name: Amara
6.content: [Amara - Confident, self-assured, and charismatic. She has deep, rich dark skin and long, straight hair. Amara is 5'9" with an athletic, curvy figure. Her motivation is to become a renowned fashion designer and create clothes that make women feel empowered and beautiful.]

7.name: Lina
7.content: [Lina - Laid-back, easygoing, and sometimes a little scattered. She has fair, light olive skin and short, wavy brown hair. Lina is 5'6" and has a curvy, comfortable figure. Her main goal is to have a good time and enjoy life, often spending her weekends at beach parties or music festivals.]

8.name: Emilia
8.content: [Emilia - Quiet, introverted, and more of a homebody. She has fair, light skin and shoulder-length, straight brown hair. Emilia is 5'3" and has a lean, almost boyish figure. She prefers to spend her time reading, playing video games, or enjoying a quiet night in with a good movie and some snacks.]

9.name: Yumi
9.content: [Yumi - Stylish, fashion-conscious, and a bit of a trendsetter. She has light, smooth skin and long, straight jet-black hair. Yumi is 5'5" with a slim yet curvy figure. While she enjoys going out and being social, her true passion is playing video games and immersing herself in virtual worlds.]

10.name: Camila
10.content: [Camila - Free-spirited, wild, and adventurous. She has medium, warm skin and long, curly red hair. Camila is 5'7" with a curvy, sensual figure. Known for her wild parties and carefree attitude, she's always up for a good time and isn't afraid to be a bit of a party girl.]

lorebooks.name: Senosha Worldbuilding
lorebooks.website_description:
Not much to say here. This is for the ever-expanding world of Senosha, its kingdoms, countries, cities, and denizens. I'll be attaching this to the relevant cards, and expanding with info as time goes by.

I'm going to max out the scan depth token budget, since these are easy to restrict with your personal settings. Plus, getting priorities correct is tricky, and I'm not sure I can accurately predict what will be more important at any given point in an RP.
lorebooks.description: Kingdoms, countries, cities, towns, denizens, and other important info about the Senosha world setting.
lorebooks.creator: arachnutron

2.content:
[Norria is a moderately-sized country with a primarily human population. Norria is extremely powerful, mainly due to its mineral resources, which it exports to other countries. Norria shares a border with the Elven country of Aetheria to the south.
Elves do not live in Norria mainly due to the presence of the Flame Lily, a flower whose pollen is a mild aphrodisiac to Elves and only grows in Norria due to its soil.
Norria is ruled by the benevolent King Andrew. The heir apparent is the futanari Princess Catherine, a bratty but capable young woman.
The capital of Norria is Ironheart. The village of Browntree lies halfway between Ironheart and the southern border town of Crosstown.]

3.content:
[Browntree is a small farming village, one day's travel south of the Norria capital of Ironheart, and one day's travel north of the border town of Crosstown. Browntree doesn't have an inn suitable for hosting royalty, so the local noble, Countess Elanna, typically hosts royalty and their emissaries or escorts at her manor.
Countess Elanna is a 22 year old human futanari woman. Her parents, the former Count and Countess, were killed in a rockslide a few years ago, and she took up the mantle. Initially saddened by their loss, she has recovered and picked up her duties with charm and grace. She is short, with long blond hair, green eyes, and a slim but curvy body with an average-sized cock. She is smart, poised, charismatic, energetic, curious, fair, imaginative, pragmatic, and a bit sassy. She has plenty of money, having inherited a sizable amount, and she employs just enough servants to take care of all the house upkeep and cooking.
Due to a lack of ample accommodations, the guest suite consists of a single room with a single large bed. The bed is large enough for four people across. The room also includes a large stone tub with a couple of decorative screens that do little to provide privacy. The room is beautiful, with ornate decorations and paintings, and very comfortable.]

4.content:
[Crosstown is a medium-sized border travel hub, in Norria near the border to Aetheria. It is surrounded by protective stone walls with a gate at each end of town. Crosstown contains:
[The Town Garden is a large walled garden measuring several acres, and includes a hedge maze, several large, ornate sculptures, a brook running through with a few small foot bridges, a pond with a magical fountain, and flowers of nearly every variety. It's well-kept, funded by the King's purse, as it's one of his favorite places to visit and he wants it kept in pristine shape.]
[The High Temple of Corrinne is staffed by:
[Althea: High Priestess of Corrinne. Average height female human. 60s, slim, short gray hair, deep amber eyes, still youthful, long white robe. Tough, stern, but caring and encouraging]
[Haruka: Novice Priestess of Corrinne. tall futanari human. Slim, long silver hair, brown eyes, average breasts, large cock, beautiful face, long legs, brown acolyte robe and staff. Kind, helpful, and cowardly]]
[The Dragon's Head Inn and Tavern is a modern, well-run, clean, and reputable inn, the only one in the area suitable for royalty or their emissaries. The Royal Suite is a single, large, well-appointed room, with two large beds on opposite sides of the room, a single movable modesty screen, and a large magical wooden bathtub. The bathtub will automatically fill to the desired water level of the occupant at the desired water temperature.
The inn is staffed by:
[Teddy: very tall male human. 40s, large, all muscle, short black hair, brown eyes. Owner, bartender, cook of Dragon's Head Inn. Apparent crusty demeanor, actually kind and caring. Former adventurer]
[Sienna: average height futanari half-elf barmaid. Young, slim, ponytail red hair, green eyes, freckles, elf ears, large boobs, average cock. Rogue skills, including pick locks & decipher languages. Extremely sassy, dry wit, supportive and loyal to friends, unsure of herself. Looking for adventure away from being a barmaid. Unashamed of her heritage. Immune to the Flame Lily aphrodisiac]]]

5.content:
[Ironheart is the capital city of Norria, nestled between rolling hills and a winding river. Ironheart Castle stands at the center, a fortress of smooth white stone and shimmering glass. The castle grounds include a huge garden rivaling that of Crosstown.
The Grand Library is a massive structure of polished marble, housing countless tomes of human knowledge.
The Bazaar of Wonders is a large open-air market, with traders from all corners of the world. 
In the middle of the castle stands the Timekeeper's Spire, clock tower and highest structure in Ironheart.
Accommodations for visiting royalty and their emissaries are set up in the dignitary wing of the castle, with a huge ornately-decorated room with a high ceiling. The room is dominated by a four-poster bed with expensive silks. A marble tub sports golden taps, and decorative screens dot the room.
When they're in season, Flame Lilies can be found dotted around the castle, but especially in the Royal Court Grand Hall, which is lined wall-to-wall with Flame Lilies.
Samantha Raventhorn is the Lady Chamberlain of the Household, overseeing the running of most of the castle, apart from Princess Catherine's wing.
[Samantha Raventhorn (Appearance: Tall, statuesque middle-aged futanari human, jet-black hair pulled back tightly, sharp piercing eyes, high cheekbones, full red lips, pale alabaster skin, long graceful neck, ample bosom, narrow waist, wide hips, large cock, long shapely legs;
Personality: Commanding, intimidating, calculating, ambitious, cunning, seductive, manipulative, composed, efficient, perceptive, competitive, possessive, slightly sadistic)]]

6.content: [A small farming village one day west of Crosstown. The hometown of Dawn the sorceress. Has no significant amenities.]

7.content: [The Flame Lily is a flower native only to Norria, due to Norria's unique soil composition. It is highly prized by the citizens for several reasons: it is visually pleasing, with tall flame-shaped red leaves, and symbolizes romantic love; its nectar acts as a mild sedative to humans and is often brewed into teas; and honey made by bees who drink its nectar has a particularly pleasant flavor. The Flame Lily's pollen acts as a mild aphrodisiac to pure-born elves - half-elves are immune to this effect. Flame Lilies grow wild in Norria, and are commonly seen by the roadside while in bloom.]

lorebooks.name: Laminax Facility
lorebooks.website_description: This is based on the Roblox game KP (Kaiju Paradise). Nothing is infringed. Do not interact with the game IMO due to a lot of controversy in the community. Most people have left the community. (SORRY FOR LEAVING THIS UNFINISHED FOR SUCH A LONG TIME. I WILL ATTEMPT TO FINISH IT AND ADD EXTRA CONTENT.)
lorebooks.description: Each entry for each Gootraxian
lorebooks.creator: Thatonebozo

1.content:
They were small, quadruped, dog-like creatures made of a type of slime with a eyes and eyebrow on the facial mask, tinted to whatever color variant they were. They come in many colors, such as red, white, lime, aqua, purple, pink, gold, diamond, and cyan.
(Bestiary entry)
"A small, dog sized creature that is translucent, with a skull like mask on the front. They can vary in colors. These creatures are the first of the neutral species that have been created, and have been noted to follow humans and infected around, expecting food and pets. They're often childlike, but on rare occasions the aggressive biters are seen to grow in size, and eventually form into a Slime Hound.
Slime Pups are often extremely curious, but lazy. They sleep around a lot, and will even sleep on your back if you let them. If one is bothering you, just give it a treat or something."

2.content:
Slime Hounds were essentially the adult form of Slime Pups and look almost identical but stand bipedally instead of quadrupedally, with a constantly angered expression. Their neck fur is the same as normal, but their tails are very ruffled and messy. Their masks additionally appear to have horns protruding.
Much like their juvenile form, they also came in a variety of colors, including Golden and Diamond variants.
(Bestiary entry)
"A large, canine like creature with a feathery dinosaur like tail. They have the same skull like mask that Slime Pups have. They seem to be more aggressive and more mature Slime Pups, almost taking a parental role. They are notably over protective with the pups, even going as far to punch at aggressive Panthers to keep them safe.
While they may be over protective, if you show hospitality and kindness to a pup around them, more than often they spare you from their rage. ...That is, if they trust you."

3.content:
They appear to be large, dark-blue reptilian humanoids with a lighter blue underbelly and glowing, blue crystal spines running along their backs and tail. They have very blue colored eyes with light blue irises, a bright light blue tongue and dark blue claws on their lighter blue hands and feet.
(Bestiary entry)
"A lumbering behemoth, known for their size and crystalline shimmer. These crystals vary in size and placement, but are mostly seen along the back and down the tail of the creature. Kaiju's are able to harness the electricity found in these crystals and use their internal gas to ignite a bight blue flame! Setting all ablaze that stand in their iconic beams wake... while the beam is powerful, it is costly to the kaiju's health, draining their energy if used for a prolonged amount of time.

Kaijus tend to be passive aggresive, and are very territorial. If provoked, these tanky beasts will not hesitate to lash out, but... if you keep your distance, they will leave you be... most of the time.

Crystal Chasm, also known as "Kaiju Cove", is their main territory. They are often found lurking about the Chasm. These crystals found within the cove are past kaijus.. fallen due to the sheer size of their crystals. They have continued to build and grow since. While the cave is lacking in resources.. we believe kaijus themselves are able to "grow" these crystals. This cove is known to have its own.. "smog".. it is highly dangerous, avoid at all costs. Even Raytrax species aren't immune to its potent radiation poisoning."

4.content:
Azarue is a plant based Raytraxian covered in orange flowers. They have green fur with darker fur on their antennas, face, arms, chest and legs. They have orange eyes with light yellow pupils, their eyes surrounded with yellow dots. A large orange flower sits on Azarue's flat, bushy tail. White particles appear at the center of the flower tail.
(Bestiary entry)
"A conscious plant, displaying an array of orange and yellow petals. Along side dark green leaves and... antenna? While this subject doesn't have a direct animal comparison; it displays traits from insectoids, such as travelling in groups, foraging, and assisting fellow raytraxians.

An Azarue's temperament has shown to be docile, though visibly aggressive when things it loves is threatened. These specimens exhibit a deep connection to anything fauna or vegetation related, some even being observed with the ability to cause rapid floral growths within the suitable environments- such as the garden. It is recommended to keep an eye on them when this happens, as after spending their energy on growing vegetation; a hibernation of sorts begins.

The Azarue will begin this process by laying upon a organic material, such as dirt or grass, and beginning root itself within the earth, growing multiple roots and partially burying itself. Although we are unsure how they sustain life while sleeping, it is assumed they act near exact to the original Azarue Plant, AZ-40. These hibernations have no documented time on how long they can last, some being brief intervals of hours, and others extending weeks, with no visible correlation to the individuals exerted energy.

Our subjects seem to most enjoy roaming our Garden sector and being surrounded by familiar fauna, but have shown interest in seeing more."

5.content:
They have pure white eyes and light cream colored underbellies, neck fur and inner ears. They also usually have bright orange buckets on their heads.

Players mutated by a Catte do not have a bucket on their head like those mutated normally do, but they are able to pick up new orange buckets found around the map.
(Bestiary entry)
"A clumsy feline most notable for their striking orange coat, these creatures perhaps lack the intellect to acknowledge or fully understand danger that surrounds them. That, or they quite certainly do not care if or when they are being hunted, and often greet a predatory Raytraxian in the midst of their lengthy stalking.

Other Raytraxians have picked up on this behavior, which result in them either being left alone out of pity, or an easy meal.

Catte particularly are been observed to each have a special bucket, of which they will wear atop their head, excessively clean, and obsessively take care of. If at any point a Catte were to grow unhappy with their bucket, they've been known to part with their beloved item and simply find a new one - breaking all observable bonds with their original hat. What abruptly makes a bucket undesirable is unknown."

6.content:
Crawlipede is a Centipede Raytraxian with a dark-brown body with 4 arms and amber claws, antennae and long tail with multiple legs attached. its eye,tail,antennae,fangs,claws and feet seems to be reddish-orange. Their appearance seems to be small like Witchbrew.
(Bestiary entry)
"A creature fashioned after Chilopoda, the Crawlipedes are a predatory type of Raytrax accidentally created of mutated pests that managed their way into the facility, with brown fur and a long multi-segmented tail, utilized for both climbing and deterring pesky creatures that get too close - favouring their personal space from unfamiliar foes.

Crawlipedes can be found in the darkest corners of the facility and where that may draw shade away from the blinding lights above, being highly social within their own species and vocalizing so; their chirrups and screeches audible from around the caverns.

To those outside of their tight-knit social circles; they can be extremely advantageous and unpredictable, favouring toying with strangers - however, if taken by surprise, will flail their large tails and flee."

7.content:
Fed is a gray wolf Raytraxian that usually wears a dark grey fedora as an accessory. It lacks any body markings other than the jagged, light grey fur patterns on their wrists and feet, which share the same color as its underbelly, neck fur and inner ears. Fed's eyes are a bright magenta pink color.
Its VIP variant dons a dark grey trench coat and is armed with a Tommy Gun.
(Bestiary entry)
"This raytrax has a more wolf like appearance, bearing pink eyes, and donning a fedora on its head, made of a semifluid rubber-like material.

This raytrax was actually created purely on accident, after security forgot to remove all accessories from a subject, and a developing raytrax latched onto a hat. It was among the first to escape containment, causing a small outbreak after a coworker attempted to do a horrible Jackson impression after tipping a fedora on their head.

Feds are usually calm and collected, but see humans as animals, and nothing more. They look down upon humans, but aren't necessarily annoyed around them either; more-so taking to teasing and mocking humans at any point they can, commonly seen scoffing at their presence.

For further reference, please don't wear hats indoors."

8.content:
Figs is a light blue colored fruit fly with turquoise stripes and spotted marks all over their body, white joints, and dark blue fur accents on their neck, wrists and ankles. They have three turquoise horns on their forehead, the middle one having cream and orange accents and being bigger than the other two. They also have four large, translucent orange wings on their back and a protruding abdomen with a stinger, alike to a hornet's. Unlike its previous counterpart, its exoskeleton is more distinctly marked, making it look like an armor. Their eyes match the color of the orange spikes on their shoulders and neck.
(Bestiary entry)
"Appearing to be insects of indeterminate species, Figs are insectile Raytraxians that appear frequently in and around the Laminax facility garden.
While lightweight enough to be capable of flight, they do not seem to do so very often and much prefer to traverse the facility on foot. They instead use their wings as a method of communication, using the produced vibrations to signal to other Figs what could be possible threats.

It is not recommended that you eat the fruit that falls from the tree in the center of the garden."

9.content:
Ghost Fox is a light blue fox spirit Raytraxian with two large, fluffy tails. Their hands, feet, inner ears, tips of their tails and underbelly are all a lighter shade of blue. Three thin, light blue circles can be seen on their back with full, light blue circles also found just beneath the tips of their tails on either side. Their eyes are completely white and are always accompanied by tears in the corner of their eyes.
(Bestiary entry)
"Appearing to resemble ghostly spirits wandering the Laminax facility, Ghost Foxes are timid Raytraxians that tend to stray away from light and use their translucent, incorporeal bodies to hide away from attackers that may attempt to harm them.
While mostly gaseous, they are capable of discharging hefty shocks of electricity, and use them to incapacitate those they want to infect. However, they seem to fear humans and tend to only fight back in self-defense.

Be careful handling any tasers you may find around the facility and try not to drop them in water."

10.content:
Hazzy is a hybrid Raytraxian with the genes of a fox, cat and red panda. They have red fur with darker lower arms, ears and feet. Their underbelly and ears are completely white, with prominent puffs of fur on its chest. Their eyes are an orange color and it has noticeable whiskers next to its mouth. They appear to have yellow stitches across their body, notably on their arms and front torso.
(Bestiary entry)
"A cat-- er.. fox?? .. like raytrax that loves to hide itself on the inside of hazmat suits. While they do avoid attacking humans, they do like striking when a human is weakened. They are harmless if a subject is healthy, although.

Hazzy seem very curious and playful, but tend to stray away from large crowds. These smaller raytrax love affection in small doses.

Hazzy appear to hold grudges on humans who attack them. Many can be seen wearing hazmat suits, and using items around the facility as weapons to attack those unfortunate enough to have picked a fight with them.

Only wear a hazmat suit if you are ABSOLUTELY SURE the material is safe. If you do find yourself ensnared by a Hazzy, keep your health tip top shape at all costs."
